Arpia REST API documentation version v1

http://api-arpia-debug.azurewebsites.net/arpia-webapi/{version}

  • version: required (v1)

Home

Welcome to the Arpia API documentation. The Arpia API allow you to connect Arpia web application for that it can have functionalities. The Arpia API is stable & secure because use Json Web Token.

Copyright

All development rights are reserved by Nativapps Inc.

Abbreviations

This resource contains all the necessary operations for the management of the abbreviations, among these operations we will have HTTP methods to get all the elements, to get a single element, to add new elements to the resource, to edit the existing elements and finally to eliminate.

/abbreviations get post

get

Get a list of all abbreviations.

post

Add a new abbreviation.

get /abbreviations

Get a list of all abbreviations.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

HTTP status code 200

Successfull request.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: array of Abbreviation

Items: Abbreviation

  • id: (number)
  • shortText: required (string - maxLength: 5)
  • content: required (string - maxLength: 200)

Example:

[
  {
    "id": 1,
    "shortText": "CRA",
    "content": "CRA {0} #{1}-{2}"
  },
  {
    "id": 2,
    "shortText": "CLL",
    "content": "CLL {0} #{1}-{2}"
  }
]

HTTP status code 404

The origin server did not find a current representation for the target resource or is not willing to disclose that one exists.

Resource not found, specifically occurs when a route is poorly specified, make sure that the resource ID are needing is correct.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 404,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 500

The server encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request.

If an error occurred on the server, the required operation could not be performed, sorry.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 500,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

Secured by jwt

Headers

  • Authorization: required (string)

    Used to send a valid JWT access token. In the Authorization header using the Bearer schema.

    Example:

    Bearer eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJzdWIiOiIxMjM0NTY3ODkwIiwibmFtZSI6IkpvaG4gRG9lIiwiYWRtaW4iOnRydWV9.TJVA95OrM7E2cBab30RMHrHDcEfxjoYZgeFONFh7HgQ

post /abbreviations

Add a new abbreviation.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • id: (number)
  • shortText: required (string - maxLength: 5)
  • content: required (string - maxLength: 200)

Example:

{
  "shortText": "CRA",
  "content": "CRA {0} #{1}-{2}"
}

HTTP status code 201

It has created a new abbreviation.

Headers

  • Location: required (string)

    Location where you can get the information of the created abbreviation.

    Example:

    http://api.arpia.com/v1/abbreviations/1

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • id: (number)
  • shortText: required (string - maxLength: 5)
  • content: required (string - maxLength: 200)

HTTP status code 400

The server cannot or will not process the request due to something that is perceived to be a client error (e.g., malformed request syntax, invalid request message framing, or deceptive request routing).

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 400,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 404

The origin server did not find a current representation for the target resource or is not willing to disclose that one exists.

Resource not found, specifically occurs when a route is poorly specified, make sure that the resource ID are needing is correct.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 404,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 500

The server encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request.

If an error occurred on the server, the required operation could not be performed, sorry.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 500,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

Secured by jwt

Headers

  • Authorization: required (string)

    Used to send a valid JWT access token. In the Authorization header using the Bearer schema.

    Example:

    Bearer eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJzdWIiOiIxMjM0NTY3ODkwIiwibmFtZSI6IkpvaG4gRG9lIiwiYWRtaW4iOnRydWV9.TJVA95OrM7E2cBab30RMHrHDcEfxjoYZgeFONFh7HgQ

/abbreviations/{id} get put delete

A specific abbreviation, a item of the abbreviations list.

get

Get information about a abbreviation.

put

Update information about the specific abbreviation.

delete

Remove a specific abbreviation.

get /abbreviations/{id}

Get information about a abbreviation.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • id: required (number)

    Abbreviation ID is required.

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

HTTP status code 200

Successfull request.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • id: (number)
  • shortText: required (string - maxLength: 5)
  • content: required (string - maxLength: 200)

Example:

{
  "id": 1,
  "shortText": "CRA",
  "content": "CRA {0} #{1}-{2}"
}

HTTP status code 400

The server cannot or will not process the request due to something that is perceived to be a client error (e.g., malformed request syntax, invalid request message framing, or deceptive request routing).

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{

  "statusCode": 400,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 404

The origin server did not find a current representation for the target resource or is not willing to disclose that one exists.

Resource not found, specifically occurs when a route is poorly specified, make sure that the resource ID are needing is correct.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

put /abbreviations/{id}

Update information about the specific abbreviation.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • id: required (number)

    Abbreviation ID is required.

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • id: (number)
  • shortText: required (string - maxLength: 5)
  • content: required (string - maxLength: 200)

HTTP status code 200

It has updated a abbreviation.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • id: (number)
  • shortText: required (string - maxLength: 5)
  • content: required (string - maxLength: 200)

HTTP status code 400

The server cannot or will not process the request due to something that is perceived to be a client error (e.g., malformed request syntax, invalid request message framing, or deceptive request routing).

Media type: application/json

    }

delete /abbreviations/{id}

Remove a specific abbreviation.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • id: required (number)

    Abbreviation ID is required.

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

Successfull request.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • id: (number)
  • shortText: required (string - maxLength: 5)
  • content: required (string - maxLength: 200)

/abbreviations/st/{shortText} get

get

Get an abbreviation from the given short text.

get /abbreviations/st/{shortText}

Get an abbreviation from the given short text.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • shortText: required (string)

    The short text of an abbreviation.

    Example:

    CLL

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

HTTP status code 200

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • id: (number)
  • shortText: required (string - maxLength: 5)
  • content: required (string - maxLength: 200)

Example:

{
  "id": 1,
  "shortText": "CRA",
  "content": "CRA {0} #{1}-{2}"
}

HTTP status code 400

The server cannot or will not process the request due to something that is perceived to be a client error (e.g., malformed request syntax, invalid request message framing, or deceptive request routing).

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

  • documentation: required (string)

  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

Accounts

This resource contains all the methods necessary to manage a user account within the Arpia platform.

/accounts get

get

Get a user information from the given username.

get /accounts

Get a user information from the given username.

  • Request
  • Response

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

Query Parameters

  • q: required (string)

    The username value

HTTP status code 200

Successfull request.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • id: required (number)
  • displayName: required (string)
  • email: required (string)
  • username: (string)
  • urlPic: (string)

Example:

{
  "id": 1,
  "displayName": "Ali Connors",
  "email": "aliconnors@example.com",
  "username": "ali_connors",
  "urlPic": "http://static.arpia.com/imgs/img_001.jpg"
}

HTTP status code 400

The server cannot or will not process the request due to something that is perceived to be a client error (e.g., malformed request syntax, invalid request message framing, or deceptive request routing).

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 400,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 401

The request has not been applied because it lacks valid authentication credentials for the target resource.

The server generating a 401 response MUST send a WWW-Authenticate header field containing at least one challenge applicable to the target resource.

If the request included authentication credentials, then the 401 response indicates that authorization has been refused for those credentials. The user agent MAY repeat the request with a new or replaced Authorization header field. If the 401 response contains the same challenge as the prior response, and the user agent has already attempted authentication at least once, then the user agent SHOULD present the enclosed representation to the user, since it usually contains relevant diagnostic information.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 401,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 404

The origin server did not find a current representation for the target resource or is not willing to disclose that one exists.

Resource not found, specifically occurs when a route is poorly specified, make sure that the resource ID are needing is correct.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 404,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 500

The server encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request.

If an error occurred on the server, the required operation could not be performed, sorry.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

/accounts/authenticate post

post

This endpoint is used to log in with a username and password.

post /accounts/authenticate

This endpoint is used to log in with a username and password.

  • Request
  • Response

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • username: required (string)
  • password: required (string)

Example:

{
  "username": "admin",
  "password": "admin"
}

HTTP status code 200

Successfull request.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • token: required (string)
  • type: required (string)

Example:

{
  "token": "eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJzdWIiOiIxMjM0NTY3ODkwIiwibmFtZSI6IkpvaG4gRG9lIiwiYWRtaW4iOnRydWV9.TJVA95OrM7E2cBab30RMHrHDcEfxjoYZgeFONFh7HgQ",
  "type": "JWT"
}

HTTP status code 400

The server cannot or will not process the request due to something that is perceived to be a client error (e.g., malformed request syntax, invalid request message framing, or deceptive request routing).

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 400,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 401

The request has not been applied because it lacks valid authentication credentials for the target resource.

The server generating a 401 response MUST send a WWW-Authenticate header field containing at least one challenge applicable to the target resource.

If the request included authentication credentials, then the 401 response indicates that authorization has been refused for those credentials. The user agent MAY repeat the request with a new or replaced Authorization header field. If the 401 response contains the same challenge as the prior response, and the user agent has already attempted authentication at least once, then the user agent SHOULD present the enclosed representation to the user, since it usually contains relevant diagnostic information.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 401,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 404

The origin server did not find a current representation for the target resource or is not willing to disclose that one exists.

Resource not found, specifically occurs when a route is poorly specified, make sure that the resource ID are needing is correct.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 404,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 500

The server encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request.

If an error occurred on the server, the required operation could not be performed, sorry.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 500,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

/accounts/refresh post

post

This endpoint serves to update a token through an old token.

post /accounts/refresh

This endpoint serves to update a token through an old token.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

HTTP status code 200

Successfull request.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • token: required (string)
  • type: required (string)

Example:

{
  "token": "eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJzdWIiOiIxMjM0NTY3ODkwIiwibmFtZSI6IkpvaG4gRG9lIiwiYWRtaW4iOnRydWV9.TJVA95OrM7E2cBab30RMHrHDcEfxjoYZgeFONFh7HgQ",
  "type": "JWT"
}

HTTP status code 400

The server cannot or will not process the request due to something that is perceived to be a client error (e.g., malformed request syntax, invalid request message framing, or deceptive request routing).

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 400,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 401

The request has not been applied because it lacks valid authentication credentials for the target resource.

The server generating a 401 response MUST send a WWW-Authenticate header field containing at least one challenge applicable to the target resource.

If the request included authentication credentials, then the 401 response indicates that authorization has been refused for those credentials. The user agent MAY repeat the request with a new or replaced Authorization header field. If the 401 response contains the same challenge as the prior response, and the user agent has already attempted authentication at least once, then the user agent SHOULD present the enclosed representation to the user, since it usually contains relevant diagnostic information.

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

Headers

  • Authorization: required (string)

    Used to send a valid JWT access token. In the Authorization header using the Bearer schema.

    Example:

    Bearer eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJzdWIiOiIxMjM0NTY3ODkwIiwibmFtZSI6IkpvaG4gRG9lIiwiYWRtaW4iOnRydWV9.TJVA95OrM7E2cBab30RMHrHDcEfxjoYZgeFONFh7HgQ

Actions

This resource contains all the necessary operations for the management of the actions, among these operations we will have HTTP methods to get all the elements, to get a single element, to add new elements to the resource, to edit the existing elements and finally to eliminate.

/actions get post

get

Get a list of all actions.

post

Add a new action.

get /actions

Get a list of all actions.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

Query Parameters

  • messengerId: (number)

    The messenger ID

    Example:

    1

HTTP status code 200

Successfull request.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: array of Action

Items: Action

  • id: (number)
  • title: required (string)
  • description: required (string)
  • registerDate: (datetime)

Example:

[
  {
    "id": 1,
    "title": "Title",
    "description": "This is a description.",
    "registerDate": "2017-04-14T10:49:00.000Z"
  },
  {
    "id": 2,
    "title": "The second title",
    "description": "This is a second description.",
    "registerDate": "2017-04-16T21:53:00.000Z"
  }
]

HTTP status code 404

The origin server did not find a current representation for the target resource or is not willing to disclose that one exists.

Resource not found, specifically occurs when a route is poorly specified, make sure that the resource ID are needing is correct.

    }

{
  "title": "Title",
  "description": "This is a description."
}

HTTP status code 201

It has created a new action.

Headers

  • Location: required (string)

    Location where you can get the information of the created action.

    Example:

    http://api.arpia.com/v1/actions/1

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • id: (number)
  • title: required (string)
  • description: required (string)
  • registerDate: (datetime)

/actions/{id} get put delete

A specific action, a item of the actions list.

get

Get information about a action.

put

Update information about the specific action.

delete

Remove a specific action.

get /actions/{id}

Get information about a action.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • id: required (number)

    Action ID is required.

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

Query Parameters

  • messengerId: required (number)

    The messenger ID

    Example:

    1

  • id: (number)

  • id: (number)

Bases

This resource contains all the necessary operations for the management of the bases, among these operations we will have HTTP methods to get all the elements, to get a single element, to add new elements to the resource, to edit the existing elements and finally to eliminate.

/bases get post

get

Get a list of all bases.

post

Register a delivery or return of the bases.

The amount of bases to be delivered can be negative or positive, if it is negative then it is taken as a return of bases and if it is positive then it is taken as a delivery of bases.

get /bases

Get a list of all bases.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

Query Parameters

  • messengerId: required (number)

    Provide the messenger ID if you need to obtain the messenger bases.

  • debt: required (boolean)

    True, if you need to get the bases that are in debt.

  • start: (number - default: 0 - minimum: 0)

    Specify the index of first element to get

    Example:

    10
  • size: (number - minimum: 10 - maximum: 200)

    Specify the amount of items that will be retrieved per request

    Example:

    150

HTTP status code 200

Successfull request.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • items: required (array of BaseResponse)

    Items: BaseResponse

    • id: required (number)
    • baseDelivery: required (integer)
    • baseReturn: required (integer)
    • amount: required (number)
    • registerDate: required (datetime)
    • messenger: required (object)
      • identification: required (string)
      • name: required (string)
      • lastName: required (string)
      • birthday: required (datetime)
    • operation: required (object)
      • id: required (number)
      • name: required (string)
    • records: required (array of BaseRecord)

      Items: BaseRecord

      • userId: required (number)
      • userDisplayName: required (string)
      • concept: required (one of DELIVERY, RETURN)
      • count: required (integer)
      • registerDate: required (datetime)
  • total: required (integer)

HTTP status code 404

The origin server did not find a current representation for the target resource or is not willing to disclose that one exists.

Resource not found, specifically occurs when a route is poorly specified, make sure that the resource ID are needing is correct.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 404,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 500

The server encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request.

If an error occurred on the server, the required operation could not be performed, sorry.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 500,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

Secured by jwt

Headers

  • Authorization: required (string)

    Used to send a valid JWT access token. In the Authorization header using the Bearer schema.

    Example:

    Bearer eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJzdWIiOiIxMjM0NTY3ODkwIiwibmFtZSI6IkpvaG4gRG9lIiwiYWRtaW4iOnRydWV9.TJVA95OrM7E2cBab30RMHrHDcEfxjoYZgeFONFh7HgQ

post /bases

Register a delivery or return of the bases.

The amount of bases to be delivered can be negative or positive, if it is negative then it is taken as a return of bases and if it is positive then it is taken as a delivery of bases.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • messenger: required (number)
  • operation: required (number)
  • count: required (integer)

HTTP status code 201

It has created a new basis.

Headers

  • Location: required (string)

    Location where you can get the information of the created basis.

    Example:

    http://api.arpia.com/v1/bases/1

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • id: required (number)
  • baseDelivery: required (integer)
  • baseReturn: required (integer)
  • amount: required (number)
  • registerDate: required (datetime)
  • messenger: required (object)
    • identification: required (string)
    • name: required (string)
    • lastName: required (string)
    • birthday: required (datetime)
  • operation: required (object)
    • id: required (number)
    • name: required (string)
  • records: required (array of BaseRecord)

    Items: BaseRecord

    • userId: required (number)
    • userDisplayName: required (string)
    • concept: required (one of DELIVERY, RETURN)
    • count: required (integer)
    • registerDate: required (datetime)

HTTP status code 400

The server cannot or will not process the request due to something that is perceived to be a client error (e.g., malformed request syntax, invalid request message framing, or deceptive request routing).

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 400,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 404

Resource not found, specifically occurs when a route is poorly specified, make sure that the resource ID are needing is correct.

  • Authorization: required (string)

    Used to send a valid JWT access token. In the Authorization header using the Bearer schema.

    Example:

    Bearer eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJzdWIiOiIxMjM0NTY3ODkwIiwibmFtZSI6IkpvaG4gRG9lIiwiYWRtaW4iOnRydWV9.TJVA95OrM7E2cBab30RMHrHDcEfxjoYZgeFONFh7HgQ

/bases/{id} get post

A specific base, a item of the bases list.

get

Get information about a base.

post

Register a delivery or return of the bases.

The amount of bases to be delivered can be negative or positive, if it is negative then it is taken as a return of bases and if it is positive then it is taken as a delivery of bases.

get /bases/{id}

Get information about a base.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • id: required (number)

    Base ID is required.

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

HTTP status code 200

Successfull request.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • id: required (number)
  • baseDelivery: required (integer)
  • baseReturn: required (integer)
  • amount: required (number)
  • registerDate: required (datetime)
  • messenger: required (object)
    • identification: required (string)
    • name: required (string)
    • lastName: required (string)
    • birthday: required (datetime)
  • operation: required (object)
    • id: required (number)
    • name: required (string)
  • records: required (array of BaseRecord)

    Items: BaseRecord

    • userId: required (number)
    • userDisplayName: required (string)
    • concept: required (one of DELIVERY, RETURN)
    • count: required (integer)
    • registerDate: required (datetime)

Birthdays

This resource contains the operation to get all the customers that are particulars and that are celebrating their birthday soonly.

/birthdays get

get

Get a list of all particulars with a soon birthday.

get /birthdays

Get a list of all particulars with a soon birthday.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

Query Parameters

  • to: required (string)

    Specify the date wanted to filter the birthdays.

    Example:

    TODAY
  • start: (number - default: 0 - minimum: 0)

    Specify the index of first element to get

    Example:

    10
  • size: (number - minimum: 10 - maximum: 200)

    Specify the amount of items that will be retrieved per request

    Example:

    150

HTTP status code 200

Successfull request.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • items: required (array of Customer)

    Items: Customer

    • id: required (number)
    • observations: (string)
    • displayName: required (string)
    • identification: required (string)
    • type: required (one of PARTICULAR, ESTABLISHMENT)
    • banned: required (boolean)
  • total: required (number)

Example:

{
  "items": [
    {
      "id": 1,
      "displayName": "Ali Connors",
      "identification": "123456789",
      "type": "PARTICULAR",
      "banned": false
    },
    {
      "id": 2,
      "displayName": "Nativapps Inc",
      "identification": "987654321",
      "type": "ESTABLISHMENT",
      "banned": true,
      "observations": "This is a observations."
    }
  ],
  "total": 2
}

HTTP status code 404

The origin server did not find a current representation for the target resource or is not willing to disclose that one exists.

Resource not found, specifically occurs when a route is poorly specified, make sure that the resource ID are needing is correct.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 404,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

The server encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request.

    Bearer eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJzdWIiOiIxMjM0NTY3ODkwIiwibmFtZSI6IkpvaG4gRG9lIiwiYWRtaW4iOnRydWV9.TJVA95OrM7E2cBab30RMHrHDcEfxjoYZgeFONFh7HgQ

Cash

This resource contains all the necessary operations for the management of the cash, among these operations we will have HTTP methods to get all the elements, to get a single element and to add new elements to the resource.

/cash get post

get

Get a list of all cash.

post

Add a new cash.

get /cash

Get a list of all cash.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

Query Parameters

  • start: (number - default: 0 - minimum: 0)

    Specify the index of first element to get

    Example:

    10
  • size: (number - minimum: 10 - maximum: 200)

    Specify the amount of items that will be retrieved per request

    Example:

    150

HTTP status code 200

Successfull request.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • items: required (array of CashResponse)

    Items: CashResponse

    • amount: required (number)
    • reason: required (string)
    • registerType: required (one of IN, OUT)
    • id: (number)
    • operation: required (object)
      • id: (number)
      • name: required (string)
      • alias: required (string)
      • description: (string)
      • imageUrl: (string)
      • adminUser: (object)
        • id: required (number)
        • username: (string)
        • email: required (string)
        • displayName: required (string)
    • user: required (object)
      • id: required (number)
      • displayName: required (string)
      • email: required (string)
      • username: (string)
      • urlPic: (string)
    • registerDate: required (datetime)
  • total: required (number)

Example:

{
  "items": [
    {
      "id": 1,
      "operation": {
        "id": 1,
        "name": "Operation 411",
        "alias": "411"
      },
      "user": {
        "id": 1,
        "displayName": "Ali Connors",
        "email": "aliconnors@example.com",
        "username": "ali_connors",
        "urlPic": "http://static.arpia.com/imgs/img_001.jpg"
      },
      "amount": 50000,
      "reason": "Domicile payment",
      "registerType": "IN",
      "registerDate": "2017-04-01T08:00:00.000Z"
    },
    {
      "id": 2,
      "operation": {
        "id": 1,
        "name": "Operation 411",
        "alias": "411"
      },
      "user": {
        "id": 2,
        "displayName": "Peter Carlsson",
        "email": "petercarlsson@example.com",
        "username": "peter_carlsson",
        "urlPic": "http://static.arpia.com/imgs/img_002.jpg"
      },
      "amount": 20000,
      "reason": "Stationery expenses",
      "registerType": "OUT",
      "registerDate": "2017-04-01T08:00:00.000Z"
    }
  ],
  "total": 10
}

The origin server did not find a current representation for the target resource or is not willing to disclose that one exists.

Resource not found, specifically occurs when a route is poorly specified, make sure that the resource ID are needing is correct.

    • message: required (string)

  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."

    Used to send a valid JWT access token. In the Authorization header using the Bearer schema.

    Example:

    Bearer eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJzdWIiOiIxMjM0NTY3ODkwIiwibmFtZSI6IkpvaG4gRG9lIiwiYWRtaW4iOnRydWV9.TJVA95OrM7E2cBab30RMHrHDcEfxjoYZgeFONFh7HgQ

post /cash

Add a new cash.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • amount: required (number)
  • reason: required (string)
  • registerType: required (one of IN, OUT)
  • operation: required (number)

Example:

{
  "operation": 1,
  "amount": 50000,
  "reason": "Domicile payment",
  "registerType": "IN"
}

HTTP status code 201

It has created a new cash.

Headers

  • Location: required (string)

    Location where you can get the information of the created cash.

    Example:

    http://api.arpia.com/v1/cash/1

Type: object

Properties
  • amount: required (number)
  • reason: required (string)
  • registerType: required (one of IN, OUT)

    Used to send a valid JWT access token. In the Authorization header using the Bearer schema.

    Example:

    Bearer eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJzdWIiOiIxMjM0NTY3ODkwIiwibmFtZSI6IkpvaG4gRG9lIiwiYWRtaW4iOnRydWV9.TJVA95OrM7E2cBab30RMHrHDcEfxjoYZgeFONFh7HgQ

/cash/{id} get

get

Get information about a cash register.

get /cash/{id}

Get information about a cash register.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • id: required (string)

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

HTTP status code 200

Successfull request.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • amount: required (number)
  • reason: required (string)
  • registerType: required (one of IN, OUT)
  • id: (number)
  • operation: required (object)
    • id: (number)
    • name: required (string)
    • alias: required (string)
    • description: (string)
    • imageUrl: (string)
    • adminUser: (object)
      • id: required (number)
      • username: (string)
      • email: required (string)
      • displayName: required (string)
  • user: required (object)
    • id: required (number)
    • displayName: required (string)
    • email: required (string)
    • username: (string)
    • urlPic: (string)
  • registerDate: required (datetime)

Example:

{
  "id": 1,
  "operation": {
    "id": 1,
    "name": "Operation 411",
    "alias": "411"
  },
  "user": {
    "id": 1,
    "displayName": "Ali Connors",
    "email": "aliconnors@example.com",
    "username": "ali_connors",
    "urlPic": "http://static.arpia.com/imgs/img_001.jpg"
  },
  "amount": 50000,
  "reason": "Domicile payment",
  "registerType": "IN",
  "registerDate": "2017-04-01T08:00:00.000Z"
}

HTTP status code 400

The server cannot or will not process the request due to something that is perceived to be a client error (e.g., malformed request syntax, invalid request message framing, or deceptive request routing).

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 400,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 404

The origin server did not find a current representation for the target resource or is not willing to disclose that one exists.

Resource not found, specifically occurs when a route is poorly specified, make sure that the resource ID are needing is correct.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 404,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 500

The server encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request.

If an error occurred on the server, the required operation could not be performed, sorry.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 500,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

Secured by jwt

Headers

  • Authorization: required (string)

    Used to send a valid JWT access token. In the Authorization header using the Bearer schema.

    Example:

    Bearer eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJzdWIiOiIxMjM0NTY3ODkwIiwibmFtZSI6IkpvaG4gRG9lIiwiYWRtaW4iOnRydWV9.TJVA95OrM7E2cBab30RMHrHDcEfxjoYZgeFONFh7HgQ

/cash/tallying get post

This resource contains all the necessary operations for the management of the tallying, among these operations we will have HTTP methods to get all the elements, to get a single element, to add new elements to the resource, to edit the existing elements and finally to eliminate.

get

Get a list of all tallying.

post

Add a new tallying.

get /cash/tallying

Get a list of all tallying.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

Query Parameters

  • start: (number - default: 0 - minimum: 0)

    Specify the index of first element to get

    Example:

    10
  • size: (number - minimum: 10 - maximum: 200)

    Specify the amount of items that will be retrieved per request

    Example:

    150
  • from: (date-only)

    Specifies the start date of the filter.

    Example:

    2015-07-30
  • to: (date-only)

    Specifies the end date of the filter.

    Example:

    2017-12-31

HTTP status code 200

Successfull request.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • items: required (array of CashTallyingResponse)

    Items: CashTallyingResponse

    • id: required (number)
    • user: required (object)
      • id: required (number)
      • displayName: required (string)
      • email: required (string)
      • username: (string)
      • urlPic: (string)
    • registerDate: required (datetime)
    • cashRegisters: required (array of CashRegisterResponse)

      Items: CashRegisterResponse

      • count: required (integer)
      • value: required (number)
      • cashType: required (one of PAPER, COIN)
      • total: required (number)
    • settlement: required (object)
      • produced: required (number)
      • credits: required (number)
      • advances: required (number)
      • expenses: required (number)
      • total: required (number)
    • observations: required (string)
    • totalPapers: required (number)
    • totalCoins: required (number)
    • totalCash: required (number)
    • imbalance: required (number)
  • total: required (integer)

Example:

{
  "items": [
    {
      "id": 1,
      "user": {
        "id": 1,
        "displayName": "Ali Connors",
        "email": "aliconnors@example.com",
        "username": "ali_connors",
        "urlPic": "http://static.arpia.com/imgs/img_001.jpg"
      },
      "registerDate": "2017-04-02T08:00:00.000Z",
      "cashRegisters": [
        {
          "count": 10,
          "value": 500,
          "cashType": "COIN",
          "total": 5000
        },
        {
          "count": 10,
          "value": 2000,
          "cashType": "PAPER",
          "total": 20000
        }
      ],
      "settlement": {
        "produced": 45000,
        "credits": 0,
        "advances": 10000,
        "expenses": 10000,
        "total": 25000
      },
      "observations": "closed without problems",
      "totalPapers": 20000,
      "totalCoins": 5000,
      "totalCash": 25000,
      "imbalance": 0
    },
    {
      "id": 2,
      "user": {
        "id": 2,
        "displayName": "Peter Carlsson",
        "email": "petercarlsson@example.com",
        "username": "peter_carlsson",
        "urlPic": "http://static.arpia.com/imgs/img_002.jpg"
      },
      "registerDate": "2017-04-01T08:00:00.000Z",
      "cashRegisters": [
        {
          "count": 10,
          "value": 200,
          "cashType": "COIN",
          "total": 2000
        },
        {
          "count": 10,
          "value": 10000,
          "cashType": "PAPER",
          "total": 100000
        }
      ],
      "settlement": {
        "produced": 100000,
        "credits": 0,
        "advances": 10000,
        "expenses": 10000,
        "total": 80000
      },
      "observations": "closed without problems",
      "totalPapers": 100000,
      "totalCoins": 2000,
      "totalCash": 102000,
      "imbalance": 22000
    }
  ],
  "total": 10
}

HTTP status code 404

The origin server did not find a current representation for the target resource or is not willing to disclose that one exists.

Resource not found, specifically occurs when a route is poorly specified, make sure that the resource ID are needing is correct.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 404,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 500

The server encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request.

If an error occurred on the server, the required operation could not be performed, sorry.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 500,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

Secured by jwt

Headers

  • Authorization: required (string)

    Used to send a valid JWT access token. In the Authorization header using the Bearer schema.

    Example:

    Bearer eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJzdWIiOiIxMjM0NTY3ODkwIiwibmFtZSI6IkpvaG4gRG9lIiwiYWRtaW4iOnRydWV9.TJVA95OrM7E2cBab30RMHrHDcEfxjoYZgeFONFh7HgQ

post /cash/tallying

Add a new tallying.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • cashRegisters: required (array of CashRegister)

    Items: CashRegister

    • count: required (integer)
    • value: required (number)
    • cashType: required (one of PAPER, COIN)
  • settlement: required (object)
    • produced: required (number)
    • credits: required (number)
    • advances: required (number)
    • expenses: required (number)
  • observations: required (string)

Example:

{
  "cashRegisters": [
    {
      "count": 10,
      "value": 500,
      "cashType": "COIN"
    },
    {
      "count": 10,
      "value": 2000,
      "cashType": "PAPER"
    }
  ],
  "settlement": {
    "produced": 45000,
    "credits": 0,
    "advances": 10000,
    "expenses": 10000
  },
  "observations": "closed without problems"
}

HTTP status code 201

It has created a new tallying.

Headers

  • Location: required (string)

    Location where you can get the information of the created cash tallying.

    Example:

    http://api.arpia.com/v1/cash/tallying/1

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • id: required (number)
  • user: required (object)
    • id: required (number)
    • displayName: required (string)
    • email: required (string)
    • username: (string)
    • urlPic: (string)
  • registerDate: required (datetime)
  • cashRegisters: required (array of CashRegisterResponse)

    Items: CashRegisterResponse

    • count: required (integer)
    • value: required (number)
    • cashType: required (one of PAPER, COIN)
    • total: required (number)
  • settlement: required (object)
    • produced: required (number)
    • credits: required (number)
    • advances: required (number)
    • expenses: required (number)
    • total: required (number)
  • observations: required (string)
  • totalPapers: required (number)
  • totalCoins: required (number)
  • totalCash: required (number)
  • imbalance: required (number)

Example:

{
  "id": 1,
  "user": {
    "id": 1,
    "displayName": "Ali Connors",
    "email": "aliconnors@example.com",
    "username": "ali_connors",
    "urlPic": "http://static.arpia.com/imgs/img_001.jpg"
  },
  "registerDate": "2017-04-02T08:00:00.000Z",
  "cashRegisters": [
    {
      "count": 10,
      "value": 500,
      "cashType": "COIN",
      "total": 5000
    },
    {
      "count": 10,
      "value": 2000,
      "cashType": "PAPER",
      "total": 20000
    }
  ],
  "settlement": {
    "produced": 45000,
    "credits": 0,
    "advances": 10000,
    "expenses": 10000,
    "total": 25000
  },
  "observations": "closed without problems",
  "totalPapers": 20000,
  "totalCoins": 5000,
  "totalCash": 25000,
  "imbalance": 0
}

  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

/cash/tallying/{id} get

get

Get information about a cash tallying register.

get /cash/tallying/{id}

Get information about a cash tallying register.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • id: required (string)

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

HTTP status code 200

Successfull request.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • id: required (number)
  • user: required (object)
    • id: required (number)
    • displayName: required (string)
    • email: required (string)
    • username: (string)
    • urlPic: (string)
  • registerDate: required (datetime)
  • cashRegisters: required (array of CashRegisterResponse)

    Items: CashRegisterResponse

    • count: required (integer)
    • value: required (number)
    • cashType: required (one of PAPER, COIN)
    • total: required (number)
  • settlement: required (object)
    • produced: required (number)
    • credits: required (number)
    • advances: required (number)
    • expenses: required (number)
    • total: required (number)
  • observations: required (string)
  • totalPapers: required (number)
  • totalCoins: required (number)
  • totalCash: required (number)
  • imbalance: required (number)

Example:

{
  "id": 1,
  "user": {
    "id": 2,
    "displayName": "Peter Carlsson",
    "email": "petercarlsson@example.com",
    "username": "peter_carlsson",
    "urlPic": "http://static.arpia.com/imgs/img_002.jpg"
  },
  "registerDate": "2017-04-02T08:00:00.000Z",
  "cashRegisters": [
    {
      "count": 10,
      "value": 500,
      "cashType": "COIN",
      "total": 5000
    },
    {
      "count": 10,
      "value": 2000,
      "cashType": "PAPER",
      "total": 20000
    }
  ],
  "settlement": {
    "produced": 45000,
    "credits": 0,
    "advances": 10000,
    "expenses": 10000,
    "total": 25000
  },
  "observations": "closed without problems",
  "totalPapers": 20000,
  "totalCoins": 5000,
  "totalCash": 25000,
  "imbalance": 0
}

The server cannot or will not process the request due to something that is perceived to be a client error (e.g., malformed request syntax, invalid request message framing, or deceptive request routing).

Media type: application/json

  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 400,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 500

The server encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request.

If an error occurred on the server, the required operation could not be performed, sorry.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 500,

      "message": "This is a second error message."

Secured by jwt

  • Authorization: required (string)

    Used to send a valid JWT access token. In the Authorization header using the Bearer schema.

    Example:

    Bearer eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJzdWIiOiIxMjM0NTY3ODkwIiwibmFtZSI6IkpvaG4gRG9lIiwiYWRtaW4iOnRydWV9.TJVA95OrM7E2cBab30RMHrHDcEfxjoYZgeFONFh7HgQ

Chips

This resource contains all the necessary operations for the management of the chips, among these operations we will have HTTP methods to get all the elements, to get a single element, to add new elements to the resource, to edit the existing elements and finally to eliminate.

/chips get post

get

Get a list of all chips.

post

Add a new chip.

get /chips

Get a list of all chips.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

Query Parameters

  • messenger: (number)

    If you need to filter the list from a messenger you can provide this parameter.

    Example:

    1265
  • type: (one of LOAN, RETURN)

    If you need to filter the list from the loans and returns, you can provide this parameter.

  • start: (number - default: 0 - minimum: 0)

    Specify the index of first element to get

    Example:

    10
  • size: (number - minimum: 10 - maximum: 200)

    Specify the amount of items that will be retrieved per request

    Example:

    150

HTTP status code 200

Successfull request.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • items: required (array of Chip)

    Items: Chip

    • id: (number)
    • messenger: required (MessengerSimple | number)
    • type: required (one of LOAN, RETURN)
    • items: required (array of ChipItem)
    • created: (datetime)
  • total: required (number)

Example:

{
  "items": [
    {
      "id": 1,
      "messenger": {
        "id": 1,
        "identification": "12346798",
        "name": "Jhon",
        "lastName": "Doe",
        "gender": "MALE",
        "birthday": "1993-02-11",
        "photo": "http://static.arpia.com/imgs/img_001.jpg",
        "category": 5
      },
      "type": "LOAN",
      "items": [
        {
          "element": {
            "id": 1,
            "name": "Item 1"
          },
          "count": 2
        },
        {
          "element": {
            "id": 2,
            "name": "Item 2"
          },
          "count": 3
        }
      ],
      "created": "2017-06-28T12:30:00.000Z"
    },
    {
      "id": 2,
      "messenger": {
        "id": 1,
        "identification": "12346798",
        "name": "Jhon",
        "lastName": "Doe",
        "gender": "MALE",
        "birthday": "1993-02-11",
        "photo": "http://static.arpia.com/imgs/img_001.jpg",
        "category": 5
      },
      "type": "RETURN",
      "items": [
        {
          "element": {
            "id": 1,
            "name": "Item 1"
          },
          "count": 2
        },
        {
          "element": {
            "id": 2,
            "name": "Item 2"
          },
          "count": 1
        }
      ],
      "created": "2017-06-28T12:30:00.000Z"
    }
  ],
  "total": 10
}

HTTP status code 404

The origin server did not find a current representation for the target resource or is not willing to disclose that one exists.

Resource not found, specifically occurs when a route is poorly specified, make sure that the resource ID are needing is correct.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 404,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 500

The server encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request.

If an error occurred on the server, the required operation could not be performed, sorry.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 500,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

Secured by jwt

Headers

  • Authorization: required (string)

    Used to send a valid JWT access token. In the Authorization header using the Bearer schema.

    Example:

    Bearer eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJzdWIiOiIxMjM0NTY3ODkwIiwibmFtZSI6IkpvaG4gRG9lIiwiYWRtaW4iOnRydWV9.TJVA95OrM7E2cBab30RMHrHDcEfxjoYZgeFONFh7HgQ

post /chips

Add a new chip.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • id: (number)
  • messenger: required (MessengerSimple | number)
  • type: required (one of LOAN, RETURN)
  • items: required (array of ChipItem)
  • created: (datetime)

Example:

{
  "messenger": 1,
  "type": "LOAN",
  "items": [
    {
      "element": 1,
      "count": 2
    },
    {
      "element": 2,
      "count": 3
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 200

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Example:

{
  "id": 2,
  "messenger": {
    "id": 1,
    "identification": "12346798",
    "name": "Jhon",
    "lastName": "Doe",
    "gender": "MALE",
    "birthday": "1993-02-11",
    "photo": "http://static.arpia.com/imgs/img_001.jpg",
    "category": 5
  },
  "type": "RETURN",
  "items": [
    {
      "element": {
        "id": 1,
        "name": "Item 1"
      },
      "count": 2
    },
    {
      "element": {
        "id": 2,
        "name": "Item 2"
      },
      "count": 1
    }
  ],
  "created": "2017-06-28T12:30:00.000Z"
}

HTTP status code 201

It has created a new chip.

Headers

  • Location: required (string)

    Location where you can get the information of the created chip.

    Example:

    http://api.arpia.com/v1/chips/1

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • id: (number)
  • messenger: required (MessengerSimple | number)
  • type: required (one of LOAN, RETURN)
  • items: required (array of ChipItem)
  • created: (datetime)

HTTP status code 400

The server cannot or will not process the request due to something that is perceived to be a client error (e.g., malformed request syntax, invalid request message framing, or deceptive request routing).

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 400,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 404

The origin server did not find a current representation for the target resource or is not willing to disclose that one exists.

Resource not found, specifically occurs when a route is poorly specified, make sure that the resource ID are needing is correct.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 404,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 500

The server encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request.

If an error occurred on the server, the required operation could not be performed, sorry.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 500,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

Secured by jwt

Headers

  • Authorization: required (string)

    Used to send a valid JWT access token. In the Authorization header using the Bearer schema.

    Example:

    Bearer eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJzdWIiOiIxMjM0NTY3ODkwIiwibmFtZSI6IkpvaG4gRG9lIiwiYWRtaW4iOnRydWV9.TJVA95OrM7E2cBab30RMHrHDcEfxjoYZgeFONFh7HgQ

/chips/{id} get

A specific chip, a item of the chips list.

get

Get information about a Chip.

get /chips/{id}

Get information about a Chip.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • id: required (number)

    Chip ID is required.

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

HTTP status code 200

Successfull request.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • id: (number)
  • messenger: required (MessengerSimple | number)
  • type: required (one of LOAN, RETURN)
  • items: required (array of ChipItem)
  • created: (datetime)

Example:

{
  "id": 2,
  "messenger": {
    "id": 1,
    "identification": "12346798",
    "name": "Jhon",
    "lastName": "Doe",
    "gender": "MALE",
    "birthday": "1993-02-11",
    "photo": "http://static.arpia.com/imgs/img_001.jpg",
    "category": 5
  },
  "type": "RETURN",
  "items": [
    {
      "element": {
        "id": 1,
        "name": "Item 1"
      },
      "count": 2
    },
    {
      "element": {
        "id": 2,
        "name": "Item 2"
      },
      "count": 1
    }
  ],
  "created": "2017-06-28T12:30:00.000Z"
}

    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

Resource not found, specifically occurs when a route is poorly specified, make sure that the resource ID are needing is correct.

HTTP status code 500

The server encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request.

If an error occurred on the server, the required operation could not be performed, sorry.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties

  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

Secured by jwt

Headers

  • Authorization: required (string)

    Used to send a valid JWT access token. In the Authorization header using the Bearer schema.

    Example:

    Bearer eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJzdWIiOiIxMjM0NTY3ODkwIiwibmFtZSI6IkpvaG4gRG9lIiwiYWRtaW4iOnRydWV9.TJVA95OrM7E2cBab30RMHrHDcEfxjoYZgeFONFh7HgQ

Customers

This resource contains all the necessary operations for the management of the customers, among these operations we will have HTTP methods to get all the elements, to get a single element, to add new elements to the resource, to edit the existing elements and finally to eliminate.

/customers get

get

Get a list of all customers.

get /customers

Get a list of all customers.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

Query Parameters

  • search: (string)

    The value to search.

  • start: (number - default: 0 - minimum: 0)

    Specify the index of first element to get

    Example:

    10
  • size: (number - minimum: 10 - maximum: 200)

    Specify the amount of items that will be retrieved per request

    Example:

    150

HTTP status code 200

Successfull request.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • items: required (array of Customer)

    Items: Customer

    • id: required (number)
    • observations: (string)
    • displayName: required (string)
    • identification: required (string)
    • type: required (one of PARTICULAR, ESTABLISHMENT)
    • banned: required (boolean)
  • total: required (number)

Example:

{
  "items": [
    {
      "id": 1,
      "displayName": "Ali Connors",
      "identification": "123456789",
      "type": "PARTICULAR",
      "banned": false
    },
    {
      "id": 2,
      "observations": "This is a observations.",
      "displayName": "Summer BBQ",
      "identification": "987654321",
      "type": "ESTABLISHMENT",
      "banned": false
    }
  ],
  "total": 150
}

HTTP status code 404

The origin server did not find a current representation for the target resource or is not willing to disclose that one exists.

Resource not found, specifically occurs when a route is poorly specified, make sure that the resource ID are needing is correct.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 404,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

If an error occurred on the server, the required operation could not be performed, sorry.

/customers/{id} get

A specific customer, a item of the customers list.

get

Get information about a customer.

get /customers/{id}

Get information about a customer.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • id: required (number)

    Customer ID is required.

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

HTTP status code 200

Successfull request.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • id: required (number)
  • observations: (string)
  • displayName: required (string)
  • identification: required (string)
  • type: required (one of PARTICULAR, ESTABLISHMENT)
  • banned: required (boolean)

Example:

{
  "id": 1,
  "identification": "123456789",
  "displayName": "Jhon Doe",
  "type": "PARTICULAR",
  "banned": false,
  "observations": "This is a observation."
}

Curriculum Vitae

This resource contains all the necessary operations for the management of the curriculum vitaes, among these operations we will have HTTP methods to get all the elements, to get a single element, to edit the existing elements and finally to eliminate.

/cvs get

get

Get curriculum vitae from the given messenger ID

get /cvs

Get curriculum vitae from the given messenger ID

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

Query Parameters

  • messenger: required (number)

    The messenger ID

    Example:

    1

HTTP status code 200

Successfull request.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • id: (number)
  • socialSecurity: required (object)
    • nameEPS: required (string)
    • nameARL: required (string)
    • pensionEntity: required (string)
  • home: required (object)
    • stratum: required (integer)
    • sonsNumber: required (integer)
    • homeownership: required (one of OWN, RENT)
    • monthlyExpenses: required (number)
  • civilStatus: required (one of SINGLE, MARRIED, WIDOWER, COMMITTED, DIVORCED)
  • birthCity: required (string)
  • academicLevel: required (one of BASIC_EDUCATION, SECONDARY_EDUCATION, TECHNICIAN, TECHNOLOGIST, PROFESSIONAL)
  • militaryCard: (string)
  • district: (string)
  • references: (array of Reference)

    Items: Reference

    • index: (integer)
    • name: required (string)
    • lastName: required (string)
    • address: required (string)
    • phoneNumber: required (string)
    • type: required (one of FAMILY, PERSONAL)
    • relationship: required (one of MOTHER, FATHER, BROTHERS, CHILDREN, OTHER)

HTTP status code 404

The origin server did not find a current representation for the target resource or is not willing to disclose that one exists.

Resource not found, specifically occurs when a route is poorly specified, make sure that the resource ID are needing is correct.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 404,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

The server encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request.

If an error occurred on the server, the required operation could not be performed, sorry.

Body

  • documentation: required (string)

/cvs/{id} get put

A specific curriculum vitae, the curriculum vitae of messenger.

get

Get information about a curriculum vitae.

put

Update specific curriculum vitae of the messenger.

get /cvs/{id}

Get information about a curriculum vitae.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • id: required (number)

    Curriculum Vitae ID is required.

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

HTTP status code 200

Successfull request.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • id: (number)
  • socialSecurity: required (object)
    • nameEPS: required (string)
    • nameARL: required (string)
    • pensionEntity: required (string)
  • home: required (object)
    • stratum: required (integer)
    • sonsNumber: required (integer)
    • homeownership: required (one of OWN, RENT)
    • monthlyExpenses: required (number)
  • civilStatus: required (one of SINGLE, MARRIED, WIDOWER, COMMITTED, DIVORCED)
  • birthCity: required (string)
  • academicLevel: required (one of BASIC_EDUCATION, SECONDARY_EDUCATION, TECHNICIAN, TECHNOLOGIST, PROFESSIONAL)
  • militaryCard: (string)
  • district: (string)
  • references: (array of Reference)

    Items: Reference

    • index: (integer)
    • name: required (string)
    • lastName: required (string)
    • address: required (string)
    • phoneNumber: required (string)
    • type: required (one of FAMILY, PERSONAL)
    • relationship: required (one of MOTHER, FATHER, BROTHERS, CHILDREN, OTHER)
