  • home: required (object)
    • stratum: required (integer)
    • sonsNumber: required (integer)
    • homeownership: required (one of OWN, RENT)
    • monthlyExpenses: required (number)
  • civilStatus: required (one of SINGLE, MARRIED, WIDOWER, COMMITTED, DIVORCED)
  • birthCity: required (string)
  • academicLevel: required (one of BASIC_EDUCATION, SECONDARY_EDUCATION, TECHNICIAN, TECHNOLOGIST, PROFESSIONAL)
  • militaryCard: (string)
  • district: (string)
  • references: (array of Reference)

    Items: Reference

    • index: (integer)
    • name: required (string)
    • lastName: required (string)
    • address: required (string)
    • phoneNumber: required (string)
    • type: required (one of FAMILY, PERSONAL)
    • relationship: required (one of MOTHER, FATHER, BROTHERS, CHILDREN, OTHER)

HTTP status code 200

It has updated a curriculum vitae.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • id: (number)
  • socialSecurity: required (object)
    • nameEPS: required (string)
    • nameARL: required (string)
    • pensionEntity: required (string)
  • home: required (object)
    • stratum: required (integer)
    • sonsNumber: required (integer)
    • homeownership: required (one of OWN, RENT)
    • monthlyExpenses: required (number)
  • civilStatus: required (one of SINGLE, MARRIED, WIDOWER, COMMITTED, DIVORCED)
  • birthCity: required (string)
  • academicLevel: required (one of BASIC_EDUCATION, SECONDARY_EDUCATION, TECHNICIAN, TECHNOLOGIST, PROFESSIONAL)
  • militaryCard: (string)
  • district: (string)
  • references: (array of Reference)

    Items: Reference

    • index: (integer)
    • name: required (string)
    • lastName: required (string)
    • address: required (string)
    • phoneNumber: required (string)
    • type: required (one of FAMILY, PERSONAL)
    • relationship: required (one of MOTHER, FATHER, BROTHERS, CHILDREN, OTHER)

HTTP status code 400

The server cannot or will not process the request due to something that is perceived to be a client error (e.g., malformed request syntax, invalid request message framing, or deceptive request routing).

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 400,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 404

The origin server did not find a current representation for the target resource or is not willing to disclose that one exists.

Resource not found, specifically occurs when a route is poorly specified, make sure that the resource ID are needing is correct.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 404,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 500

The server encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request.

If an error occurred on the server, the required operation could not be performed, sorry.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 500,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

Secured by jwt

Headers

  • Authorization: required (string)

    Used to send a valid JWT access token. In the Authorization header using the Bearer schema.

    Example:

    Bearer eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJzdWIiOiIxMjM0NTY3ODkwIiwibmFtZSI6IkpvaG4gRG9lIiwiYWRtaW4iOnRydWV9.TJVA95OrM7E2cBab30RMHrHDcEfxjoYZgeFONFh7HgQ

/cvs/{id}/references get post

This resource contains all the necessary operations for the management of the references, among these operations we will have HTTP methods to get all the elements, to get a single element, to add new elements to the resource, to edit the existing elements and finally to eliminate.

get

Get a list of all references.

post

Add a new reference.

get /cvs/{id}/references

Get a list of all references.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • id: required (number)

    Curriculum Vitae ID is required.

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

HTTP status code 200

Successfull request.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: array of Reference

Items: Reference

  • index: (integer)
  • name: required (string)
  • lastName: required (string)
  • address: required (string)
  • phoneNumber: required (string)
  • type: required (one of FAMILY, PERSONAL)
  • relationship: required (one of MOTHER, FATHER, BROTHERS, CHILDREN, OTHER)

Example:

[
  {
    "index": 1,
    "name": "Ali",
    "lastName": "Connors",
    "address": "CRA 45 # 15-32",
    "phoneNumber": "1234567890",
    "type": "PERSONAL",
    "relationship": "OTHER"
  },
  {
    "index": 2,
    "name": "Sandra",
    "lastName": "Adams",
    "address": "CRA 45 # 15-32",
    "phoneNumber": "9876543210",
    "type": "FAMILY",
    "relationship": "BROTHERS"
  }
]

HTTP status code 201

It has created a new reference.

Headers

  • Location: required (string)

    Location where you can get the information of the created reference.

    Example:

    http://api.arpia.com/v1/references/1

Type: object

  • relationship: required (one of MOTHER, FATHER, BROTHERS, CHILDREN, OTHER)

/cvs/{id}/references/{id} get put delete

A specific reference, a item of the references list.

get

Get information about a reference.

put

Update information about the specific reference.

delete

Remove a specific reference.

get /cvs/{id}/references/{id}

Get information about a reference.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • id: required (number)

    Curriculum Vitae ID is required.

  • id: required (number)

    Reference ID is required.

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

HTTP status code 200

Successfull request.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • index: (integer)
  • name: required (string)
  • lastName: required (string)
  • address: required (string)
  • phoneNumber: required (string)
  • type: required (one of FAMILY, PERSONAL)
  • relationship: required (one of MOTHER, FATHER, BROTHERS, CHILDREN, OTHER)

{
  "index": 1,
  "name": "Ali",
  "lastName": "Connors",
  "address": "CRA 45 # 15-32",
  "phoneNumber": "1234567890",
  "type": "PERSONAL",
  "relationship": "OTHER"
}

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • id: required (number)

    Curriculum Vitae ID is required.

  • id: required (number)

    Reference ID is required.

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

    Used to send a valid JWT access token. In the Authorization header using the Bearer schema.

    Example:

    Bearer eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJzdWIiOiIxMjM0NTY3ODkwIiwibmFtZSI6IkpvaG4gRG9lIiwiYWRtaW4iOnRydWV9.TJVA95OrM7E2cBab30RMHrHDcEfxjoYZgeFONFh7HgQ

Debts

This resource contains all the necessary operations for the management of the debts, among these operations we will have HTTP methods to get all the elements, to get a single element, to add new elements to the resource and finally to edit the existing elements.

/debts get post

get

Get a list of all the debts.

post

Add a new debt.

get /debts

Get a list of all the debts.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

Query Parameters

  • closureState: required (boolean)

    Specify the closure state of the debts.

    Example:

    true
  • search: (string)

    The value to search.

  • start: (number - default: 0 - minimum: 0)

    Specify the index of first element to get

    Example:

    10
  • size: (number - minimum: 10 - maximum: 200)

    Specify the amount of items that will be retrieved per request

    Example:

    150
  • orderBy: (string)

    Specify the property of the object be sorted.

  • orderType: (one of ASC, DESC - default: ASC)

    Specify whether to sort ascending or descending

  • from: (date-only)

    Specifies the start date of the filter.

    Example:

    2015-07-30
  • to: (date-only)

    Specifies the end date of the filter.

    Example:

    2017-12-31

HTTP status code 200

Successfull request.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • items: required (array of DebtResponse)

    Items: DebtResponse

    • value: required (number)
    • concept: required (string)
    • closure: (object)
      • closuredBy: (object)
        • id: required (number)
        • displayName: required (string)
        • email: required (string)
        • username: (string)
        • urlPic: (string)
      • closuredType: required (one of PAID_OUT, DISCARDED)
      • observation: required (string)
      • date: (datetime)
    • feeInfo: required (object)
      • id: (number)
      • firstPayment: required (date-only)
      • numberOfFees: required (integer)
      • period: required (one of DAILY, WEEKLY, BIWEEKLY, MONTHLY, QUARTERLY, BIANNUAL, ANNUAL)
    • id: required (number)
    • owner: required (object)
      • id: required (number)
      • displayName: required (string)
      • email: required (string)
      • username: (string)
      • urlPic: (string)
    • created: required (datetime)
  • total: required (number)

Example:

{
  "items": [
    {
      "id": 1,
      "concept": "This is the concept",
      "value": 25000,
      "feeInfo": {
        "id": 1,
        "firstPayment": "2018-04-17",
        "numberOfFees": 12,
        "period": "DAILY"
      },
      "owner": {
        "id": 1,
        "displayName": "Ali Connors",
        "email": "aliconnors@example.com",
        "username": "ali_connors",
        "urlPic": "http://static.arpia.com/imgs/img_001.jpg"
      },
      "created": "2018-04-17T11:20:00.000Z"
    },
    {
      "id": 2,
      "value": 53000,
      "concept": "This is the second concept",
      "closure": {
        "closuredBy": {
          "id": 2,
          "displayName": "Peter Carlsson",
          "email": "petercarlsson@example.com",
          "username": "peter_carlsson",
          "urlPic": "http://static.arpia.com/imgs/img_002.jpg"
        },
        "closuredType": "PAID_OUT",
        "observation": "This is the observation",
        "date": "2018-04-17T11:20:00.000Z"
      },
      "feeInfo": {
        "id": 2,
        "firstPayment": "2018-04-17",
        "numberOfFees": 3,
        "period": "WEEKLY"
      },
      "owner": {
        "id": 1,
        "displayName": "Ali Connors",
        "email": "aliconnors@example.com",
        "username": "ali_connors",
        "urlPic": "http://static.arpia.com/imgs/img_001.jpg"
      },
      "created": "2018-04-17T11:20:00.000Z"
    }
  ],
  "total": 2
}

HTTP status code 404

The origin server did not find a current representation for the target resource or is not willing to disclose that one exists.

Resource not found, specifically occurs when a route is poorly specified, make sure that the resource ID are needing is correct.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 404,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 500

The server encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request.

If an error occurred on the server, the required operation could not be performed, sorry.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 500,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

Secured by jwt

Headers

  • Authorization: required (string)

    Used to send a valid JWT access token. In the Authorization header using the Bearer schema.

    Example:

    Bearer eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJzdWIiOiIxMjM0NTY3ODkwIiwibmFtZSI6IkpvaG4gRG9lIiwiYWRtaW4iOnRydWV9.TJVA95OrM7E2cBab30RMHrHDcEfxjoYZgeFONFh7HgQ

post /debts

Add a new debt.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • value: required (number)
  • concept: required (string)
  • closure: (object)
    • closuredBy: (object)
      • id: required (number)
      • displayName: required (string)
      • email: required (string)
      • username: (string)
      • urlPic: (string)
    • closuredType: required (one of PAID_OUT, DISCARDED)
    • observation: required (string)
    • date: (datetime)
  • feeInfo: required (object)
    • id: (number)
    • firstPayment: required (date-only)
    • numberOfFees: required (integer)
    • period: required (one of DAILY, WEEKLY, BIWEEKLY, MONTHLY, QUARTERLY, BIANNUAL, ANNUAL)
  • ownerId: required (number)

Example:

{
  "concept": "This is the concept",
  "value": 25000,
  "ownerId": 1,
  "feeInfo": {
    "firstPayment": "2018-04-17",
    "numberOfFees": 12,
    "period": "DAILY"
  }
}

HTTP status code 201

It has created a new debt.

Headers

  • Location: required (string)

    Location where you can get the information of the created debt.

    Example:

    http://api.arpia.com/v1/debts/1

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • value: required (number)
  • concept: required (string)
  • closure: (object)
    • closuredBy: (object)
      • id: required (number)
      • displayName: required (string)
      • email: required (string)
      • username: (string)
      • urlPic: (string)
    • closuredType: required (one of PAID_OUT, DISCARDED)
    • observation: required (string)
    • date: (datetime)
  • feeInfo: required (object)
    • id: (number)
    • firstPayment: required (date-only)
    • numberOfFees: required (integer)
    • period: required (one of DAILY, WEEKLY, BIWEEKLY, MONTHLY, QUARTERLY, BIANNUAL, ANNUAL)
  • id: required (number)
  • owner: required (object)
    • id: required (number)
    • displayName: required (string)
    • email: required (string)
    • username: (string)
    • urlPic: (string)
  • created: required (datetime)

Example:

{
  "id": 1,
  "concept": "This is the concept",
  "value": 25000,
  "feeInfo": {
    "id": 1,
    "firstPayment": "2018-04-17",
    "numberOfFees": 12,
    "period": "DAILY"
  },
  "owner": {
    "id": 1,
    "displayName": "Ali Connors",
    "email": "aliconnors@example.com",
    "username": "ali_connors",
    "urlPic": "http://static.arpia.com/imgs/img_001.jpg"
  },
  "created": "2018-04-17T11:20:00.000Z"
}

HTTP status code 400

The server cannot or will not process the request due to something that is perceived to be a client error (e.g., malformed request syntax, invalid request message framing, or deceptive request routing).

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 400,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

/debts/{id} get put

A specific debt, a item of the debts list.

get

Get information about a debt.

put

Update information about the specific debt.

get /debts/{id}

Get information about a debt.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • id: required (string)

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

HTTP status code 200

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • value: required (number)
  • concept: required (string)
  • closure: (object)
    • closuredBy: (object)
      • id: required (number)
      • displayName: required (string)
      • email: required (string)
      • username: (string)
      • urlPic: (string)
    • closuredType: required (one of PAID_OUT, DISCARDED)
    • observation: required (string)
    • date: (datetime)
  • feeInfo: required (object)
    • id: (number)
    • firstPayment: required (date-only)
    • numberOfFees: required (integer)
    • period: required (one of DAILY, WEEKLY, BIWEEKLY, MONTHLY, QUARTERLY, BIANNUAL, ANNUAL)
  • id: required (number)
  • owner: required (object)
    • id: required (number)
    • displayName: required (string)
    • email: required (string)
    • username: (string)
    • urlPic: (string)
  • created: required (datetime)

Example:

{
  "id": 1,
  "concept": "This is the concept",
  "value": 25000,
  "feeInfo": {
    "id": 1,
    "firstPayment": "2018-04-17",
    "numberOfFees": 12,
    "period": "DAILY"
  },
  "owner": {
    "id": 1,
    "displayName": "Ali Connors",
    "email": "aliconnors@example.com",
    "username": "ali_connors",
    "urlPic": "http://static.arpia.com/imgs/img_001.jpg"
  },
  "created": "2018-04-17T11:20:00.000Z"
}

put /debts/{id}

Update information about the specific debt.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • id: required (string)

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • value: required (number)
  • concept: required (string)
  • closure: (object)
    • closuredBy: (object)
      • id: required (number)
      • displayName: required (string)
      • email: required (string)
      • username: (string)
      • urlPic: (string)
    • closuredType: required (one of PAID_OUT, DISCARDED)
    • observation: required (string)
    • date: (datetime)
  • feeInfo: required (object)
    • id: (number)
    • firstPayment: required (date-only)
    • numberOfFees: required (integer)
    • period: required (one of DAILY, WEEKLY, BIWEEKLY, MONTHLY, QUARTERLY, BIANNUAL, ANNUAL)
  • ownerId: required (number)

Example:

{
  "concept": "This is the concept",
  "value": 25000,
  "ownerId": 1,
  "feeInfo": {
    "firstPayment": "2018-04-17",
    "numberOfFees": 12,
    "period": "DAILY"
  }
}

HTTP status code 200

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • value: required (number)
  • concept: required (string)
  • closure: (object)
    • closuredBy: (object)
      • id: required (number)
      • displayName: required (string)
      • email: required (string)
      • username: (string)
      • urlPic: (string)
    • closuredType: required (one of PAID_OUT, DISCARDED)
    • observation: required (string)
    • date: (datetime)
  • feeInfo: required (object)
    • id: (number)
    • firstPayment: required (date-only)
    • numberOfFees: required (integer)
    • period: required (one of DAILY, WEEKLY, BIWEEKLY, MONTHLY, QUARTERLY, BIANNUAL, ANNUAL)
  • id: required (number)
  • owner: required (object)
    • id: required (number)
    • displayName: required (string)
    • email: required (string)
    • username: (string)
    • urlPic: (string)
  • created: required (datetime)

Example:

{
  "id": 1,
  "concept": "This is the concept",
  "value": 25000,
  "feeInfo": {
    "id": 1,
    "firstPayment": "2018-04-17",
    "numberOfFees": 12,
    "period": "DAILY"
  },
  "owner": {
    "id": 1,
    "displayName": "Ali Connors",
    "email": "aliconnors@example.com",
    "username": "ali_connors",
    "urlPic": "http://static.arpia.com/imgs/img_001.jpg"
  },
  "created": "2018-04-17T11:20:00.000Z"

/debts/{id}/closure put

The closure of a specific debt.

put

Update closure information about the specific debt.

put /debts/{id}/closure

Update closure information about the specific debt.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • id: required (string)

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • closuredBy: (object)
    • id: required (number)
    • displayName: required (string)
    • email: required (string)
    • username: (string)
    • urlPic: (string)
  • closuredType: required (one of PAID_OUT, DISCARDED)
  • observation: required (string)
  • date: (datetime)

Example:

{
  "closuredType": "PAID_OUT",
  "observation": "This is the observation"
}

HTTP status code 200

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • closuredBy: (object)
    • id: required (number)
    • displayName: required (string)
    • email: required (string)
    • username: (string)
    • urlPic: (string)
  • closuredType: required (one of PAID_OUT, DISCARDED)
  • observation: required (string)
  • date: (datetime)

Example:

{
  "closuredBy": {
    "id": 2,
    "displayName": "Peter Carlsson",
    "email": "petercarlsson@example.com",
    "username": "peter_carlsson",
    "urlPic": "http://static.arpia.com/imgs/img_002.jpg"
  },
  "closuredType": "PAID_OUT",
  "observation": "This is the obserbation",
  "date": "2017-04-14T14:01:00.000Z"
}

The server cannot or will not process the request due to something that is perceived to be a client error (e.g., malformed request syntax, invalid request message framing, or deceptive request routing).

HTTP status code 500

The server encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request.

Body

  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)

  "statusCode": 500,
  "messages": [

      "message": "This is a second error message."

Secured by jwt

Headers

  • Authorization: required (string)

    Used to send a valid JWT access token. In the Authorization header using the Bearer schema.

    Example:

    Bearer eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJzdWIiOiIxMjM0NTY3ODkwIiwibmFtZSI6IkpvaG4gRG9lIiwiYWRtaW4iOnRydWV9.TJVA95OrM7E2cBab30RMHrHDcEfxjoYZgeFONFh7HgQ

/debts/{id}/payments get post

This resource contains all the necessary operations for the management of the payments, among these operations we will have HTTP methods to get all the elements, to get a single element or to add new elements to the resource.

get

Get a list of all payments.

post

Add a new payment.

get /debts/{id}/payments

Get a list of all payments.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • id: required (string)

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

Query Parameters

  • start: (number - default: 0 - minimum: 0)

    Specify the index of first element to get

    Example:

    10
  • size: (number - minimum: 10 - maximum: 200)

    Specify the amount of items that will be retrieved per request

    Example:

    150
  • orderBy: (string)

    Specify the property of the object be sorted.

  • orderType: (one of ASC, DESC - default: ASC)

    Specify whether to sort ascending or descending

  • from: (date-only)

    Specifies the start date of the filter.

    Example:

    2015-07-30
  • to: (date-only)

    Specifies the end date of the filter.

    Example:

    2017-12-31

HTTP status code 200

Successfull request.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • items: required (array of Payment)

    Items: Payment

    • index: (integer)
    • payment: required (number)
    • authorizedBy: (object)
      • id: required (number)
      • displayName: required (string)
      • email: required (string)
      • username: (string)
      • urlPic: (string)
    • date: (datetime)
    • operationId: (number)
  • total: required (number)

Example:

{
  "items": [
    {
      "index": 1,
      "payment": 100,
      "authorizedBy": {
        "id": 1,
        "displayName": "Ali Connors",
        "email": "aliconnors@example.com",
        "username": "ali_connors",
        "urlPic": "http://static.arpia.com/imgs/img_001.jpg"
      },
      "date": "2018-04-17T11:20:00.000Z"
    },
    {
      "index": 2,
      "payment": 200,
      "authorizedBy": {
        "id": 2,
        "displayName": "Peter Carlsson",
        "email": "petercarlsson@example.com",
        "username": "peter_carlsson",
        "urlPic": "http://static.arpia.com/imgs/img_002.jpg"
      },
      "date": "2018-04-17T11:20:00.000Z"
    }
  ],
  "total": 2
}

HTTP status code 404

The origin server did not find a current representation for the target resource or is not willing to disclose that one exists.

Resource not found, specifically occurs when a route is poorly specified, make sure that the resource ID are needing is correct.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 404,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 500

The server encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request.

If an error occurred on the server, the required operation could not be performed, sorry.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 500,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

Secured by jwt

Headers

  • Authorization: required (string)

    Used to send a valid JWT access token. In the Authorization header using the Bearer schema.

    Example:

    Bearer eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJzdWIiOiIxMjM0NTY3ODkwIiwibmFtZSI6IkpvaG4gRG9lIiwiYWRtaW4iOnRydWV9.TJVA95OrM7E2cBab30RMHrHDcEfxjoYZgeFONFh7HgQ

post /debts/{id}/payments

Add a new payment.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • id: required (string)

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • index: (integer)
  • payment: required (number)
  • authorizedBy: (object)
    • id: required (number)
    • displayName: required (string)
    • email: required (string)
    • username: (string)
    • urlPic: (string)
  • date: (datetime)
  • operationId: (number)

Example:

{
  "payment": 100,
  "operationId": 1
}

HTTP status code 201

It has created a new payment.

Headers

  • Location: required (string)

    Location where you can get the information of the created payment.

    Example:

    http://api.arpia.com/v1/payments/1

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • index: (integer)
  • payment: required (number)
  • authorizedBy: (object)
    • id: required (number)
    • displayName: required (string)
    • email: required (string)
    • username: (string)
    • urlPic: (string)
  • date: (datetime)
  • operationId: (number)

Example:

{
  "index": 1,
  "payment": 100,
  "authorizedBy": {
    "id": 1,
    "displayName": "Ali Connors",
    "email": "aliconnors@example.com",
    "username": "ali_connors",
    "urlPic": "http://static.arpia.com/imgs/img_001.jpg"
  },
  "date": "2018-04-17T11:20:00.000Z"
}

HTTP status code 400

The server cannot or will not process the request due to something that is perceived to be a client error (e.g., malformed request syntax, invalid request message framing, or deceptive request routing).

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 400,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 404

The origin server did not find a current representation for the target resource or is not willing to disclose that one exists.

Resource not found, specifically occurs when a route is poorly specified, make sure that the resource ID are needing is correct.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

  "statusCode": 404,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

Media type: application/json

  • documentation: required (string)

  • Authorization: required (string)

    Used to send a valid JWT access token. In the Authorization header using the Bearer schema.

    Example:

    Bearer eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJzdWIiOiIxMjM0NTY3ODkwIiwibmFtZSI6IkpvaG4gRG9lIiwiYWRtaW4iOnRydWV9.TJVA95OrM7E2cBab30RMHrHDcEfxjoYZgeFONFh7HgQ

/debts/{id}/payments/{index} get

A specific payment, a item of the payment list.

get

Get information about a payment.

get /debts/{id}/payments/{index}

Get information about a payment.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • id: required (string)
  • index: required (number)

    payment index is required.

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

HTTP status code 200

Successfull request.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • index: (integer)
  • payment: required (number)
  • authorizedBy: (object)
    • id: required (number)
    • displayName: required (string)
    • email: required (string)
    • username: (string)
    • urlPic: (string)
  • date: (datetime)
  • operationId: (number)

Example:

{
  "index": 1,
  "payment": 100,
  "authorizedBy": {
    "id": 1,
    "displayName": "Ali Connors",
    "email": "aliconnors@example.com",
    "username": "ali_connors",
    "urlPic": "http://static.arpia.com/imgs/img_001.jpg"
  },
  "date": "2018-04-17T11:20:00.000Z"
}

The server encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request.

Deposits

This resource contains all the necessary operations for the management of the security deposit, among these operations we will have HTTP methods to get all the elements.

/deposits get

get

Get a list of all deposits.

get /deposits

Get a list of all deposits.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

Query Parameters

  • start: (number - default: 0 - minimum: 0)

    Specify the index of first element to get

    Example:

    10
  • size: (number - minimum: 10 - maximum: 200)

    Specify the amount of items that will be retrieved per request

    Example:

    150
  • orderBy: (string)

    Specify the property of the object be sorted.

  • orderType: (one of ASC, DESC - default: ASC)

    Specify whether to sort ascending or descending

  • search: (string)

    The value to search.

HTTP status code 200

Successfull request.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: array of Deposit

Items: Deposit

  • owner: required (object)
    • id: required (number)
    • displayName: required (string)
    • email: required (string)
    • username: (string)
    • urlPic: (string)
  • paidToDate: required (number)
  • depositAmount: required (number)

Example:

[
  {
    "owner": {
      "id": 1,
      "displayName": "Ali Connors",
      "email": "aliconnors@example.com",
      "username": "ali_connors",
      "urlPic": "http://static.arpia.com/imgs/img_001.jpg"
    },
    "paidToDate": 10000,
    "depositAmount": 50000
  },
  {
    "owner": {
      "id": 2,
      "displayName": "Peter Carlsson",
      "email": "petercarlsson@example.com",
      "username": "peter_carlsson",
      "urlPic": "http://static.arpia.com/imgs/img_002.jpg"
    },
    "paidToDate": 20000,
    "depositAmount": 50000
  }
]

HTTP status code 404

The origin server did not find a current representation for the target resource or is not willing to disclose that one exists.

Resource not found, specifically occurs when a route is poorly specified, make sure that the resource ID are needing is correct.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 404,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 500

The server encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request.

If an error occurred on the server, the required operation could not be performed, sorry.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 500,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

Secured by jwt

Headers

  • Authorization: required (string)

    Used to send a valid JWT access token. In the Authorization header using the Bearer schema.

    Example:

    Bearer eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJzdWIiOiIxMjM0NTY3ODkwIiwibmFtZSI6IkpvaG4gRG9lIiwiYWRtaW4iOnRydWV9.TJVA95OrM7E2cBab30RMHrHDcEfxjoYZgeFONFh7HgQ

/deposits/payments get post

This resource contains all the necessary operations for the management of the payments, among these operations we will have HTTP methods to get all the elements, to get a single element, to add new elements to the resource, to edit the existing elements and finally to eliminate.

get

Get a list of all payments.

post

Add a new payment.

get /deposits/payments

Get a list of all payments.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

Query Parameters

  • search: (string)

    The value to search.

  • start: (number - default: 0 - minimum: 0)

    Specify the index of first element to get

    Example:

    10
  • size: (number - minimum: 10 - maximum: 200)

    Specify the amount of items that will be retrieved per request

    Example:

    150
  • orderBy: (string)

    Specify the property of the object be sorted.

  • orderType: (one of ASC, DESC - default: ASC)

    Specify whether to sort ascending or descending

  • from: (date-only)

    Specifies the start date of the filter.

    Example:

    2015-07-30
  • to: (date-only)

    Specifies the end date of the filter.

    Example:

    2017-12-31

HTTP status code 200

Successfull request.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • items: required (array of DepositPaymentRs)

    Items: DepositPaymentRs

    • payment: required (number)
    • id: required (number)
    • owner: required (object)
      • id: required (number)
      • displayName: required (string)
      • email: required (string)
      • username: (string)
      • urlPic: (string)
    • receivedBy: required (object)
      • id: required (number)
      • displayName: required (string)
      • email: required (string)
      • username: (string)
      • urlPic: (string)
    • created: required (datetime)
  • total: required (number)

Example:

{
  "items": [
    {
      "id": 1,
      "payment": 50000,
      "owner": {
        "id": 2,
        "displayName": "Peter Carlsson",
        "email": "petercarlsson@example.com",
        "username": "peter_carlsson",
        "urlPic": "http://static.arpia.com/imgs/img_002.jpg"
      },
      "receivedBy": {
        "id": 1,
        "displayName": "Ali Connors",
        "email": "aliconnors@example.com",
        "username": "ali_connors",
        "urlPic": "http://static.arpia.com/imgs/img_001.jpg"
      },
      "created": "2017-04-01T08:00:00.000Z"
    },
    {
      "id": 2,
      "payment": 40000,
      "owner": {
        "id": 1,
        "displayName": "Ali Connors",
        "email": "aliconnors@example.com",
        "username": "ali_connors",
        "urlPic": "http://static.arpia.com/imgs/img_001.jpg"
      },
      "receivedBy": {
        "id": 2,
        "displayName": "Peter Carlsson",
        "email": "petercarlsson@example.com",
        "username": "peter_carlsson",
        "urlPic": "http://static.arpia.com/imgs/img_002.jpg"
      },
      "created": "2017-04-01T08:00:00.000Z"
    }
  ],
  "total": 10
}

The origin server did not find a current representation for the target resource or is not willing to disclose that one exists.

Resource not found, specifically occurs when a route is poorly specified, make sure that the resource ID are needing is correct.

post /deposits/payments

Add a new payment.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • payment: required (number)
  • ownerId: required (number)

Example:

{
  "ownerId": 1,
  "payment": 20000
}

HTTP status code 201

It has created a new payment.

Headers

  • Location: required (string)

    Location where you can get the information of the created payment.

    Example:

    http://api.arpia.com/v1/deposits/payments/1

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • payment: required (number)
  • id: required (number)
  • owner: required (object)
    • id: required (number)
    • displayName: required (string)
    • email: required (string)
    • username: (string)
    • urlPic: (string)
  • receivedBy: required (object)
    • id: required (number)
    • displayName: required (string)
    • email: required (string)
    • username: (string)
    • urlPic: (string)
  • created: required (datetime)

/deposits/payments/{id} get

get

Get information about a deposit payment register.

get /deposits/payments/{id}

Get information about a deposit payment register.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • id: required (string)

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

HTTP status code 200

Successfull request.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • payment: required (number)
  • id: required (number)
  • owner: required (object)
    • id: required (number)
    • displayName: required (string)
    • email: required (string)
    • username: (string)
    • urlPic: (string)
  • receivedBy: required (object)
    • id: required (number)
    • displayName: required (string)
    • email: required (string)
    • username: (string)
    • urlPic: (string)
  • created: required (datetime)

Example:

{
  "id": 1,
  "payment": 50000,
  "owner": {
    "id": 1,
    "displayName": "Ali Connors",
    "email": "aliconnors@example.com",
    "username": "ali_connors",
    "urlPic": "http://static.arpia.com/imgs/img_001.jpg"
  },
  "receivedBy": {
    "id": 2,
    "displayName": "Peter Carlsson",
    "email": "petercarlsson@example.com",
    "username": "peter_carlsson",
    "urlPic": "http://static.arpia.com/imgs/img_002.jpg"
  },
  "created": "2017-04-01T08:00:00.000Z"
}

HTTP status code 400

The server cannot or will not process the request due to something that is perceived to be a client error (e.g., malformed request syntax, invalid request message framing, or deceptive request routing).

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 400,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 404

The origin server did not find a current representation for the target resource or is not willing to disclose that one exists.

Resource not found, specifically occurs when a route is poorly specified, make sure that the resource ID are needing is correct.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 404,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 500

The server encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request.

If an error occurred on the server, the required operation could not be performed, sorry.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 500,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

Secured by jwt

Headers

  • Authorization: required (string)

    Used to send a valid JWT access token. In the Authorization header using the Bearer schema.

    Example:

    Bearer eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJzdWIiOiIxMjM0NTY3ODkwIiwibmFtZSI6IkpvaG4gRG9lIiwiYWRtaW4iOnRydWV9.TJVA95OrM7E2cBab30RMHrHDcEfxjoYZgeFONFh7HgQ

Discounts

This resource contains all the necessary operations for the management of the discounts, among these operations we will have HTTP methods to get all the elements, to get a single element, to add new elements to the resource, to edit the existing elements and finally to eliminate.

/discounts get post

get

Get a list of all discounts.

post

Add a new discount.

get /discounts

Get a list of all discounts.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

Query Parameters

  • search: (string)

    The value to search.

  • start: (number - default: 0 - minimum: 0)

    Specify the index of first element to get

    Example:

    10
  • size: (number - minimum: 10 - maximum: 200)

    Specify the amount of items that will be retrieved per request

    Example:

    150
  • orderBy: (string)

    Specify the property of the object be sorted.

  • orderType: (one of ASC, DESC - default: ASC)

    Specify whether to sort ascending or descending

  • from: (date-only)

    Specifies the start date of the filter.

    Example:

    2015-07-30
  • to: (date-only)

    Specifies the end date of the filter.

    Example:

    2017-12-31

HTTP status code 200

Successfull request.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • items: required (array of DiscountResponse)

    Items: DiscountResponse

    • name: required (string)
    • startDate: required (datetime)
    • endDate: required (datetime)
    • percent: required (number)
    • useLimit: required (integer)
    • id: required (number)
    • countUsed: required (integer)
  • total: required (number)

Example:

{
  "items": [
    {
      "id": 1,
      "countUsed": 7,
      "name": "discount #1",
      "startDate": "2017-04-01T08:00:00.000Z",
      "endDate": "2017-04-10T08:00:00.000Z",
      "percent": 0.5,
      "useLimit": 100
    },
    {
      "id": 2,
      "countUsed": 3,
      "name": "discount #2",
      "startDate": "2017-05-01T08:00:00.000Z",
      "endDate": "2017-05-10T08:00:00.000Z",
      "percent": 0.8,
      "useLimit": 200
    }
  ],
  "total": 2
}

HTTP status code 404

The origin server did not find a current representation for the target resource or is not willing to disclose that one exists.

Resource not found, specifically occurs when a route is poorly specified, make sure that the resource ID are needing is correct.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 404,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 500

The server encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request.

If an error occurred on the server, the required operation could not be performed, sorry.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)

    Used to send a valid JWT access token. In the Authorization header using the Bearer schema.

    Example:

post /discounts

Add a new discount.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • name: required (string)
  • startDate: required (datetime)
  • endDate: required (datetime)
  • percent: required (number)
  • useLimit: required (integer)

Example:

{
  "name": "discount #1",
  "startDate": "2017-05-01T08:00:00.000Z",
  "endDate": "2017-05-10T08:00:00.000Z",
  "percent": 0.8,
  "useLimit": 200
}

HTTP status code 201

It has created a new discount.

Headers

  • Location: required (string)

    Location where you can get the information of the created discount.

    Example:

    http://api.arpia.com/v1/discounts/1

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • name: required (string)
  • startDate: required (datetime)
  • endDate: required (datetime)
  • percent: required (number)
  • useLimit: required (integer)
  • id: required (number)
  • countUsed: required (integer)

Example:

{
  "id": 1,
  "countUsed": 7,
  "name": "discount #1",
  "startDate": "2017-04-01T08:00:00.000Z",
  "endDate": "2017-04-10T08:00:00.000Z",
  "percent": 0.5,
  "useLimit": 100
}

/discounts/{id} get put delete

A specific discount, a item of the discounts list.

get

Get information about a discount.

put

Update information about the specific discount.

delete

Remove a specific discount.

get /discounts/{id}

Get information about a discount.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • id: required (number)

    Discount ID is required.

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

HTTP status code 200

Successfull request.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • name: required (string)
  • startDate: required (datetime)
  • endDate: required (datetime)
  • percent: required (number)
  • useLimit: required (integer)
  • id: required (number)
  • countUsed: required (integer)

Example:

{
  "id": 1,
  "countUsed": 7,
  "name": "discount #1",
  "startDate": "2017-04-01T08:00:00.000Z",
  "endDate": "2017-04-10T08:00:00.000Z",
  "percent": 0.5,
  "useLimit": 100
}

put /discounts/{id}

Update information about the specific discount.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • id: required (number)

    Discount ID is required.

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • name: required (string)
  • startDate: required (datetime)
  • endDate: required (datetime)
  • percent: required (number)
  • useLimit: required (integer)

Example:

{
  "name": "discount #1",
  "startDate": "2017-05-01T08:00:00.000Z",
  "endDate": "2017-05-10T08:00:00.000Z",
  "percent": 0.8,
  "useLimit": 200
}

HTTP status code 200

It has updated a discount.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • name: required (string)
  • startDate: required (datetime)
  • endDate: required (datetime)
  • percent: required (number)

  • countUsed: required (integer)

delete /discounts/{id}

Remove a specific discount.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • id: required (number)

    Discount ID is required.

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

Media type: application/json

  • name: required (string)
  • startDate: required (datetime)

/discounts/{id}/changes get

get

Gets a list of discount change logs.

get /discounts/{id}/changes

Gets a list of discount change logs.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • id: required (number)

    Discount ID is required.

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

HTTP status code 200

Successfull request.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: array of DiscountChangeLog

Items: DiscountChangeLog

  • index: required (integer)
  • user: required (object)
    • id: required (number)
    • displayName: required (string)
    • email: required (string)
    • username: (string)
    • urlPic: (string)
  • date: required (datetime)

Example:

[
  {
    "index": 1,
    "user": {
      "id": 1,
      "displayName": "victorprens",
      "email": "victorprens@arpia.com",
      "username": "vprens",
      "urlPic": "http://static.arpia.com/imgs/img_001.jpg"
    },
    "date": "2017-04-17T11:20:41-05:00"
  },
  {
    "index": 2,
    "user": {
      "id": 1,
      "displayName": "victorprens",
      "email": "victorprens@arpia.com",
      "username": "vprens",
      "urlPic": "http://static.arpia.com/imgs/img_001.jpg"
    },
    "date": "2017-05-17T11:20:41-05:00"
  }
]

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 500,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

Secured by jwt

Headers

  • Authorization: required (string)

    Used to send a valid JWT access token. In the Authorization header using the Bearer schema.

    Example:

    Bearer eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJzdWIiOiIxMjM0NTY3ODkwIiwibmFtZSI6IkpvaG4gRG9lIiwiYWRtaW4iOnRydWV9.TJVA95OrM7E2cBab30RMHrHDcEfxjoYZgeFONFh7HgQ

/discounts/{id}/changes/{index} get

A specific discount change log, a item of the discount change logs list.

get

Get information about a discount change log.

get /discounts/{id}/changes/{index}

Get information about a discount change log.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • id: required (number)

    Discount ID is required.

  • index: required (number)

    discount change log index is required.

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

HTTP status code 200

Successfull request.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • index: required (integer)
  • user: required (object)
    • id: required (number)
    • displayName: required (string)
    • email: required (string)
    • username: (string)
    • urlPic: (string)
  • date: required (datetime)

Example:

{
  "index": 1,
  "user": {
    "id": 1,
    "displayName": "victorprens",
    "email": "victorprens@arpia.com",
    "username": "vprens",
    "urlPic": "http://static.arpia.com/imgs/img_001.jpg"
  },
  "date": "2017-04-17T11:20:41-05:00"
}

HTTP status code 400

The server cannot or will not process the request due to something that is perceived to be a client error (e.g., malformed request syntax, invalid request message framing, or deceptive request routing).

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 400,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 404

The origin server did not find a current representation for the target resource or is not willing to disclose that one exists.

Resource not found, specifically occurs when a route is poorly specified, make sure that the resource ID are needing is correct.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 404,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 500

The server encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request.

If an error occurred on the server, the required operation could not be performed, sorry.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 500,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

Secured by jwt

Headers

  • Authorization: required (string)

    Used to send a valid JWT access token. In the Authorization header using the Bearer schema.

    Example:

    Bearer eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJzdWIiOiIxMjM0NTY3ODkwIiwibmFtZSI6IkpvaG4gRG9lIiwiYWRtaW4iOnRydWV9.TJVA95OrM7E2cBab30RMHrHDcEfxjoYZgeFONFh7HgQ

Dismissals

This resource contains all the necessary operations for the management of the dismissals, among these operations we will have HTTP methods to get all the elements, to get a single element, to add new elements to the resource, to edit the existing elements and finally to eliminate.

/dismissals get post

get

Get a list of all dismissals.

post

Add a new dismissal.

get /dismissals

Get a list of all dismissals.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

Query Parameters

  • messengerId: required (number)

    The messenger ID

    Example:

    5

HTTP status code 200

Successfull request.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: array of Dismissal

Items: Dismissal

  • id: (number)
  • dismissal: required (boolean)
  • reason: required (string)
  • messengerId: required (number)
  • register: (datetime)

Example:

[
  {
    "id": 1,
    "dismissal": true,
    "reason": "This is a reason",
    "messengerId": 1,
    "register": "2017-04-17T20:30:00.000Z"
  },
  {
    "id": 2,
    "dismissal": false,
    "reason": "This is a reason",
    "messengerId": 2,
    "register": "2017-04-23T20:30:00.000Z"
  }
]

HTTP status code 404

The origin server did not find a current representation for the target resource or is not willing to disclose that one exists.

Resource not found, specifically occurs when a route is poorly specified, make sure that the resource ID are needing is correct.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 404,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 500

The server encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request.

If an error occurred on the server, the required operation could not be performed, sorry.

Media type: application/json

Add a new dismissal.

  • Response
  • Security

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • id: (number)
  • dismissal: required (boolean)
  • reason: required (string)
  • messengerId: required (number)
  • register: (datetime)

Example:

{
  "dismissal": true,
  "reason": "This is a reason.",
  "messengerId": 1
}

HTTP status code 201

It has created a new dismissal.

Headers

  • Location: required (string)

    Location where you can get the information of the created dismissal.

    Example:

    http://api.arpia.com/v1/dismissals/1

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • id: (number)
  • dismissal: required (boolean)
  • reason: required (string)
  • messengerId: required (number)
  • register: (datetime)

/dismissals/{id} get put delete

A specific dismissal, a item of the dismissals list.

get

Get information about a dismissal.

put

Update information about the specific dismissal.

delete

Remove a specific dismissal.

get /dismissals/{id}

Get information about a dismissal.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • id: required (number)

    Dismissal ID is required.

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

HTTP status code 200

Successfull request.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • id: (number)
  • dismissal: required (boolean)
  • reason: required (string)
  • messengerId: required (number)
  • register: (datetime)

Example:

{
  "id": 1,
  "dismissal": true,
  "reason": "This is a reason.",
  "messengerId": 1,
  "register": "2017-04-17T20:30:00.000Z"
}

Documents

This resource contains all the necessary operations for the management of the documents, among these operations we will have HTTP methods to get all the elements, to get a single element, to add new elements to the resource, to edit the existing elements and finally to eliminate.

/documents get post

get

Get a list of all documents.

post

Add a new document.

get /documents

Get a list of all documents.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

Query Parameters

  • search: (string)

    The value to search.

  • start: (number - default: 0 - minimum: 0)

    Specify the index of first element to get

    Example:

    10
  • size: (number - minimum: 10 - maximum: 200)

    Specify the amount of items that will be retrieved per request

    Example:

    150

HTTP status code 200

Successfull request.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • items: required (array of Document)

    Items: Document

    • id: (number)
    • name: required (string)
    • description: (string)
    • expirationDate: (date-only)
    • url: required (string)
    • log: (array of DocumentLog)

      Items: DocumentLog

      • index: required (integer)
      • url: required (string)
      • registerDate: required (datetime)
    • visible: required (boolean)
  • total: required (number)

Example:

{
  "items": [
    {
      "id": 1,
      "name": "Document #1",
      "description": "This is a description",
      "expirationDate": "2017-05-15",
      "url": "http://static.arpia.com/pdf/document_123.pdf",
      "log": [
        {
          "index": 1,
          "url": "http://static.arpia.com/pdf/document_123.pdf",
          "registerDate": "2017-04-20T10:00:00.000Z"
        }
      ],
      "visible": true
    },
    {
      "id": 2,
      "name": "Document #2",
      "url": "http://static.arpia.com/pdf/document_789.pdf",
      "log": [
        {
          "index": 1,
          "url": "http://static.arpia.com/pdf/document_456.pdf",
          "registerDate": "2017-04-20T10:00:00.000Z"
        },
        {
          "index": 2,
          "url": "http://static.arpia.com/pdf/document_789.pdf",
          "registerDate": "2017-04-26T12:00:00.000Z"
        }
      ],
      "visible": false
    }
  ],
  "total": 10
}

HTTP status code 404

The origin server did not find a current representation for the target resource or is not willing to disclose that one exists.

Resource not found, specifically occurs when a route is poorly specified, make sure that the resource ID are needing is correct.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 404,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 500

The server encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request.

If an error occurred on the server, the required operation could not be performed, sorry.

Body

Media type: application/json

  • documentation: required (string)

  "messages": [

    },

      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }

Secured by jwt

Headers

  • Authorization: required (string)

    Used to send a valid JWT access token. In the Authorization header using the Bearer schema.

    Example:

    Bearer eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJzdWIiOiIxMjM0NTY3ODkwIiwibmFtZSI6IkpvaG4gRG9lIiwiYWRtaW4iOnRydWV9.TJVA95OrM7E2cBab30RMHrHDcEfxjoYZgeFONFh7HgQ

post /documents

Add a new document.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • id: (number)
  • name: required (string)
  • description: (string)
  • expirationDate: (date-only)
  • url: required (string)
  • log: (array of DocumentLog)

    Items: DocumentLog

    • index: required (integer)
    • url: required (string)
    • registerDate: required (datetime)
  • visible: required (boolean)

Example:

{
  "name": "My Document",
  "description": "This is a description.",
  "url": "http://static.arpia.com/pdf/document_123.pdf",
  "expirationDate": "2018-05-01",
  "visible": true
}

HTTP status code 201

It has created a new document.

Headers

  • Location: required (string)

    Location where you can get the information of the created document.

    Example:

    http://api.arpia.com/v1/documents/1

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • id: (number)
  • name: required (string)
  • description: (string)
  • expirationDate: (date-only)
  • url: required (string)
  • log: (array of DocumentLog)

    Items: DocumentLog

    • index: required (integer)
    • url: required (string)
    • registerDate: required (datetime)
  • visible: required (boolean)

HTTP status code 400

The server cannot or will not process the request due to something that is perceived to be a client error (e.g., malformed request syntax, invalid request message framing, or deceptive request routing).

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 400,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 404

The origin server did not find a current representation for the target resource or is not willing to disclose that one exists.

Resource not found, specifically occurs when a route is poorly specified, make sure that the resource ID are needing is correct.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 404,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 500

The server encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request.

If an error occurred on the server, the required operation could not be performed, sorry.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 500,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

Secured by jwt

Headers

  • Authorization: required (string)

    Used to send a valid JWT access token. In the Authorization header using the Bearer schema.

    Example:

    Bearer eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJzdWIiOiIxMjM0NTY3ODkwIiwibmFtZSI6IkpvaG4gRG9lIiwiYWRtaW4iOnRydWV9.TJVA95OrM7E2cBab30RMHrHDcEfxjoYZgeFONFh7HgQ

/documents/{id} get put delete

A specific document, a item of the documents list.

get

Get information about a document.

put

Update information about the specific document.

delete

Remove a specific document.

get /documents/{id}

Get information about a document.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • id: required (number)

    Document ID is required.

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

HTTP status code 200

Successfull request.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • id: (number)
  • name: required (string)
  • description: (string)
  • expirationDate: (date-only)
  • url: required (string)
  • log: (array of DocumentLog)

    Items: DocumentLog

    • index: required (integer)
    • url: required (string)
    • registerDate: required (datetime)
  • visible: required (boolean)

Example:

{
  "id": 1,
  "name": "My Document",
  "description": "This is a description.",
  "expirationDate": "2018-05-01",
  "url": "http://static.arpia.com/pdf/document_789.pdf",
  "log": [
    {
      "index": 1,
      "url": "http://static.arpia.com/pdf/document_456.pdf",
      "registerDate": "2017-04-20T10:00:00.000Z"
    },
    {
      "index": 2,
      "url": "http://static.arpia.com/pdf/document_789.pdf",
      "registerDate": "2017-04-26T12:00:00.000Z"
    }
  ],
  "visible": false
}

HTTP status code 400

The server cannot or will not process the request due to something that is perceived to be a client error (e.g., malformed request syntax, invalid request message framing, or deceptive request routing).

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 400,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

  • id: required (number)

    Document ID is required.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

  • id: required (number)

    Document ID is required.

Secured by jwt

  • Authorization: required (string)

    Used to send a valid JWT access token. In the Authorization header using the Bearer schema.

    Example:

    Bearer eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJzdWIiOiIxMjM0NTY3ODkwIiwibmFtZSI6IkpvaG4gRG9lIiwiYWRtaW4iOnRydWV9.TJVA95OrM7E2cBab30RMHrHDcEfxjoYZgeFONFh7HgQ

Domiciles

This resource contains all the necessary operations for the management of the domiciles, among these operations we will have HTTP methods to get all the elements, to get a single element, to add new elements to the resource, to edit the existing elements and finally to eliminate.

/domiciles get post

get

Get a list of all domiciles.

post

Add a new domicile.

get /domiciles

Get a list of all domiciles.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

Query Parameters

  • customer: (number)

    If you need to filter the list of home services by customers, you can provide the customer ID.

    Example:

    1084
  • operation: (number)

    If you need to filter the list of home services by operation, you can provide the ID of the operation.

    Example:

    1
  • date: (date-only)

    If you need to filter the list of home services by date, provide that date.

    Example:

    2017-04-10
  • search: (string)

    The value to search.

  • start: (number - default: 0 - minimum: 0)

    Specify the index of first element to get

    Example:

    10
  • size: (number - minimum: 10 - maximum: 200)

    Specify the amount of items that will be retrieved per request

    Example:

    150
  • orderBy: (string)

    Specify the property of the object be sorted.

  • orderType: (one of ASC, DESC - default: ASC)

    Specify whether to sort ascending or descending

HTTP status code 200

Successfull request.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • items: required (array of Domicile)

    Items: Domicile

    • id: (number)
    • customerId: required (number)
    • operationId: required (number)
    • locations: required (array of Location)

      Items: Location

      • index: (integer)
      • address: required (string)
      • reference: (string)
      • coordinates: (object)
        • latitude: required (number)
        • longitude: required (number)
      • task: required (string)
    • rating: required (object)
      • trustLevel: required (integer - default: 1 - minimum: 1 - maximum: 5)
      • priority: required (one of NORMAL, HIGH - default: NORMAL)
    • requirements: required (object)
      • cashRequired: required (number - default: 0)
      • monitoring: required (boolean - default: false)
    • periodicity: (object)
      • time: required (time-only)
      • startDate: required (date-only)
      • endDate: required (date-only)
      • type: required (string)
    • createDate: (datetime)
  • total: required (number)

Example:

{
  "items": [
    {
      "id": 1,
      "customerId": 1,
      "operationId": 1,
      "locations": [
        {
          "index": 1,
          "address": "CRA 45",
          "reference": "This is a reference.",
          "coordinates": {
            "latitude": 10.4237186,
            "longitude": -75.5456146
          },
          "task": "This is taks."
        },
        {
          "index": 2,
          "address": "CRA 85",
          "reference": "This is a reference.",
          "task": "This is taks."
        }
      ],
      "rating": {
        "trustLevel": 3,
        "priority": "NORMAL"
      },
      "requirements": {
        "cashRequired": 0,
        "monitoring": false
      },
      "createDate": "2017-04-20T12:32:00.000Z"
    },
    {
      "id": 2,
      "customerId": 2,
      "operationId": 1,
      "locations": [
        {
          "index": 1,
          "address": "CRA 45",
          "reference": "This is a reference.",
          "task": "This is taks."
        },
        {
          "index": 2,
          "address": "CRA 85",
          "reference": "This is a reference.",
          "task": "This is taks."
        }
      ],
      "rating": {
        "trustLevel": 5,
        "priority": "HIGH"
      },
      "requirements": {
        "cashRequired": 0,
        "monitoring": true
      },
      "createDate": "2017-04-20T12:32:00.000Z",
      "periodicity": {
        "type": "monthlyRepeatData",
        "time": "12:30:00",
        "startDate": "2017-01-01",
        "endDate": "2017-12-31",
        "every": 1,
        "dayOfMonth": 15
      }
    }
  ],
  "total": 10
}

HTTP status code 404

The origin server did not find a current representation for the target resource or is not willing to disclose that one exists.

Resource not found, specifically occurs when a route is poorly specified, make sure that the resource ID are needing is correct.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 404,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

The server encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request.

If an error occurred on the server, the required operation could not be performed, sorry.
