    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

Secured by jwt

  • Authorization: required (string)

    Used to send a valid JWT access token. In the Authorization header using the Bearer schema.

    Example:

    Bearer eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJzdWIiOiIxMjM0NTY3ODkwIiwibmFtZSI6IkpvaG4gRG9lIiwiYWRtaW4iOnRydWV9.TJVA95OrM7E2cBab30RMHrHDcEfxjoYZgeFONFh7HgQ

post /domiciles

Add a new domicile.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • id: (number)
  • customerId: required (number)
  • operationId: required (number)
  • locations: required (array of Location)

    Items: Location

    • index: (integer)
    • address: required (string)
    • reference: (string)
    • coordinates: (object)
      • latitude: required (number)
      • longitude: required (number)
    • task: required (string)
  • rating: required (object)
    • trustLevel: required (integer - default: 1 - minimum: 1 - maximum: 5)
    • priority: required (one of NORMAL, HIGH - default: NORMAL)
  • requirements: required (object)
    • cashRequired: required (number - default: 0)
    • monitoring: required (boolean - default: false)
  • periodicity: (object)
    • time: required (time-only)
    • startDate: required (date-only)
    • endDate: required (date-only)
    • type: required (string)
  • createDate: (datetime)

Example:

{
  "customerId": 1,
  "operationId": 1,
  "locations": [
    {
      "index": 1,
      "address": "CRA 45",
      "reference": "This is a reference.",
      "coordinates": {
        "latitude": 10.4237186,
        "longitude": -75.5456146
      },
      "task": "This is taks."
    },
    {
      "index": 2,
      "address": "CRA 85",
      "reference": "This is a reference.",
      "task": "This is taks."
    }
  ],
  "rating": {
    "trustLevel": 3,
    "priority": "NORMAL"
  },
  "requirements": {
    "cashRequired": 0,
    "monitoring": false
  }
}

HTTP status code 201

It has created a new domicile.

Headers

  • Location: required (string)

    Location where you can get the information of the created domicile.

    Example:

    http://api.arpia.com/v1/domiciles/1

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • id: (number)
  • customerId: required (number)
  • operationId: required (number)
  • locations: required (array of Location)

    Items: Location

    • index: (integer)
    • address: required (string)
    • reference: (string)
    • coordinates: (object)
      • latitude: required (number)
      • longitude: required (number)
    • task: required (string)
  • rating: required (object)
    • trustLevel: required (integer - default: 1 - minimum: 1 - maximum: 5)
    • priority: required (one of NORMAL, HIGH - default: NORMAL)
  • requirements: required (object)
    • cashRequired: required (number - default: 0)
    • monitoring: required (boolean - default: false)
  • periodicity: (object)
    • time: required (time-only)
    • startDate: required (date-only)
    • endDate: required (date-only)
    • type: required (string)
  • createDate: (datetime)

HTTP status code 400

The server cannot or will not process the request due to something that is perceived to be a client error (e.g., malformed request syntax, invalid request message framing, or deceptive request routing).

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 400,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 404

The origin server did not find a current representation for the target resource or is not willing to disclose that one exists.

Resource not found, specifically occurs when a route is poorly specified, make sure that the resource ID are needing is correct.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 404,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 500

The server encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request.

If an error occurred on the server, the required operation could not be performed, sorry.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 500,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

Secured by jwt

Headers

  • Authorization: required (string)

    Used to send a valid JWT access token. In the Authorization header using the Bearer schema.

    Example:

    Bearer eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJzdWIiOiIxMjM0NTY3ODkwIiwibmFtZSI6IkpvaG4gRG9lIiwiYWRtaW4iOnRydWV9.TJVA95OrM7E2cBab30RMHrHDcEfxjoYZgeFONFh7HgQ

/domiciles/{id} get put

A specific home service, a item of the home services list.

get

Get information about a home service.

put

Update information about the specific home service.

get /domiciles/{id}

Get information about a home service.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • id: required (number)

    Domicile ID is required.

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

HTTP status code 200

Successfull request.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • id: (number)
  • customerId: required (number)
  • operationId: required (number)
  • locations: required (array of Location)

    Items: Location

    • index: (integer)
    • address: required (string)
    • reference: (string)
    • coordinates: (object)
      • latitude: required (number)
      • longitude: required (number)
    • task: required (string)
  • rating: required (object)
    • trustLevel: required (integer - default: 1 - minimum: 1 - maximum: 5)
    • priority: required (one of NORMAL, HIGH - default: NORMAL)
  • requirements: required (object)
    • cashRequired: required (number - default: 0)
    • monitoring: required (boolean - default: false)
  • periodicity: (object)
    • time: required (time-only)
    • startDate: required (date-only)
    • endDate: required (date-only)
    • type: required (string)
  • createDate: (datetime)

Example:

{
  "id": 1,
  "customerId": 1,
  "operationId": 1,
  "locations": [
    {
      "index": 1,
      "address": "CRA 45 # 15-32",
      "reference": "This is a reference.",
      "coordinates": {
        "latitude": 10.4237186,
        "longitude": -75.5456146
      },
      "task": "This is taks."
    },
    {
      "index": 2,
      "address": "CRA 85 # 32-15",
      "reference": "This is a reference.",
      "task": "This is taks."
    }
  ],
  "rating": {
    "trustLevel": 3,
    "priority": "NORMAL"
  },
  "requirements": {
    "cashRequired": 0,
    "monitoring": false
  },
  "createDate": "2017-04-20T12:32:00.000Z",
  "periodicity": {
    "type": "monthlyRepeatData",
    "time": "12:30:00",
    "startDate": "2017-01-01",
    "endDate": "2017-12-31",
    "every": 1,
    "dayOfMonth": 15
  }
}

HTTP status code 400

The server cannot or will not process the request due to something that is perceived to be a client error (e.g., malformed request syntax, invalid request message framing, or deceptive request routing).

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 400,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 404

The origin server did not find a current representation for the target resource or is not willing to disclose that one exists.

Resource not found, specifically occurs when a route is poorly specified, make sure that the resource ID are needing is correct.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 404,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 500

The server encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request.

If an error occurred on the server, the required operation could not be performed, sorry.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    • message: required (string)

  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."

    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

Secured by jwt

Headers

  • Authorization: required (string)

    Used to send a valid JWT access token. In the Authorization header using the Bearer schema.

    Example:

    Bearer eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJzdWIiOiIxMjM0NTY3ODkwIiwibmFtZSI6IkpvaG4gRG9lIiwiYWRtaW4iOnRydWV9.TJVA95OrM7E2cBab30RMHrHDcEfxjoYZgeFONFh7HgQ

put /domiciles/{id}

Update information about the specific home service.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • id: required (number)

    Domicile ID is required.

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • id: (number)
  • customerId: required (number)
  • operationId: required (number)
  • locations: required (array of Location)

    Items: Location

    • index: (integer)
    • address: required (string)
    • reference: (string)
    • coordinates: (object)
      • latitude: required (number)
      • longitude: required (number)
    • task: required (string)
  • rating: required (object)
    • trustLevel: required (integer - default: 1 - minimum: 1 - maximum: 5)
    • priority: required (one of NORMAL, HIGH - default: NORMAL)
  • requirements: required (object)
    • cashRequired: required (number - default: 0)
    • monitoring: required (boolean - default: false)
  • periodicity: (object)
    • time: required (time-only)
    • startDate: required (date-only)
    • endDate: required (date-only)
    • type: required (string)
  • createDate: (datetime)

HTTP status code 200

It has updated a home service.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • id: (number)
  • customerId: required (number)
  • operationId: required (number)
  • locations: required (array of Location)

    Items: Location

    • index: (integer)
    • address: required (string)
    • reference: (string)
    • coordinates: (object)
      • latitude: required (number)
      • longitude: required (number)
    • task: required (string)
  • rating: required (object)
    • trustLevel: required (integer - default: 1 - minimum: 1 - maximum: 5)
    • priority: required (one of NORMAL, HIGH - default: NORMAL)
  • requirements: required (object)
    • cashRequired: required (number - default: 0)
    • monitoring: required (boolean - default: false)
  • periodicity: (object)
    • time: required (time-only)
    • startDate: required (date-only)
    • endDate: required (date-only)
    • type: required (string)
  • createDate: (datetime)

Example:

{
  "id": 1,
  "customerId": 1,
  "operationId": 1,
  "locations": [
    {
      "index": 1,
      "address": "CRA 45 # 15-32",
      "reference": "This is a reference.",
      "coordinates": {
        "latitude": 10.4237186,
        "longitude": -75.5456146
      },
      "task": "This is taks."
    },
    {
      "index": 2,
      "address": "CRA 85 # 32-15",
      "reference": "This is a reference.",
      "task": "This is taks."
    }
  ],
  "rating": {
    "trustLevel": 3,
    "priority": "NORMAL"
  },
  "requirements": {
    "cashRequired": 0,
    "monitoring": false
  },
  "createDate": "2017-04-20T12:32:00.000Z",
  "periodicity": {
    "type": "monthlyRepeatData",
    "time": "12:30:00",
    "startDate": "2017-01-01",
    "endDate": "2017-12-31",
    "every": 1,
    "dayOfMonth": 15
  }
}

/domiciles/{id}/execute post

post

Execute an existing home service.

post /domiciles/{id}/execute

Execute an existing home service.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • id: required (number)

    Domicile ID is required.

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • automatic: required (boolean)

Example:

{
  "automatic": true
}

HTTP status code 200

The executed home service.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • id: (number)
  • assignments: (array of Assignment)

    Items: Assignment

    • index: required (integer)
    • messengerId: required (number)
    • registerDate: required (datetime)
  • price: required (number)
  • messengerGain: required (number)
  • discount: (number)
  • status: (one of WAITING, DISPATCHED, FINALIZED)
  • automatic: required (boolean)
  • startDate: (datetime)
  • finishDate: (datetime)
  • cancelDate: (datetime)
  • cancelReason: (string)
  • domicile: required (number | Domicile)

HTTP status code 400

The server cannot or will not process the request due to something that is perceived to be a client error (e.g., malformed request syntax, invalid request message framing, or deceptive request routing).

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 400,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 404

The origin server did not find a current representation for the target resource or is not willing to disclose that one exists.

Resource not found, specifically occurs when a route is poorly specified, make sure that the resource ID are needing is correct.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 404,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."

    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]

HTTP status code 500

The server encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request.

If an error occurred on the server, the required operation could not be performed, sorry.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

Secured by jwt

  • Authorization: required (string)

    Used to send a valid JWT access token. In the Authorization header using the Bearer schema.

    Example:

    Bearer eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJzdWIiOiIxMjM0NTY3ODkwIiwibmFtZSI6IkpvaG4gRG9lIiwiYWRtaW4iOnRydWV9.TJVA95OrM7E2cBab30RMHrHDcEfxjoYZgeFONFh7HgQ

Domicile Executes

This resource contains all the necessary operations for the management of the domicilesexe, among these operations we will have HTTP methods to get all the elements, to get a single element, to add new elements to the resource, to edit the existing elements and finally to eliminate.

/domicilesexe get post

get

Get a list of all domicilesexe.

post

Execute an existing home service.

get /domicilesexe

Get a list of all domicilesexe.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

Query Parameters

  • state: (one of WAITING, DISPATCHED, FINALIZED, CANCELLED)

    If you need to get the home services from your state, you can do so through this parameter.

  • customer: (number)

    If you need to filter the list of home services by customers, you can provide the customer ID.

    Example:

    1084
  • gender: (one of MALE, FEMALE)

    You can filter the list of home services from the gender of the client, for example you can get all the home services where the client is female.

    Example:

    FEMALE
  • auto: (boolean)

    You can filter all home services that were automatically dispatched and those that did not.

    Example:

    true
  • operator: (number)

    If you need to filter the list of home services by the operator who dispatches, you can provide the operator ID via this parameter.

    Example:

    103
  • dispatcher: (number)

    If you need to filter the home services list by the dispatcher ID, you can provide the ID by this parameter.

    Example:

    1003
  • operation: (number)

    If you need to filter the list of home services by operation, you can provide the ID of the operation.

    Example:

    1
  • from: (date-only)

    Specifies the start date of the filter.

    Example:

    2015-07-30
  • to: (date-only)

    Specifies the end date of the filter.

    Example:

    2017-12-31
  • search: (string)

    The value to search.

  • start: (number - default: 0 - minimum: 0)

    Specify the index of first element to get

    Example:

    10
  • size: (number - minimum: 10 - maximum: 200)

    Specify the amount of items that will be retrieved per request

    Example:

    150
  • orderBy: (string)

    Specify the property of the object be sorted.

  • orderType: (one of ASC, DESC - default: ASC)

    Specify whether to sort ascending or descending

HTTP status code 200

Successfull request.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • items: required (array of DomicileExecute)

    Items: DomicileExecute

    • id: (number)
    • assignments: (array of Assignment)

      Items: Assignment

      • index: required (integer)
      • messengerId: required (number)
      • registerDate: required (datetime)
    • price: required (number)
    • messengerGain: required (number)
    • discount: (number)
    • status: (one of WAITING, DISPATCHED, FINALIZED)
    • automatic: required (boolean)
    • startDate: (datetime)
    • finishDate: (datetime)
    • cancelDate: (datetime)
    • cancelReason: (string)
    • domicile: required (number | Domicile)
  • total: required (number)

Example:

{
  "items": [
    {
      "id": 1,
      "assignments": [
        {
          "index": 1,
          "messengerId": 1,
          "registerDate": "2017-04-20T12:30:00.000Z"
        }
      ],
      "status": "DISPATCHED",
      "price": 10000,
      "messengerGain": 5000,
      "automatic": true,
      "startDate": "2017-04-20T12:35:00.000Z",
      "domicile": {
        "id": 1,
        "customerId": 1,
        "operationId": 1,
        "locations": [
          {
            "index": 1,
            "address": "CRA 45 # 15-32",
            "reference": "This is a reference.",
            "coordinates": {
              "latitude": 10.4237186,
              "longitude": -75.5456146
            },
            "task": "This is taks."
          },
          {
            "index": 2,
            "address": "CRA 85 # 32-15",
            "reference": "This is a reference.",
            "task": "This is taks."
          }
        ],
        "rating": {
          "trustLevel": 3,
          "priority": "NORMAL"
        },
        "requirements": {
          "cashRequired": 0,
          "monitoring": false
        },
        "createDate": "2017-04-20T12:32:00.000Z",
        "periodicity": {
          "type": "monthlyRepeatData",
          "time": "12:30:00",
          "startDate": "2017-01-01",
          "endDate": "2017-12-31",
          "every": 1,
          "dayOfMonth": 15
        }
      }
    },
    {
      "id": 2,
      "assignments": [
        {
          "index": 1,
          "messengerId": 1,
          "registerDate": "2017-04-20T12:30:00.000Z"
        },
        {
          "index": 2,
          "messengerId": 2,
          "registerDate": "2017-04-20T12:30:00.000Z"
        }
      ],
      "status": "FINALIZED",
      "price": 10000,
      "messengerGain": 5000,
      "automatic": true,
      "startDate": "2017-04-20T12:35:00.000Z",
      "finishDate": "2017-04-20T12:53:00.000Z",
      "domicile": {
        "id": 1,
        "customerId": 1,
        "operationId": 1,
        "locations": [
          {
            "index": 1,
            "address": "CRA 45 # 15-32",
            "reference": "This is a reference.",
            "coordinates": {
              "latitude": 10.4237186,
              "longitude": -75.5456146
            },
            "task": "This is taks."
          },
          {
            "index": 2,
            "address": "CRA 85 # 32-15",
            "reference": "This is a reference.",
            "task": "This is taks."
          }
        ],
        "rating": {
          "trustLevel": 3,
          "priority": "NORMAL"
        },
        "requirements": {
          "cashRequired": 0,
          "monitoring": false
        },
        "createDate": "2017-04-20T12:32:00.000Z",
        "periodicity": {
          "type": "monthlyRepeatData",
          "time": "12:30:00",
          "startDate": "2017-01-01",
          "endDate": "2017-12-31",
          "every": 1,
          "dayOfMonth": 15
        }
      }
    }
  ],
  "total": 10
}

HTTP status code 404

The origin server did not find a current representation for the target resource or is not willing to disclose that one exists.

Resource not found, specifically occurs when a route is poorly specified, make sure that the resource ID are needing is correct.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 404,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]

Secured by jwt

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • id: (number)
  • assignments: (array of Assignment)

    Items: Assignment

    • index: required (integer)
    • messengerId: required (number)
    • registerDate: required (datetime)
  • price: required (number)
  • messengerGain: required (number)
  • discount: (number)
  • status: (one of WAITING, DISPATCHED, FINALIZED)
  • automatic: required (boolean)
  • startDate: (datetime)
  • finishDate: (datetime)
  • cancelDate: (datetime)
  • cancelReason: (string)
  • domicile: required (number | Domicile)

Example:

{
  "automatic": true,
  "domicile": 1,
  "price": 10000,
  "messengerGain": 5000
}

HTTP status code 201

It has created a new domicilesexe.

Headers

  • Location: required (string)

    Location where you can get the information of the created domicilesexe.

    Example:

    http://api.arpia.com/v1/domicilesexe/1

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • id: (number)
  • assignments: (array of Assignment)

    Items: Assignment

    • index: required (integer)
    • messengerId: required (number)
    • registerDate: required (datetime)
  • price: required (number)
  • messengerGain: required (number)
  • discount: (number)
  • status: (one of WAITING, DISPATCHED, FINALIZED)
  • automatic: required (boolean)
  • startDate: (datetime)
  • finishDate: (datetime)
  • cancelDate: (datetime)
  • cancelReason: (string)
  • domicile: required (number | Domicile)

Example:

{
  "id": 1,
  "assignments": [
    {
      "index": 1,
      "messengerId": 1,
      "registerDate": "2017-04-20T12:30:00.000Z"
    }
  ],
  "status": "DISPATCHED",
  "price": 10000,
  "messengerGain": 5000,
  "automatic": true,
  "startDate": "2017-04-20T12:35:00.000Z",
  "domicile": {
    "id": 1,
    "customerId": 1,
    "operationId": 1,
    "locations": [
      {
        "index": 1,
        "address": "CRA 45 # 15-32",
        "reference": "This is a reference.",
        "coordinates": {
          "latitude": 10.4237186,
          "longitude": -75.5456146
        },
        "task": "This is taks."
      },
      {
        "index": 2,
        "address": "CRA 85 # 32-15",
        "reference": "This is a reference.",
        "task": "This is taks."
      }
    ],
    "rating": {
      "trustLevel": 3,
      "priority": "NORMAL"
    },
    "requirements": {
      "cashRequired": 0,
      "monitoring": false
    },
    "createDate": "2017-04-20T12:32:00.000Z",
    "periodicity": {
      "type": "monthlyRepeatData",
      "time": "12:30:00",
      "startDate": "2017-01-01",
      "endDate": "2017-12-31",
      "every": 1,
      "dayOfMonth": 15
    }
  }
}

HTTP status code 400

The server cannot or will not process the request due to something that is perceived to be a client error (e.g., malformed request syntax, invalid request message framing, or deceptive request routing).

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 400,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 404

The origin server did not find a current representation for the target resource or is not willing to disclose that one exists.

Resource not found, specifically occurs when a route is poorly specified, make sure that the resource ID are needing is correct.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 404,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 500

The server encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request.

If an error occurred on the server, the required operation could not be performed, sorry.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 500,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

Secured by jwt

Headers

  • Authorization: required (string)

    Used to send a valid JWT access token. In the Authorization header using the Bearer schema.

    Example:

    Bearer eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJzdWIiOiIxMjM0NTY3ODkwIiwibmFtZSI6IkpvaG4gRG9lIiwiYWRtaW4iOnRydWV9.TJVA95OrM7E2cBab30RMHrHDcEfxjoYZgeFONFh7HgQ

/domicilesexe/{id} get

A specific domicile execute, a item of the executed domiciles list.

get

Get information about a domicile execute.

get /domicilesexe/{id}

Get information about a domicile execute.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • id: required (number)

    Domicile execute ID is required.

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

HTTP status code 200

Successfull request.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • id: (number)
  • assignments: (array of Assignment)

    Items: Assignment

    • index: required (integer)
    • messengerId: required (number)
    • registerDate: required (datetime)
  • price: required (number)
  • messengerGain: required (number)
  • discount: (number)
  • status: (one of WAITING, DISPATCHED, FINALIZED)
  • automatic: required (boolean)
  • startDate: (datetime)
  • finishDate: (datetime)
  • cancelDate: (datetime)
  • cancelReason: (string)
  • domicile: required (number | Domicile)

Example:

{
  "id": 1,
  "assignments": [
    {
      "index": 1,
      "messengerId": 1,
      "registerDate": "2017-04-20T12:30:00.000Z"
    }
  ],
  "status": "DISPATCHED",
  "price": 10000,
  "messengerGain": 5000,
  "automatic": true,
  "startDate": "2017-04-20T12:35:00.000Z",
  "domicile": {
    "id": 1,
    "customerId": 1,
    "operationId": 1,
    "locations": [
      {
        "index": 1,
        "address": "CRA 45 # 15-32",
        "reference": "This is a reference.",
        "coordinates": {
          "latitude": 10.4237186,
          "longitude": -75.5456146
        },
        "task": "This is taks."
      },
      {
        "index": 2,
        "address": "CRA 85 # 32-15",
        "reference": "This is a reference.",
        "task": "This is taks."
      }
    ],
    "rating": {
      "trustLevel": 3,
      "priority": "NORMAL"
    },
    "requirements": {
      "cashRequired": 0,
      "monitoring": false
    },
    "createDate": "2017-04-20T12:32:00.000Z",
    "periodicity": {
      "type": "monthlyRepeatData",
      "time": "12:30:00",
      "startDate": "2017-01-01",
      "endDate": "2017-12-31",
      "every": 1,
      "dayOfMonth": 15
    }
  }
}

/domicilesexe/{id}/cancel put

put

This request is made to cancel a executed domicile.

put /domicilesexe/{id}/cancel

This request is made to cancel a executed domicile.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • id: required (number)

    Domicile execute ID is required.

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "message": "This is a message for cancel a domicile execute."
}

HTTP status code 200

Successfull request.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • id: (number)
  • assignments: (array of Assignment)

    Items: Assignment

    • index: required (integer)
    • messengerId: required (number)
    • registerDate: required (datetime)
  • price: required (number)
  • messengerGain: required (number)
  • discount: (number)
  • status: (one of WAITING, DISPATCHED, FINALIZED)
  • automatic: required (boolean)
  • startDate: (datetime)
  • finishDate: (datetime)
  • cancelDate: (datetime)
  • cancelReason: (string)
  • domicile: required (number | Domicile)

Example:

{
  "id": 1,
  "assignments": [
    {
      "index": 1,
      "messengerId": 1,
      "registerDate": "2017-04-20T12:30:00.000Z"
    }
  ],
  "status": "FINALIZED",
  "price": 10000,
  "messengerGain": 5000,
  "automatic": true,
  "startDate": "2017-04-20T12:35:00.000Z",
  "cancelDate": "2017-04-20T12:37:00.000Z",
  "cancelReason": "This is a message for cancel a domicile execute.",
  "domicile": {
    "id": 1,
    "customerId": 1,
    "operationId": 1,
    "locations": [
      {
        "index": 1,
        "address": "CRA 45 # 15-32",
        "reference": "This is a reference.",
        "coordinates": {
          "latitude": 10.4237186,
          "longitude": -75.5456146
        },
        "task": "This is taks."
      },
      {
        "index": 2,
        "address": "CRA 85 # 32-15",
        "reference": "This is a reference.",
        "task": "This is taks."
      }
    ],
    "rating": {
      "trustLevel": 3,
      "priority": "NORMAL"
    },
    "requirements": {
      "cashRequired": 0,
      "monitoring": false
    },
    "createDate": "2017-04-20T12:32:00.000Z",
    "periodicity": {
      "type": "monthlyRepeatData",
      "time": "12:30:00",
      "startDate": "2017-01-01",
      "endDate": "2017-12-31",
      "every": 1,
      "dayOfMonth": 15
    }
  }
}

put

This request is made to finish a executed domicile.

put /domicilesexe/{id}/finish

This request is made to finish a executed domicile.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • id: required (number)

    Domicile execute ID is required.

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

HTTP status code 200

Successfull request.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • id: (number)
  • assignments: (array of Assignment)

    Items: Assignment

    • index: required (integer)
    • messengerId: required (number)
    • registerDate: required (datetime)
  • price: required (number)
  • messengerGain: required (number)
  • discount: (number)
  • status: (one of WAITING, DISPATCHED, FINALIZED)
  • automatic: required (boolean)
  • startDate: (datetime)
  • finishDate: (datetime)
  • cancelDate: (datetime)
  • cancelReason: (string)
  • domicile: required (number | Domicile)

Example:

{
  "id": 1,
  "assignments": [
    {
      "index": 1,
      "messengerId": 1,
      "registerDate": "2017-04-20T12:30:00.000Z"
    }
  ],
  "status": "FINALIZED",
  "price": 10000,
  "messengerGain": 5000,
  "automatic": true,
  "startDate": "2017-04-20T12:35:00.000Z",
  "finishDate": "2017-04-20T12:53:00.000Z",
  "domicile": {
    "id": 1,
    "customerId": 1,
    "operationId": 1,
    "locations": [
      {
        "index": 1,
        "address": "CRA 45 # 15-32",
        "reference": "This is a reference.",
        "coordinates": {
          "latitude": 10.4237186,
          "longitude": -75.5456146
        },
        "task": "This is taks."
      },
      {
        "index": 2,
        "address": "CRA 85 # 32-15",
        "reference": "This is a reference.",
        "task": "This is taks."
      }
    ],
    "rating": {
      "trustLevel": 3,
      "priority": "NORMAL"
    },
    "requirements": {
      "cashRequired": 0,
      "monitoring": false
    },
    "createDate": "2017-04-20T12:32:00.000Z",
    "periodicity": {
      "type": "monthlyRepeatData",

      "startDate": "2017-01-01",

/domicilesexe/{id}/assignments get post

This resource contains all the necessary operations for the management of the assignments, among these operations we will have HTTP methods to get all the elements, to get a single element, to add new elements to the resource, to edit the existing elements and finally to eliminate.

get

Get a list of all assignments.

post

Add a new assignment.

get /domicilesexe/{id}/assignments

Get a list of all assignments.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • id: required (number)

    Domicile execute ID is required.

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

HTTP status code 200

Successfull request.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: array of AssignmentResponse

Items: AssignmentResponse

  • index: required (integer)
  • messenger: required (object)
    • id: required (number)
    • identification: required (string)
    • name: required (string)
    • lastName: required (string)
    • gender: (one of MALE, FEMALE)
    • birthday: (date-only)
    • photo: required (string)
    • category: (number)
  • registerDate: required (datetime)

Example:

[
  {
    "index": 1,
    "messenger": {
      "id": 1,
      "identification": "12346798",
      "name": "Jhon",
      "lastName": "Doe",
      "gender": "MALE",
      "birthday": "1993-02-11",
      "photo": "http://static.arpia.com/imgs/img_001.jpg",
      "category": 5
    },
    "registerDate": "2017-05-01T12:30:00.000Z"
  },
  {
    "index": 2,
    "messenger": {
      "id": 1,
      "identification": "12346798",
      "name": "Jhon",
      "lastName": "Doe",
      "gender": "MALE",
      "birthday": "1993-02-11",
      "photo": "http://static.arpia.com/imgs/img_001.jpg",
      "category": 5
    },
    "registerDate": "2017-05-01T12:36:45.000Z"
  }
]

HTTP status code 404

The origin server did not find a current representation for the target resource or is not willing to disclose that one exists.

Resource not found, specifically occurs when a route is poorly specified, make sure that the resource ID are needing is correct.

Body

Media type: application/json

  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)

  "statusCode": 404,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

    Used to send a valid JWT access token. In the Authorization header using the Bearer schema.

    Example:

    Bearer eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJzdWIiOiIxMjM0NTY3ODkwIiwibmFtZSI6IkpvaG4gRG9lIiwiYWRtaW4iOnRydWV9.TJVA95OrM7E2cBab30RMHrHDcEfxjoYZgeFONFh7HgQ

post /domicilesexe/{id}/assignments

Add a new assignment.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • id: required (number)

    Domicile execute ID is required.

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • messengerId: required (number)

Example:

{
  "messengerId": 1
}

HTTP status code 201

It has created a new assignment.

Headers

  • Location: required (string)

    Location where you can get the information of the created assignment.

    Example:

    http://api.arpia.com/v1/assignments/1

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • index: required (integer)
  • messenger: required (object)
    • id: required (number)
    • identification: required (string)
    • name: required (string)
    • lastName: required (string)
    • gender: (one of MALE, FEMALE)
    • birthday: (date-only)
    • photo: required (string)
    • category: (number)
  • registerDate: required (datetime)

Example:

{
  "index": 1,
  "messenger": {
    "id": 1,
    "identification": "12346798",
    "name": "Jhon",
    "lastName": "Doe",
    "gender": "MALE",
    "birthday": "1993-02-11",
    "photo": "http://static.arpia.com/imgs/img_001.jpg",
    "category": 5
  },
  "registerDate": "2017-05-01T12:30:00.000Z"
}

HTTP status code 400

The server cannot or will not process the request due to something that is perceived to be a client error (e.g., malformed request syntax, invalid request message framing, or deceptive request routing).

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 400,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 404

The origin server did not find a current representation for the target resource or is not willing to disclose that one exists.

Resource not found, specifically occurs when a route is poorly specified, make sure that the resource ID are needing is correct.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 404,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 500

The server encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request.

If an error occurred on the server, the required operation could not be performed, sorry.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 500,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

Secured by jwt

Headers

  • Authorization: required (string)

    Used to send a valid JWT access token. In the Authorization header using the Bearer schema.

    Example:

    Bearer eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJzdWIiOiIxMjM0NTY3ODkwIiwibmFtZSI6IkpvaG4gRG9lIiwiYWRtaW4iOnRydWV9.TJVA95OrM7E2cBab30RMHrHDcEfxjoYZgeFONFh7HgQ

/domicilesexe/{id}/assignments/{index} get

A specific assigment, a item of the assignments list.

get

Get information about a assignment.

get /domicilesexe/{id}/assignments/{index}

Get information about a assignment.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • id: required (number)

    Domicile execute ID is required.

  • index: required (number)

    Assignment INDEX is required.

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

HTTP status code 200

Successfull request.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • index: required (integer)
  • messenger: required (object)
    • id: required (number)
    • identification: required (string)
    • name: required (string)
    • lastName: required (string)
    • gender: (one of MALE, FEMALE)
    • birthday: (date-only)
    • photo: required (string)
    • category: (number)
  • registerDate: required (datetime)

/domicilesexe/{id}/pdf get

get

This request is made to generate an order of an executed domicile.

get /domicilesexe/{id}/pdf

This request is made to generate an order of an executed domicile.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • id: required (number)

    Domicile execute ID is required.

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

  • Content-Disposition: (string)

    It is a header indicating if the content is expected to be displayed inline in the browser, that is, as a Web page or as part of a Web page, or as an attachment, that is downloaded and saved locally.

HTTP status code 200

Successfull request.

Body

Media type: application/pdf

Type: object

HTTP status code 400

The server cannot or will not process the request due to something that is perceived to be a client error (e.g., malformed request syntax, invalid request message framing, or deceptive request routing).

    Used to send a valid JWT access token. In the Authorization header using the Bearer schema.

    Example:

    Bearer eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJzdWIiOiIxMjM0NTY3ODkwIiwibmFtZSI6IkpvaG4gRG9lIiwiYWRtaW4iOnRydWV9.TJVA95OrM7E2cBab30RMHrHDcEfxjoYZgeFONFh7HgQ

Domicile Reviews

This resource contains all the necessary operations for the management of the domicilereviews, among these operations we will have HTTP methods to get all the elements, to get a single element, to add new elements to the resource, to edit the existing elements and finally to eliminate.

/domicilereviews get post

get

Get a list of all domicilereviews.

post

Add a new domicilereview.

get /domicilereviews

Get a list of all domicilereviews.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

Query Parameters

  • domicileExe: (number)

    Domicile Execute ID to filter the request.

  • start: (number - default: 0 - minimum: 0)

    Specify the index of first element to get

    Example:

    10
  • size: (number - minimum: 10 - maximum: 200)

    Specify the amount of items that will be retrieved per request

    Example:

    150

HTTP status code 200

Successfull request.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • items: required (array of DomicileReviewResponse)

    Items: DomicileReviewResponse

    • domicileExecuteId: required (number)
    • observations: required (string)
    • id: required (number)
    • registerDate: required (datetime)
    • user: required (object)
      • id: required (number)
      • displayName: required (string)
      • email: required (string)
      • username: (string)
      • urlPic: (string)
  • total: required (integer)

Example:

{
  "items": [
    {
      "id": 1,
      "user": {
        "id": 1,
        "displayName": "Ali Connors",
        "email": "aliconnors@example.com",
        "username": "ali_connors",
        "urlPic": "http://static.arpia.com/imgs/img_001.jpg"
      },
      "observations": "The domicile was executed without problems",
      "domicileExecuteId": 1,
      "registerDate": "2017-04-01T08:00:00.000Z"
    },
    {
      "id": 2,
      "user": {
        "id": 2,
        "displayName": "Peter Carlsson",
        "email": "petercarlsson@example.com",
        "username": "peter_carlsson",
        "urlPic": "http://static.arpia.com/imgs/img_002.jpg"
      },
      "observations": "The domicile was executed without problems",
      "domicileExecuteId": 2,
      "registerDate": "2017-04-01T08:00:00.000Z"
    }
  ],
  "total": 10
}

HTTP status code 404

The origin server did not find a current representation for the target resource or is not willing to disclose that one exists.

Resource not found, specifically occurs when a route is poorly specified, make sure that the resource ID are needing is correct.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 404,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

The server encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request.

If an error occurred on the server, the required operation could not be performed, sorry.

  • Authorization: required (string)

    Used to send a valid JWT access token. In the Authorization header using the Bearer schema.

    Example:

post /domicilereviews

Add a new domicilereview.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • domicileExecuteId: required (number)
  • observations: required (string)

Example:

{
  "observations": "The domicile was executed without problems",
  "domicileExecuteId": 1
}

HTTP status code 201

It has created a new domicilereview.

Headers

  • Location: required (string)

    Location where you can get the information of the created domicilereview.

    Example:

    http://api.arpia.com/v1/domicilereviews/1

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • domicileExecuteId: required (number)
  • observations: required (string)
  • id: required (number)
  • registerDate: required (datetime)
  • user: required (object)
    • id: required (number)
    • displayName: required (string)
    • email: required (string)
    • username: (string)
    • urlPic: (string)

/domicilereviews/{id} get put

A specific domicile review, a item of the domicile review list.

get

Get information about a domicile review.

put

Update information about the specific domicile review.

get /domicilereviews/{id}

Get information about a domicile review.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • id: required (number)

    DomicileReview ID is required.

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

HTTP status code 200

Successfull request.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • domicileExecuteId: required (number)
  • observations: required (string)
  • id: required (number)
  • registerDate: required (datetime)
  • user: required (object)
    • id: required (number)
    • displayName: required (string)
    • email: required (string)
    • username: (string)
    • urlPic: (string)

Example:

{
  "id": 1,
  "user": {
    "id": 1,
    "displayName": "Ali Connors",
    "email": "aliconnors@example.com",
    "username": "ali_connors",
    "urlPic": "http://static.arpia.com/imgs/img_001.jpg"
  },
  "observations": "The domicile was executed without problems",
  "domicileExecuteId": 1,
  "registerDate": "2017-04-01T08:00:00.000Z"
}

put /domicilereviews/{id}

Update information about the specific domicile review.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • id: required (number)

    DomicileReview ID is required.

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

Media type: application/json

Type: object

  • domicileExecuteId: required (number)
  • observations: required (string)

Example:

{
  "observations": "The domicile was executed without problems",
  "domicileExecuteId": 1
}

HTTP status code 200

It has updated a domicile review.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • domicileExecuteId: required (number)
  • observations: required (string)
  • id: required (number)
  • registerDate: required (datetime)
  • user: required (object)
    • id: required (number)
    • displayName: required (string)
    • email: required (string)
    • username: (string)
    • urlPic: (string)

Example:

{
  "id": 1,
  "user": {
    "id": 2,
    "displayName": "Peter Carlsson",
    "email": "petercarlsson@example.com",
    "username": "peter_carlsson",
    "urlPic": "http://static.arpia.com/imgs/img_002.jpg"
  },
  "observations": "The domicile was executed without problems",
  "domicileExecuteId": 1,
  "registerDate": "2017-04-01T08:00:00.000Z"
}

HTTP status code 400

The server cannot or will not process the request due to something that is perceived to be a client error (e.g., malformed request syntax, invalid request message framing, or deceptive request routing).

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 400,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 404

The origin server did not find a current representation for the target resource or is not willing to disclose that one exists.

Resource not found, specifically occurs when a route is poorly specified, make sure that the resource ID are needing is correct.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 404,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 500

The server encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request.

If an error occurred on the server, the required operation could not be performed, sorry.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 500,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

Secured by jwt

Headers

  • Authorization: required (string)

    Used to send a valid JWT access token. In the Authorization header using the Bearer schema.

    Example:

    Bearer eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJzdWIiOiIxMjM0NTY3ODkwIiwibmFtZSI6IkpvaG4gRG9lIiwiYWRtaW4iOnRydWV9.TJVA95OrM7E2cBab30RMHrHDcEfxjoYZgeFONFh7HgQ

Egresses

This resource contains all the necessary operations for the management of the egresses, among these operations we will have HTTP methods to get all the elements, to get a single element, to add new elements to the resource, to edit the existing elements and finally to eliminate.

/egresses get post

get

Get a list of all egresses.

post

Add a new egress.

get /egresses

Get a list of all egresses.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

Query Parameters

  • userId: (number)

    If you need to filter the list of egresses by users, you can provide the user ID.

    Example:

    1084
  • closureState: (boolean)

    If you need to filter the list of egresses by the closure state (if it is closured or not), you can provide the state of the egress you want to search for.

    Example:

    true
  • egressType: ([object Object])

    If you need to filter the list of egresses by the egress type, provide the type.

    Example:

    MANAGEMENT_EGRESS
  • search: (string)

    The value to search.

  • start: (number - default: 0 - minimum: 0)

    Specify the index of first element to get

    Example:

    10
  • size: (number - minimum: 10 - maximum: 200)

    Specify the amount of items that will be retrieved per request

    Example:

    150
  • orderBy: (string)

    Specify the property of the object be sorted.

  • orderType: (one of ASC, DESC - default: ASC)

    Specify whether to sort ascending or descending

HTTP status code 200

Successfull request.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • items: required (array of Egress)

    Items: Egress

    • id: (number)
    • value: required (number)
    • concept: required (string)
    • created: (datetime)
    • closure: (object)
      • closuredBy: (object)
        • id: required (number)
        • displayName: required (string)
        • email: required (string)
        • username: (string)
        • urlPic: (string)
      • closuredType: required (one of PAID_OUT, DISCARDED)
      • observation: required (string)
      • date: (datetime)
    • operationId: (number)
    • @type: required (string)
  • total: required (number)

Example:

{
  "items": [
    {
      "@type": "OperatorEgress",
      "concept": "Gasto Cliente",
      "created": "2017-04-14T14:00:00Z",
      "id": 1,
      "value": 200000,
      "operator": {
        "id": 1,
        "displayName": "Ali Connors",
        "email": "aliconnors@example.com",
        "username": "ali_connors",
        "urlPic": "http://static.arpia.com/imgs/img_001.jpg"
      },
      "typeConcept": "ADVANCEMENT"
    },
    {
      "@type": "OperatorEgress",
      "concept": "Gasto Cliente",
      "created": "2017-04-14T10:20:00Z",
      "id": 2,
      "value": 50000,
      "operator": {
        "id": 2,
        "displayName": "Peter Carlsson",
        "email": "petercarlsson@example.com",
        "username": "peter_carlsson",
        "urlPic": "http://static.arpia.com/imgs/img_002.jpg"
      },
      "typeConcept": "ADVANCEMENT"
    }
  ],
  "total": 2
}

HTTP status code 404

The origin server did not find a current representation for the target resource or is not willing to disclose that one exists.

Resource not found, specifically occurs when a route is poorly specified, make sure that the resource ID are needing is correct.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 404,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

post /egresses

Add a new egress.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • id: (number)
  • value: required (number)
  • concept: required (string)
  • created: (datetime)
  • closure: (object)
    • closuredBy: (object)
      • id: required (number)
      • displayName: required (string)
      • email: required (string)
      • username: (string)
      • urlPic: (string)
    • closuredType: required (one of PAID_OUT, DISCARDED)
    • observation: required (string)
    • date: (datetime)
  • operationId: (number)
  • @type: required (string)

Example:

{
  "@type": "OperatorEgress",
  "concept": "Gasto Cliente",
  "value": 200000,
  "typeConcept": "ADVANCEMENT",
  "operatorId": 1
}

HTTP status code 201

It has created a new egress.

Headers

  • Location: required (string)

    Location where you can get the information of the created egress.

    Example:

    http://api.arpia.com/v1/egresses/1

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • id: (number)
  • value: required (number)
  • concept: required (string)
  • created: (datetime)
  • closure: (object)
    • closuredBy: (object)
      • id: required (number)
      • displayName: required (string)
      • email: required (string)
      • username: (string)
      • urlPic: (string)
    • closuredType: required (one of PAID_OUT, DISCARDED)
    • observation: required (string)
    • date: (datetime)
  • operationId: (number)
  • @type: required (string)

Example:

{
  "@type": "OperatorEgress",
  "concept": "Gasto Cliente",
  "created": "2017-04-14T14:00:00Z",
  "id": 1,
  "value": 200000,
  "operator": {
    "id": 1,
    "displayName": "Ali Connors",
    "email": "aliconnors@example.com",
    "username": "ali_connors",
    "urlPic": "http://static.arpia.com/imgs/img_001.jpg"
  },
  "typeConcept": "ADVANCEMENT"
}

The server cannot or will not process the request due to something that is perceived to be a client error (e.g., malformed request syntax, invalid request message framing, or deceptive request routing).

/egresses/{id} get put

A specific egress, a item of the egresses list.

get

Get information about an egress.

put

Update information about the specific egress.

get /egresses/{id}

Get information about an egress.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

  • id: required (number)

    Egress ID is required.

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

/egresses/{id}/closure put

This resource contains the methods to manage the closure in the egresses.

put

Updates the closure of an egress.

put /egresses/{id}/closure

Updates the closure of an egress.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • id: required (number)

    Egress ID is required.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • closuredBy: (object)
    • id: required (number)
    • displayName: required (string)
    • email: required (string)
    • username: (string)
    • urlPic: (string)
  • closuredType: required (one of PAID_OUT, DISCARDED)
  • observation: required (string)
  • date: (datetime)

Example:

{
  "closuredType": "PAID_OUT",
  "observation": "This is the observation"
}

HTTP status code 200

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • closuredBy: (object)
    • id: required (number)
    • displayName: required (string)
    • email: required (string)
    • username: (string)
    • urlPic: (string)
  • closuredType: required (one of PAID_OUT, DISCARDED)

  "closuredBy": {
    "id": 2,
    "displayName": "Peter Carlsson",

    "urlPic": "http://static.arpia.com/imgs/img_002.jpg"
  },
  "closuredType": "PAID_OUT",
  "observation": "This is the obserbation",
  "date": "2017-04-14T14:01:00.000Z"
}

    Bearer eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJzdWIiOiIxMjM0NTY3ODkwIiwibmFtZSI6IkpvaG4gRG9lIiwiYWRtaW4iOnRydWV9.TJVA95OrM7E2cBab30RMHrHDcEfxjoYZgeFONFh7HgQ

Evaluations of Messengers

This resource contains all the necessary operations for the management of the messenger evaluations, among these operations we will have HTTP methods to get all the elements, to get a single element, to add new elements to the resource, to edit the existing elements and finally to eliminate.

/evaluations get post

get

Get a list of all the messenger evaluations.

post

Add a new messenger evaluation.

get /evaluations

Get a list of all the messenger evaluations.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

Query Parameters

  • messengerId: required (number - minimum: 1)

    Specify the id of the messenger.

    Example:

    10
  • start: (number - default: 0 - minimum: 0)

    Specify the index of first element to get

    Example:

    10
  • size: (number - minimum: 10 - maximum: 200)

    Specify the amount of items that will be retrieved per request

    Example:

    150

HTTP status code 200

Successfull request.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: array of Evaluation

Items: Evaluation

  • id: (number)
  • user: (object)
    • id: required (number)
    • displayName: required (string)
    • email: required (string)
    • username: (string)
    • urlPic: (string)
  • messengerId: required (number)
  • detail: (string)
  • speed: required (one of FAST, SLOW)
  • management: required (one of BAD, NORMAL, GOOD)
  • confidence: required (one of NULL, LOW, MEDIUM, HIGH, SUPER_HIGH)
  • registerDate: (datetime)

Example:

[
  {
    "id": 1,
    "user": {
      "id": 1,
      "displayName": "Ali Connors",
      "email": "aliconnors@example.com",
      "username": "ali_connors",
      "urlPic": "http://static.arpia.com/imgs/img_001.jpg"
    },
    "registerDate": "2017-04-01T08:00:00.000Z",
    "messengerId": 1,
    "detail": "This is the detail",
    "speed": "FAST",
    "management": "NORMAL",
    "confidence": "LOW"
  },
  {
    "id": 2,
    "user": {
      "id": 2,
      "displayName": "Peter Carlsson",
      "email": "petercarlsson@example.com",
      "username": "peter_carlsson",
      "urlPic": "http://static.arpia.com/imgs/img_002.jpg"
    },
    "registerDate": "2017-04-01T08:00:00.000Z",
    "messengerId": 2,
    "detail": "This is the detail",
    "speed": "SLOW",
    "management": "GOOD",
    "confidence": "HIGH"
  }
]

HTTP status code 404

The origin server did not find a current representation for the target resource or is not willing to disclose that one exists.

Resource not found, specifically occurs when a route is poorly specified, make sure that the resource ID are needing is correct.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 404,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 500

The server encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request.

If an error occurred on the server, the required operation could not be performed, sorry.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 500,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

Secured by jwt

Headers

  • Authorization: required (string)

    Used to send a valid JWT access token. In the Authorization header using the Bearer schema.

    Example:

    Bearer eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJzdWIiOiIxMjM0NTY3ODkwIiwibmFtZSI6IkpvaG4gRG9lIiwiYWRtaW4iOnRydWV9.TJVA95OrM7E2cBab30RMHrHDcEfxjoYZgeFONFh7HgQ

post /evaluations

Add a new messenger evaluation.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • id: (number)
  • user: (object)
    • id: required (number)
    • displayName: required (string)
    • email: required (string)
    • username: (string)
    • urlPic: (string)
  • messengerId: required (number)
  • detail: (string)
  • speed: required (one of FAST, SLOW)
  • management: required (one of BAD, NORMAL, GOOD)
  • confidence: required (one of NULL, LOW, MEDIUM, HIGH, SUPER_HIGH)
  • registerDate: (datetime)

Example:

{
  "messengerId": 2,
  "detail": "This is the detail",
  "speed": "SLOW",
  "management": "GOOD",
  "confidence": "HIGH"
}

HTTP status code 201

It has created a new messenger evaluation.

Headers

  • Location: required (string)

    Location where you can get the information of the created evaluation.

    Example:

    http://api.arpia.com/v1/evaluations/1

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • id: (number)
  • user: (object)
    • id: required (number)
    • displayName: required (string)
    • email: required (string)
    • username: (string)
    • urlPic: (string)
  • messengerId: required (number)
  • detail: (string)
  • speed: required (one of FAST, SLOW)
  • management: required (one of BAD, NORMAL, GOOD)
  • confidence: required (one of NULL, LOW, MEDIUM, HIGH, SUPER_HIGH)
  • registerDate: (datetime)

HTTP status code 400

The server cannot or will not process the request due to something that is perceived to be a client error (e.g., malformed request syntax, invalid request message framing, or deceptive request routing).

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 400,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 404

The origin server did not find a current representation for the target resource or is not willing to disclose that one exists.

Resource not found, specifically occurs when a route is poorly specified, make sure that the resource ID are needing is correct.

    Bearer eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJzdWIiOiIxMjM0NTY3ODkwIiwibmFtZSI6IkpvaG4gRG9lIiwiYWRtaW4iOnRydWV9.TJVA95OrM7E2cBab30RMHrHDcEfxjoYZgeFONFh7HgQ

/evaluations/{id} get

A specific messenger evaluation, a item of the messenger evaluations list.

get

Get information about a Messenger evaluation.

get /evaluations/{id}

Get information about a Messenger evaluation.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • id: required (number)

    Messenger evaluation ID is required.

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

HTTP status code 200

Successfull request.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • id: (number)
  • user: (object)
    • id: required (number)
    • displayName: required (string)
    • email: required (string)
    • username: (string)
    • urlPic: (string)
  • messengerId: required (number)
  • detail: (string)
  • speed: required (one of FAST, SLOW)
  • management: required (one of BAD, NORMAL, GOOD)
  • confidence: required (one of NULL, LOW, MEDIUM, HIGH, SUPER_HIGH)
  • registerDate: (datetime)

Example:

{
  "id": 1,
  "user": {
    "id": 1,
    "displayName": "Ali Connors",
    "email": "aliconnors@example.com",
    "username": "ali_connors",
    "urlPic": "http://static.arpia.com/imgs/img_001.jpg"
  },
  "messengerId": 1,
  "detail": "This is the detail",
  "speed": "FAST",
  "management": "NORMAL",
  "confidence": "LOW"
}

Festive Days

This resource contains all the necessary operations for the management of the festive days, among these operations we will have HTTP methods to get all the elements, to get a single element, to add new elements to the resource, to edit the existing elements and finally to eliminate.

/festives get post

get

Get a list of all the festive days.

post

Add a new festive day.

get /festives

Get a list of all the festive days.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

HTTP status code 200

Successfull request.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: array of Festive

Items: Festive

  • id: (number)
  • name: required (string)
  • dayOfMonth: required (integer)
  • Month: required (one of JANUARY, FEBRUARY, MARCH, APRIL, MAY, JUNE, JULY, AUGUST, SEPTEMBER, OCTOBER, NOVEMBER, DECEMBER)

Example:

[
  {
    "id": 1,
    "name": "Festive day #1",
    "dayOfMonth": 3,
    "Month": "FEBRUARY"
  },
  {
    "id": 2,
    "name": "Festive day #2",
    "dayOfMonth": 10,
    "Month": "DECEMBER"
  }
]

HTTP status code 404

The origin server did not find a current representation for the target resource or is not willing to disclose that one exists.

Resource not found, specifically occurs when a route is poorly specified, make sure that the resource ID are needing is correct.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 404,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 500

The server encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request.

If an error occurred on the server, the required operation could not be performed, sorry.

Body

      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]

  • Authorization: required (string)

    Bearer eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJzdWIiOiIxMjM0NTY3ODkwIiwibmFtZSI6IkpvaG4gRG9lIiwiYWRtaW4iOnRydWV9.TJVA95OrM7E2cBab30RMHrHDcEfxjoYZgeFONFh7HgQ

  • Security

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

  • id: (number)
  • name: required (string)
  • dayOfMonth: required (integer)
  • Month: required (one of JANUARY, FEBRUARY, MARCH, APRIL, MAY, JUNE, JULY, AUGUST, SEPTEMBER, OCTOBER, NOVEMBER, DECEMBER)

Example:

{
  "name": "Festive day #1",
  "dayOfMonth": 3,
  "Month": "FEBRUARY"
}

It has created a new festive.

    Location where you can get the information of the created festive.

    Example:

    http://api.arpia.com/v1/festives/1

Type: object

/festives/{id} get put delete

A specific festive day, a item of the festive days list.

get

Get information about a festive day.

put

Update information about the specific festive day.

delete

Remove a specific festive day.

get /festives/{id}

Get information about a festive day.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

  • id: required (number)

    Festive ID is required.

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.
