put /festives/{id}

Update information about the specific festive day.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • id: required (number)

    Festive ID is required.

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • id: (number)
  • name: required (string)
  • dayOfMonth: required (integer)
  • Month: required (one of JANUARY, FEBRUARY, MARCH, APRIL, MAY, JUNE, JULY, AUGUST, SEPTEMBER, OCTOBER, NOVEMBER, DECEMBER)

HTTP status code 200

It has updated a festive.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • id: (number)
  • name: required (string)
  • dayOfMonth: required (integer)
  • Month: required (one of JANUARY, FEBRUARY, MARCH, APRIL, MAY, JUNE, JULY, AUGUST, SEPTEMBER, OCTOBER, NOVEMBER, DECEMBER)

Example:

{
  "id": 1,
  "name": "Festive day #1",
  "dayOfMonth": 3,
  "Month": "FEBRUARY"
}

HTTP status code 400

The server cannot or will not process the request due to something that is perceived to be a client error (e.g., malformed request syntax, invalid request message framing, or deceptive request routing).

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 400,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 404

The origin server did not find a current representation for the target resource or is not willing to disclose that one exists.

Resource not found, specifically occurs when a route is poorly specified, make sure that the resource ID are needing is correct.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 404,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 500

The server encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request.

If an error occurred on the server, the required operation could not be performed, sorry.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 500,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

Secured by jwt

Headers

  • Authorization: required (string)

    Used to send a valid JWT access token. In the Authorization header using the Bearer schema.

    Example:

    Bearer eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJzdWIiOiIxMjM0NTY3ODkwIiwibmFtZSI6IkpvaG4gRG9lIiwiYWRtaW4iOnRydWV9.TJVA95OrM7E2cBab30RMHrHDcEfxjoYZgeFONFh7HgQ

delete /festives/{id}

Remove a specific festive day.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • id: required (number)

    Festive ID is required.

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

HTTP status code 200

Successfull request.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • id: (number)
  • name: required (string)
  • dayOfMonth: required (integer)
  • Month: required (one of JANUARY, FEBRUARY, MARCH, APRIL, MAY, JUNE, JULY, AUGUST, SEPTEMBER, OCTOBER, NOVEMBER, DECEMBER)

Example:

{
  "id": 1,
  "name": "Festive day #1",
  "dayOfMonth": 3,
  "Month": "FEBRUARY"
}

HTTP status code 400

The server cannot or will not process the request due to something that is perceived to be a client error (e.g., malformed request syntax, invalid request message framing, or deceptive request routing).

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 400,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 404

The origin server did not find a current representation for the target resource or is not willing to disclose that one exists.

Resource not found, specifically occurs when a route is poorly specified, make sure that the resource ID are needing is correct.

Media type: application/json

      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 500

The server encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request.

If an error occurred on the server, the required operation could not be performed, sorry.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 500,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

Secured by jwt

Headers

  • Authorization: required (string)

    Used to send a valid JWT access token. In the Authorization header using the Bearer schema.

    Example:

    Bearer eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJzdWIiOiIxMjM0NTY3ODkwIiwibmFtZSI6IkpvaG4gRG9lIiwiYWRtaW4iOnRydWV9.TJVA95OrM7E2cBab30RMHrHDcEfxjoYZgeFONFh7HgQ

Good Standing

This resource contains all the necessary operations for the management of the goodstanding, among these operations we will have HTTP methods to get all the elements, to get a single element, to add new elements to the resource, to edit the existing elements and finally to eliminate.

/goodstanding get post

get

Get a list of all goodstanding.

post

Add a new goodstanding.

get /goodstanding

Get a list of all goodstanding.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

Query Parameters

  • messengerId: (number)

    If provide this param then get a list filtered by messenger.

    Example:

    10
  • start: (number - default: 0 - minimum: 0)

    Specify the index of first element to get

    Example:

    10
  • size: (number - minimum: 10 - maximum: 200)

    Specify the amount of items that will be retrieved per request

    Example:

    150

HTTP status code 200

Successfull request.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • items: required (array of GoodStandingResponse)

    Items: GoodStandingResponse

    • approvalDate: (datetime)
    • observations: (string)
    • messenger: required (object)
      • id: required (number)
      • identification: required (string)
      • name: required (string)
      • lastName: required (string)
      • gender: (one of MALE, FEMALE)
      • birthday: (date-only)
      • photo: required (string)
      • category: (number)
    • registerDate: (datetime)
    • operation: required (object)
      • id: (number)
      • name: required (string)
      • alias: required (string)
      • description: (string)
      • imageUrl: (string)
      • adminUser: (object)
        • id: required (number)
        • username: (string)
        • email: required (string)
        • displayName: required (string)
    • approved: (boolean)
    • reason: (string)
    • id: required (number)
    • refundDate: (date-only)
    • message: (string)
  • total: required (number)

Example:

{
  "items": [
    {
      "id": 1,
      "refundDate": "2017-05-15",
      "reason": "This is a reason.",
      "observations": "This is a observation.",
      "message": "This is a message.",
      "operation": {
        "id": 1,
        "name": "Operation 411",
        "alias": "411"
      },
      "messenger": {
        "id": 1,
        "identification": "12346798",
        "name": "Jhon",
        "lastName": "Doe",
        "gender": "MALE",
        "birthday": "1993-02-11",
        "photo": "http://static.arpia.com/imgs/img_001.jpg",
        "category": 5
      },
      "registerDate": "2017-04-26T12:30:00.000Z",
      "approved": true,
      "approvalDate": "2017-05-20T00:00:00.000Z"
    },
    {
      "id": 2,
      "refundDate": "2017-05-15",
      "reason": "This is a reason.",
      "observations": "This is a observation.",
      "message": "This is a message.",
      "operation": {
        "id": 2,
        "name": "Operation 357",
        "alias": "357"
      },
      "messenger": {
        "id": 1,
        "identification": "12346798",
        "name": "Jhon",
        "lastName": "Doe",
        "gender": "MALE",
        "birthday": "1993-02-11",
        "photo": "http://static.arpia.com/imgs/img_001.jpg",
        "category": 5
      },
      "registerDate": "2017-04-26T12:30:00.000Z",
      "approved": true,
      "approvalDate": "2017-05-20T00:00:00.000Z"
    }
  ],
  "total": 10
}

HTTP status code 404

The origin server did not find a current representation for the target resource or is not willing to disclose that one exists.

Resource not found, specifically occurs when a route is poorly specified, make sure that the resource ID are needing is correct.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 404,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 500

The server encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request.

If an error occurred on the server, the required operation could not be performed, sorry.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    • message: required (string)

post /goodstanding

Add a new goodstanding.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • reason: (string)
  • operation: required (number)
  • messenger: required (number)

Example:

{
  "reason": "This is a reason",
  "operation": 1,
  "messenger": 1
}

HTTP status code 201

It has created a new goodstanding.

Headers

  • Location: required (string)

    Location where you can get the information of the created goodstanding.

    Example:

    http://api.arpia.com/v1/goodstanding/1

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • approvalDate: (datetime)
  • observations: (string)
  • messenger: required (object)
    • id: required (number)
    • identification: required (string)
    • name: required (string)
    • lastName: required (string)
    • gender: (one of MALE, FEMALE)
    • birthday: (date-only)
    • photo: required (string)
    • category: (number)
  • registerDate: (datetime)
  • operation: required (object)
    • id: (number)
    • name: required (string)
    • alias: required (string)
    • description: (string)
    • imageUrl: (string)
    • adminUser: (object)
      • id: required (number)
      • username: (string)
      • email: required (string)
      • displayName: required (string)
  • approved: (boolean)
  • reason: (string)
  • id: required (number)
  • refundDate: (date-only)
  • message: (string)

Example:

{
  "id": 1,
  "reason": "This is a reason.",
  "operation": {
    "id": 1,
    "name": "Operation 411",
    "alias": "411"
  },
  "messenger": {
    "id": 1,
    "identification": "12346798",
    "name": "Jhon",
    "lastName": "Doe",
    "gender": "MALE",
    "birthday": "1993-02-11",
    "photo": "http://static.arpia.com/imgs/img_001.jpg",
    "category": 5
  },
  "registerDate": "2017-04-26T12:30:00.000Z"
}

/goodstanding/{id} get

get

Get information about a good standing.

get /goodstanding/{id}

Get information about a good standing.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • id: required (string)

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

HTTP status code 200

Successfull request.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • approvalDate: (datetime)
  • observations: (string)
  • messenger: required (object)
    • id: required (number)
    • identification: required (string)
    • name: required (string)
    • lastName: required (string)
    • gender: (one of MALE, FEMALE)
    • birthday: (date-only)
    • photo: required (string)
    • category: (number)
  • registerDate: (datetime)
  • operation: required (object)
    • id: (number)
    • name: required (string)
    • alias: required (string)
    • description: (string)
    • imageUrl: (string)
    • adminUser: (object)
      • id: required (number)
      • username: (string)
      • email: required (string)
      • displayName: required (string)
  • approved: (boolean)
  • reason: (string)
  • id: required (number)
  • refundDate: (date-only)
  • message: (string)

Example:

{
  "id": 1,
  "refundDate": "2017-05-15",
  "reason": "This is a reason.",
  "observations": "This is a observation.",
  "message": "This is a message.",
  "operation": {
    "id": 1,
    "name": "Operation 411",
    "alias": "411"
  },
  "messenger": {
    "id": 1,
    "identification": "12346798",
    "name": "Jhon",
    "lastName": "Doe",
    "gender": "MALE",
    "birthday": "1993-02-11",
    "photo": "http://static.arpia.com/imgs/img_001.jpg",
    "category": 5
  },
  "registerDate": "2017-04-26T12:30:00.000Z",
  "approved": true,
  "approvalDate": "2017-05-20T00:00:00.000Z"
}

/goodstanding/{id}/approve put

put

It approves a good standing.

put /goodstanding/{id}/approve

It approves a good standing.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • id: required (string)

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • refundDate: required (date-only)
  • observations: (string)
  • message: (string)

Example:

{
  "refundDate": "2017-05-15",
  "observations": "This is a observation.",
  "message": "This is a message."
}

HTTP status code 201

Approved good standing.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • approvalDate: (datetime)
  • observations: (string)
  • messenger: required (object)
    • id: required (number)
    • identification: required (string)
    • name: required (string)
    • lastName: required (string)
    • gender: (one of MALE, FEMALE)
    • birthday: (date-only)
    • photo: required (string)
    • category: (number)
  • registerDate: (datetime)
  • operation: required (object)
    • id: (number)
    • name: required (string)
    • alias: required (string)
    • description: (string)
    • imageUrl: (string)
    • adminUser: (object)
      • id: required (number)
      • username: (string)
      • email: required (string)
      • displayName: required (string)
  • approved: (boolean)
  • reason: (string)
  • id: required (number)
  • refundDate: (date-only)
  • message: (string)

Example:

{
  "id": 1,
  "refundDate": "2017-05-15",
  "reason": "This is a reason.",
  "observations": "This is a observation.",
  "message": "This is a message.",
  "operation": {
    "id": 1,
    "name": "Operation 411",
    "alias": "411"
  },
  "messenger": {
    "id": 1,
    "identification": "12346798",
    "name": "Jhon",
    "lastName": "Doe",
    "gender": "MALE",
    "birthday": "1993-02-11",
    "photo": "http://static.arpia.com/imgs/img_001.jpg",
    "category": 5
  },
  "registerDate": "2017-04-26T12:30:00.000Z",
  "approved": true,
  "approvalDate": "2017-05-20T00:00:00.000Z"
}

  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

Secured by jwt

Headers

  • Authorization: required (string)

    Used to send a valid JWT access token. In the Authorization header using the Bearer schema.

    Example:

    Bearer eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJzdWIiOiIxMjM0NTY3ODkwIiwibmFtZSI6IkpvaG4gRG9lIiwiYWRtaW4iOnRydWV9.TJVA95OrM7E2cBab30RMHrHDcEfxjoYZgeFONFh7HgQ

/goodstanding/{id}/deny put

put

It denies a good standing.

put /goodstanding/{id}/deny

It denies a good standing.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • id: required (string)

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • observations: (string)
  • message: (string)

Example:

{
  "observations": "This is a observation.",
  "message": "This is a message."
}

HTTP status code 201

Approved good standing.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • approvalDate: (datetime)
  • observations: (string)
  • messenger: required (object)
    • id: required (number)
    • identification: required (string)
    • name: required (string)
    • lastName: required (string)
    • gender: (one of MALE, FEMALE)
    • birthday: (date-only)
    • photo: required (string)
    • category: (number)
  • registerDate: (datetime)
  • operation: required (object)
    • id: (number)
    • name: required (string)
    • alias: required (string)
    • description: (string)
    • imageUrl: (string)
    • adminUser: (object)
      • id: required (number)
      • username: (string)
      • email: required (string)
      • displayName: required (string)
  • approved: (boolean)
  • reason: (string)
  • id: required (number)
  • refundDate: (date-only)
  • message: (string)

Example:

{
  "id": 1,
  "reason": "This is a reason.",
  "observations": "This is a observation.",
  "message": "This is a message.",
  "operation": {
    "id": 1,
    "name": "Operation 411",
    "alias": "411"
  },
  "messenger": {
    "id": 1,
    "identification": "12346798",
    "name": "Jhon",
    "lastName": "Doe",
    "gender": "MALE",
    "birthday": "1993-02-11",
    "photo": "http://static.arpia.com/imgs/img_001.jpg",
    "category": 5
  },
  "registerDate": "2017-04-26T12:30:00.000Z",
  "approved": false,
  "approvalDate": "2017-05-20T00:00:00.000Z"
}

HTTP status code 400

The server cannot or will not process the request due to something that is perceived to be a client error (e.g., malformed request syntax, invalid request message framing, or deceptive request routing).

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 400,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 404

The origin server did not find a current representation for the target resource or is not willing to disclose that one exists.

Resource not found, specifically occurs when a route is poorly specified, make sure that the resource ID are needing is correct.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 404,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 500

The server encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request.

If an error occurred on the server, the required operation could not be performed, sorry.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 500,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

Secured by jwt

Headers

  • Authorization: required (string)

    Used to send a valid JWT access token. In the Authorization header using the Bearer schema.

    Example:

    Bearer eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJzdWIiOiIxMjM0NTY3ODkwIiwibmFtZSI6IkpvaG4gRG9lIiwiYWRtaW4iOnRydWV9.TJVA95OrM7E2cBab30RMHrHDcEfxjoYZgeFONFh7HgQ

Inventory

This resource contains all the necessary operations for the management of the inventory, among these operations we will have HTTP methods to get all the elements, to get a single element, to add new elements to the resource, to edit the existing elements and finally to eliminate.

/inventory get post

get

Get a list of all inventory.

post

Add a new inventory.

get /inventory

Get a list of all inventory.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

Query Parameters

  • search: (string)

    The value to search.

  • start: (number - default: 0 - minimum: 0)

    Specify the index of first element to get

    Example:

    10
  • size: (number - minimum: 10 - maximum: 200)

    Specify the amount of items that will be retrieved per request

    Example:

    150
  • orderBy: (string)

    Specify the property of the object be sorted.

  • orderType: (one of ASC, DESC - default: ASC)

    Specify whether to sort ascending or descending

HTTP status code 200

Successfull request.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • items: required (array of Inventory)

    Items: Inventory

    • id: (number)
    • name: required (string)
    • count: required (integer)
    • registerDate: (datetime)
    • updatedDate: (datetime)
  • total: required (number)

Example:

{
  "items": [
    {
      "id": 1,
      "name": "object #1",
      "count": 10,
      "registerDate": "2017-04-10T12:30:00.000Z",
      "updatedDate": "2017-04-26T16:23:00.000Z"
    },
    {
      "id": 2,
      "name": "object #2",
      "count": 53,
      "registerDate": "2017-04-10T12:30:00.000Z",
      "updatedDate": "2017-04-26T16:23:00.000Z"
    }
  ],
  "total": 25
}

HTTP status code 404

The origin server did not find a current representation for the target resource or is not willing to disclose that one exists.

Resource not found, specifically occurs when a route is poorly specified, make sure that the resource ID are needing is correct.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 404,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

Media type: application/json

  • count: required (integer)
  • registerDate: (datetime)
  • updatedDate: (datetime)

Example:

{
  "name": "Object name",
  "count": 50
}

HTTP status code 201

It has created a new inventory.

Headers

  • Location: required (string)

    Location where you can get the information of the created inventory.

    Example:

    http://api.arpia.com/v1/inventory/1

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • id: (number)
  • name: required (string)
  • count: required (integer)
  • registerDate: (datetime)
  • updatedDate: (datetime)

/inventory/{id} get put delete

A specific inventory, a item of the inventory list.

get

Get information about a inventory.

put

Update information about the specific inventory.

delete

Remove a specific inventory.

get /inventory/{id}

Get information about a inventory.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • id: required (number)

    Inventory ID is required.

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

HTTP status code 200

Successfull request.

Media type: application/json

Type: object

  • id: (number)
  • name: required (string)
  • count: required (integer)

  • updatedDate: (datetime)

  "count": 10,
  "registerDate": "2017-04-10T12:30:00.000Z",
  "updatedDate": "2017-04-26T16:23:00.000Z"

    Inventory ID is required.

Properties
  • id: (number)
  • name: required (string)
  • count: required (integer)
  • registerDate: (datetime)
  • updatedDate: (datetime)

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • id: (number)

  • registerDate: (datetime)

/inventory/{id}/messengers get

get

Get a list of messenger with loans and returns of inventory element provided.

get /inventory/{id}/messengers

Get a list of messenger with loans and returns of inventory element provided.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • id: required (number)

    Inventory ID is required.

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

HTTP status code 200

Successfull request.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: array of MessengerInfo

Items: MessengerInfo

  • messenger: required (object)
    • id: required (number)
    • identification: required (string)
    • name: required (string)
    • lastName: required (string)
    • gender: (one of MALE, FEMALE)
    • birthday: (date-only)
    • photo: required (string)
    • category: (number)
  • loans: required (integer)
  • returns: required (integer)

Example:

[
  {
    "messenger": {
      "id": 1,
      "identification": "12346798",
      "name": "Jhon",
      "lastName": "Doe",
      "gender": "MALE",
      "birthday": "1993-02-11",
      "photo": "http://static.arpia.com/imgs/img_001.jpg",
      "category": 5
    },
    "loans": 10,
    "returns": 9
  },
  {
    "messenger": {
      "id": 1,
      "identification": "12346798",
      "name": "Jhon",
      "lastName": "Doe",
      "gender": "MALE",
      "birthday": "1993-02-11",
      "photo": "http://static.arpia.com/imgs/img_001.jpg",
      "category": 5
    },
    "loans": 20,
    "returns": 16
  }
]

HTTP status code 400

The server cannot or will not process the request due to something that is perceived to be a client error (e.g., malformed request syntax, invalid request message framing, or deceptive request routing).

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 400,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 404

The origin server did not find a current representation for the target resource or is not willing to disclose that one exists.

Resource not found, specifically occurs when a route is poorly specified, make sure that the resource ID are needing is correct.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 404,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 500

The server encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request.

If an error occurred on the server, the required operation could not be performed, sorry.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 500,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

Secured by jwt

Headers

  • Authorization: required (string)

    Used to send a valid JWT access token. In the Authorization header using the Bearer schema.

    Example:

    Bearer eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJzdWIiOiIxMjM0NTY3ODkwIiwibmFtZSI6IkpvaG4gRG9lIiwiYWRtaW4iOnRydWV9.TJVA95OrM7E2cBab30RMHrHDcEfxjoYZgeFONFh7HgQ

/inventory/{id}/chipInfo get

get

Get a chip info of a inventory element provided.

get /inventory/{id}/chipInfo

Get a chip info of a inventory element provided.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • id: required (number)

    Inventory ID is required.

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

HTTP status code 200

Successfull request.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • busy: required (integer)
  • loans: required (integer)
  • returns: required (integer)

Example:

{
  "busy": 4,
  "loans": 6,
  "returns": 2
}

HTTP status code 400

The server cannot or will not process the request due to something that is perceived to be a client error (e.g., malformed request syntax, invalid request message framing, or deceptive request routing).

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 400,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 404

The origin server did not find a current representation for the target resource or is not willing to disclose that one exists.

Resource not found, specifically occurs when a route is poorly specified, make sure that the resource ID are needing is correct.

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 404,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]

HTTP status code 500

The server encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request.

If an error occurred on the server, the required operation could not be performed, sorry.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

  "statusCode": 500,
  "messages": [
    {

      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }

Secured by jwt

Headers

  • Authorization: required (string)

    Used to send a valid JWT access token. In the Authorization header using the Bearer schema.

    Example:

    Bearer eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJzdWIiOiIxMjM0NTY3ODkwIiwibmFtZSI6IkpvaG4gRG9lIiwiYWRtaW4iOnRydWV9.TJVA95OrM7E2cBab30RMHrHDcEfxjoYZgeFONFh7HgQ

/inventory/{id}/stocks get post

This resource contains all the necessary operations for the management of the stocks, among these operations we will have HTTP methods to get all the elements, to get a single element, to add new elements to the resource, to edit the existing elements and finally to eliminate.

get

Get a list of all stocks.

post

Add a new stock.

get /inventory/{id}/stocks

Get a list of all stocks.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • id: required (number)

    Inventory ID is required.

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

Query Parameters

  • type: (one of INPUT, OUTPUT)

    Provide if you need to filter the list by inputs or outputs.

  • start: (number - default: 0 - minimum: 0)

    Specify the index of first element to get

    Example:

    10
  • size: (number - minimum: 10 - maximum: 200)

    Specify the amount of items that will be retrieved per request

    Example:

    150
  • from: (date-only)

    Specifies the start date of the filter.

    Example:

    2015-07-30
  • to: (date-only)

    Specifies the end date of the filter.

    Example:

    2017-12-31

HTTP status code 200

Successfull request.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • items: required (array of Stock)

    Items: Stock

    • index: (number)
    • count: required (integer)
    • type: required (one of INPUT, OUTPUT)
    • reason: required (string)
    • registerDate: (datetime)
  • total: required (number)

Example:

{
  "items": [
    {
      "index": 1,
      "count": 5,
      "type": "INPUT",
      "reason": "This is a reason.",
      "registerDate": "2017-04-10T12:00:00.000Z"
    },
    {
      "index": 2,
      "count": 15,
      "type": "OUTPUT",
      "reason": "This is a reason.",
      "registerDate": "2017-04-10T12:00:00.000Z"
    }
  ],
  "total": 10
}

HTTP status code 404

The origin server did not find a current representation for the target resource or is not willing to disclose that one exists.

Resource not found, specifically occurs when a route is poorly specified, make sure that the resource ID are needing is correct.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 404,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 500

The server encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request.

If an error occurred on the server, the required operation could not be performed, sorry.

Media type: application/json

  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    }

    Used to send a valid JWT access token. In the Authorization header using the Bearer schema.

    Example:

    Bearer eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJzdWIiOiIxMjM0NTY3ODkwIiwibmFtZSI6IkpvaG4gRG9lIiwiYWRtaW4iOnRydWV9.TJVA95OrM7E2cBab30RMHrHDcEfxjoYZgeFONFh7HgQ

post /inventory/{id}/stocks

Add a new stock.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • id: required (number)

    Inventory ID is required.

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • index: (number)
  • count: required (integer)
  • type: required (one of INPUT, OUTPUT)
  • reason: required (string)
  • registerDate: (datetime)

Example:

{
  "count": 15,
  "type": "INPUT",
  "reason": "This is a reason."
}

HTTP status code 201

It has created a new stock.

Headers

  • Location: required (string)

    Location where you can get the information of the created stock.

    Example:

    http://api.arpia.com/v1/stocks/1

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • index: (number)
  • count: required (integer)
  • type: required (one of INPUT, OUTPUT)
  • reason: required (string)
  • registerDate: (datetime)

Example:

{
  "index": 1,
  "count": 5,
  "type": "INPUT",
  "reason": "This is a reason.",
  "registerDate": "2017-04-10T12:00:00.000Z"
}

A specific stock, a item of the stocks list.

get

Get information about a stock.

  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • id: required (number)

    Inventory ID is required.

  • index: required (integer)

    Stock index is required.

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

Issues

This resource contains all the necessary operations for the management of the issues, among these operations we will have HTTP methods to get all the elements, to get a single element, to add new elements to the resource, to edit the existing elements and finally to eliminate.

/issues get post

get

Get a list of all issues.

post

Add a new issue.

get /issues

Get a list of all issues.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

Query Parameters

  • start: (number - default: 0 - minimum: 0)

    Specify the index of first element to get

    Example:

    10
  • size: (number - minimum: 10 - maximum: 200)

    Specify the amount of items that will be retrieved per request

    Example:

    150

HTTP status code 200

Successfull request.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • items: required (array of Issue)

    Items: Issue

    • id: (number)
    • name: required (string)
    • shortName: required (string - minLength: 1 - maxLength: 3)
  • total: required (number)

Example:

{
  "items": [
    {
      "id": 1,
      "name": "Full Name 1",
      "shortName": "FN1"
    },
    {
      "id": 2,
      "name": "Full Name 2",
      "shortName": "FN2"
    }
  ],
  "total": 10
}

HTTP status code 404

The origin server did not find a current representation for the target resource or is not willing to disclose that one exists.

Resource not found, specifically occurs when a route is poorly specified, make sure that the resource ID are needing is correct.

  • documentation: required (string)

    • message: required (string)

  "statusCode": 404,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

It has created a new issue.

  • Location: required (string)

    Location where you can get the information of the created issue.

    http://api.arpia.com/v1/issues/1

Type: object

Properties
  • id: (number)
  • name: required (string)
  • shortName: required (string - minLength: 1 - maxLength: 3)

/issues/{id} get put delete

A specific issue, a item of the issues list.

get

Get information about a issue.

put

Update information about the specific issue.

delete

Remove a specific issue.

get /issues/{id}

Get information about a issue.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • id: required (number)

    Issue ID is required.

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

  • id: (number)

  "id": 1,
  "name": "Full Name 1",
  "shortName": "FN1"
}

}

HTTP status code 500

The server encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request.

If an error occurred on the server, the required operation could not be performed, sorry.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 500,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

Secured by jwt

Headers

  • Authorization: required (string)

    Used to send a valid JWT access token. In the Authorization header using the Bearer schema.

    Example:

    Bearer eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJzdWIiOiIxMjM0NTY3ODkwIiwibmFtZSI6IkpvaG4gRG9lIiwiYWRtaW4iOnRydWV9.TJVA95OrM7E2cBab30RMHrHDcEfxjoYZgeFONFh7HgQ

put /issues/{id}

Update information about the specific issue.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • id: required (number)

    Issue ID is required.

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • id: (number)
  • name: required (string)
  • shortName: required (string - minLength: 1 - maxLength: 3)

HTTP status code 200

It has updated a issue.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • id: (number)
  • name: required (string)
  • shortName: required (string - minLength: 1 - maxLength: 3)

HTTP status code 400

The server cannot or will not process the request due to something that is perceived to be a client error (e.g., malformed request syntax, invalid request message framing, or deceptive request routing).

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 400,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 404

The origin server did not find a current representation for the target resource or is not willing to disclose that one exists.

Resource not found, specifically occurs when a route is poorly specified, make sure that the resource ID are needing is correct.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 404,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

If an error occurred on the server, the required operation could not be performed, sorry.

Media type: application/json

Type: object

  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

  "messages": [

Remove a specific issue.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • id: required (number)

    Issue ID is required.

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

  • id: (number)
  • name: required (string)
  • shortName: required (string - minLength: 1 - maxLength: 3)

HTTP status code 500

The server encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request.

If an error occurred on the server, the required operation could not be performed, sorry.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 500,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

Secured by jwt

Headers

  • Authorization: required (string)

    Used to send a valid JWT access token. In the Authorization header using the Bearer schema.

    Example:

    Bearer eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJzdWIiOiIxMjM0NTY3ODkwIiwibmFtZSI6IkpvaG4gRG9lIiwiYWRtaW4iOnRydWV9.TJVA95OrM7E2cBab30RMHrHDcEfxjoYZgeFONFh7HgQ

Marketing Messages

This resource contains all the necessary operations for the management of the marketing messages, among these operations we will have HTTP methods to get all the elements, to get a single element, to add new elements to the resource, to edit the existing elements and finally to eliminate.

/marketingmessages get post

get

Get a list of all the marketing messages.

post

Add a new marketing message.

get /marketingmessages

Get a list of all the marketing messages.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

Query Parameters

  • customerId: required (number - minimum: 1)

    Specify the id of the customer.

    Example:

    10
  • start: (number - default: 0 - minimum: 0)

    Specify the index of first element to get

    Example:

    10
  • size: (number - minimum: 10 - maximum: 200)

    Specify the amount of items that will be retrieved per request

    Example:

    150

HTTP status code 200

Successfull request.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • items: required (array of MarketingMessageResponse)

    Items: MarketingMessageResponse

    • observations: required (string)
    • visit: (boolean)
    • call: (boolean)
    • id: required (number)
    • registerDate: required (datetime)
    • customer: required (object)
      • id: required (number)
      • observations: (string)
      • displayName: required (string)
      • identification: required (string)
      • type: required (one of PARTICULAR, ESTABLISHMENT)
      • banned: required (boolean)
    • user: required (object)
      • id: required (number)
      • displayName: required (string)
      • email: required (string)
      • username: (string)
      • urlPic: (string)
  • total: required (number)

Example:

{
  "items": [
    {
      "id": 1,
      "registerDate": "2017-04-01T08:00:00.000Z",
      "customer": {
        "id": 1,
        "identification": "123456789",
        "displayName": "Jhon Doe",
        "type": "PARTICULAR",
        "banned": false,
        "observations": "This is a observation."
      },
      "user": {
        "id": 1,
        "displayName": "Ali Connors",
        "email": "aliconnors@example.com",
        "username": "ali_connors",
        "urlPic": "http://static.arpia.com/imgs/img_001.jpg"
      },
      "observations": "This are the observations.",
      "visit": true,
      "call": true
    },
    {
      "id": 2,
      "registerDate": "2017-05-01T08:00:00.000Z",
      "customer": {
        "id": 2,
        "identification": "987654321",
        "displayName": "Ali Connors",
        "type": "PARTICULAR",
        "banned": false
      },
      "user": {
        "id": 2,
        "displayName": "Peter Carlsson",
        "email": "petercarlsson@example.com",
        "username": "peter_carlsson",
        "urlPic": "http://static.arpia.com/imgs/img_002.jpg"
      },
      "observations": "This are the observations.",
      "visit": true,
      "call": true
    }
  ],
  "total": 2
}

HTTP status code 404

The origin server did not find a current representation for the target resource or is not willing to disclose that one exists.

Resource not found, specifically occurs when a route is poorly specified, make sure that the resource ID are needing is correct.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 404,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 500

The server encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request.

If an error occurred on the server, the required operation could not be performed, sorry.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 500,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

Secured by jwt

Headers

  • Authorization: required (string)

    Used to send a valid JWT access token. In the Authorization header using the Bearer schema.

    Example:

    Bearer eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJzdWIiOiIxMjM0NTY3ODkwIiwibmFtZSI6IkpvaG4gRG9lIiwiYWRtaW4iOnRydWV9.TJVA95OrM7E2cBab30RMHrHDcEfxjoYZgeFONFh7HgQ

post /marketingmessages

Add a new marketing message.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • observations: required (string)
  • visit: (boolean)
  • call: (boolean)
  • customerId: required (number)

Example:

{
  "customerId": 1,
  "observations": "This are the observations.",
  "visit": true,
  "call": true
}

HTTP status code 201

It has created a new marketing message.

Headers

  • Location: required (string)

    Location where you can get the information of the created marketingmessage.

    Example:

    http://api.arpia.com/v1/marketingmessages/1

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • observations: required (string)
  • visit: (boolean)
  • call: (boolean)
  • id: required (number)
  • registerDate: required (datetime)
  • customer: required (object)
    • id: required (number)
    • observations: (string)
    • displayName: required (string)
    • identification: required (string)
    • type: required (one of PARTICULAR, ESTABLISHMENT)
    • banned: required (boolean)
  • user: required (object)
    • id: required (number)
    • displayName: required (string)
    • email: required (string)
    • username: (string)
    • urlPic: (string)

Example:

{
  "id": 1,
  "registerDate": "2017-04-01T08:00:00.000Z",
  "customer": {
    "id": 1,
    "identification": "123456789",
    "displayName": "Jhon Doe",
    "type": "PARTICULAR",
    "banned": false,
    "observations": "This is a observation."
  },
  "user": {
    "id": 1,
    "displayName": "Ali Connors",
    "email": "aliconnors@example.com",
    "username": "ali_connors",
    "urlPic": "http://static.arpia.com/imgs/img_001.jpg"
  },
  "observations": "This are the observations.",
  "visit": true,
  "call": true
}

/marketingmessages/{id} get delete

A specific marketing message, a item of the marketing messages list.

get

Get information about a marketing message.

delete

Remove a specific marketing message.

get /marketingmessages/{id}

Get information about a marketing message.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • id: required (number)

    Marketing message ID is required.

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

HTTP status code 200

Successfull request.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • observations: required (string)
  • visit: (boolean)
  • call: (boolean)
  • id: required (number)
  • registerDate: required (datetime)
  • customer: required (object)
    • id: required (number)
    • observations: (string)
    • displayName: required (string)
    • identification: required (string)
    • type: required (one of PARTICULAR, ESTABLISHMENT)
    • banned: required (boolean)
  • user: required (object)
    • id: required (number)
    • displayName: required (string)
    • email: required (string)
    • username: (string)
    • urlPic: (string)

Example:

{
  "id": 1,
  "registerDate": "2017-04-01T08:00:00.000Z",
  "customer": {
    "id": 1,
    "identification": "123456789",
    "displayName": "Jhon Doe",
    "type": "PARTICULAR",
    "banned": false,
    "observations": "This is a observation."
  },
  "user": {
    "id": 2,
    "displayName": "Peter Carlsson",
    "email": "petercarlsson@example.com",
    "username": "peter_carlsson",
    "urlPic": "http://static.arpia.com/imgs/img_002.jpg"
  },
  "observations": "This are the observations.",
  "visit": true,
  "call": true
}

delete /marketingmessages/{id}

Remove a specific marketing message.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • id: required (number)

    Marketing message ID is required.

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

HTTP status code 200

Successfull request.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • observations: required (string)
  • visit: (boolean)
  • call: (boolean)
  • id: required (number)
  • registerDate: required (datetime)
  • customer: required (object)
    • id: required (number)
    • observations: (string)
    • displayName: required (string)
    • identification: required (string)
    • type: required (one of PARTICULAR, ESTABLISHMENT)
    • banned: required (boolean)

Secured by jwt

Headers

  • Authorization: required (string)

    Used to send a valid JWT access token. In the Authorization header using the Bearer schema.

    Example:

    Bearer eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJzdWIiOiIxMjM0NTY3ODkwIiwibmFtZSI6IkpvaG4gRG9lIiwiYWRtaW4iOnRydWV9.TJVA95OrM7E2cBab30RMHrHDcEfxjoYZgeFONFh7HgQ

Marketing Observations

This resource contains all the necessary operations for the management of the marketing observations, among these operations we will have HTTP methods to get all the elements, to get a single element, to add new elements to the resource, to edit the existing elements and finally to eliminate.

/marketingobs get post

get

Get a list of all the marketing observations.

post

Add a new marketing observation.

get /marketingobs

Get a list of all the marketing observations.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

Query Parameters

  • customerId: (number - minimum: 1)

    Specify the id of the customer.

    Example:

    10
  • start: (number - default: 0 - minimum: 0)

    Specify the index of first element to get

    Example:

    10
  • size: (number - minimum: 10 - maximum: 200)

    Specify the amount of items that will be retrieved per request

    Example:

    150

HTTP status code 200

Successfull request.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • items: required (array of MarketingObsResponse)

    Items: MarketingObsResponse

    • observations: required (string)
    • id: required (number)
    • user: required (object)
      • id: required (number)
      • displayName: required (string)
      • email: required (string)
      • username: (string)
      • urlPic: (string)
    • custormer: required (object)
      • id: required (number)
      • observations: (string)
      • displayName: required (string)
      • identification: required (string)
      • type: required (one of PARTICULAR, ESTABLISHMENT)
      • banned: required (boolean)
    • registerDate: required (datetime)
  • total: required (number)

Example:

{
  "items": [
    {
      "id": 1,
      "user": {
        "id": 1,
        "displayName": "Ali Connors",
        "email": "aliconnors@example.com",
        "username": "ali_connors",
        "urlPic": "http://static.arpia.com/imgs/img_001.jpg"
      },
      "custormer": {
        "id": 1,
        "identification": "123456789",
        "displayName": "Jhon Doe",
        "type": "PARTICULAR",
        "banned": false,
        "observations": "This is a observation."
      },
      "registerDate": "2017-04-01T08:00:00.000Z",
      "observations": "This are the observations"
    },
    {
      "id": 2,
      "user": {
        "id": 2,
        "displayName": "Peter Carlsson",
        "email": "petercarlsson@example.com",
        "username": "peter_carlsson",
        "urlPic": "http://static.arpia.com/imgs/img_002.jpg"
      },
      "custormer": {
        "id": 2,
        "identification": "987654321",
        "displayName": "Ali Connors",
        "type": "PARTICULAR",
        "banned": false
      },
      "registerDate": "2017-04-01T08:00:00.000Z",
      "observations": "This are the observations"
    }
  ],
  "total": 2
}

HTTP status code 404

The origin server did not find a current representation for the target resource or is not willing to disclose that one exists.

Resource not found, specifically occurs when a route is poorly specified, make sure that the resource ID are needing is correct.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 404,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 500

The server encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request.

If an error occurred on the server, the required operation could not be performed, sorry.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 500,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

Secured by jwt

Headers

  • Authorization: required (string)

    Used to send a valid JWT access token. In the Authorization header using the Bearer schema.

    Example:

    Bearer eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJzdWIiOiIxMjM0NTY3ODkwIiwibmFtZSI6IkpvaG4gRG9lIiwiYWRtaW4iOnRydWV9.TJVA95OrM7E2cBab30RMHrHDcEfxjoYZgeFONFh7HgQ

post /marketingobs

Add a new marketing observation.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • observations: required (string)
  • customerId: required (number)

Example:

{
  "customerId": 1,
  "observations": "This are the observations"
}

HTTP status code 201

It has created a new marketingob.

Headers

  • Location: required (string)

    Location where you can get the information of the created marketingob.

    Example:

    http://api.arpia.com/v1/marketingobs/1

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • observations: required (string)
  • id: required (number)
  • user: required (object)
    • id: required (number)
    • displayName: required (string)
    • email: required (string)
    • username: (string)
    • urlPic: (string)
  • custormer: required (object)
    • id: required (number)
    • observations: (string)
    • displayName: required (string)
    • identification: required (string)
    • type: required (one of PARTICULAR, ESTABLISHMENT)
    • banned: required (boolean)
  • registerDate: required (datetime)

Example:

{
  "id": 1,
  "user": {
    "id": 2,
    "displayName": "Peter Carlsson",
    "email": "petercarlsson@example.com",
    "username": "peter_carlsson",
    "urlPic": "http://static.arpia.com/imgs/img_002.jpg"
  },
  "custormer": {
    "id": 1,
    "identification": "123456789",
    "displayName": "Jhon Doe",
    "type": "PARTICULAR",
    "banned": false,
    "observations": "This is a observation."
  },
  "registerDate": "2017-04-01T08:00:00.000Z",
  "observations": "This are the observations"
}

HTTP status code 400

The server cannot or will not process the request due to something that is perceived to be a client error (e.g., malformed request syntax, invalid request message framing, or deceptive request routing).

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 400,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 404

The origin server did not find a current representation for the target resource or is not willing to disclose that one exists.

Resource not found, specifically occurs when a route is poorly specified, make sure that the resource ID are needing is correct.

    Used to send a valid JWT access token. In the Authorization header using the Bearer schema.

    Example:

    Bearer eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJzdWIiOiIxMjM0NTY3ODkwIiwibmFtZSI6IkpvaG4gRG9lIiwiYWRtaW4iOnRydWV9.TJVA95OrM7E2cBab30RMHrHDcEfxjoYZgeFONFh7HgQ

/marketingobs/{id} get put delete

A specific marketing observation, a item of the marketing observations list.

get

Get information about a marketing observation.

put

Update information about the specific marketing observation.

delete

Remove a specific marketing observation.

get /marketingobs/{id}

Get information about a marketing observation.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • id: required (number)

    marketing observation ID is required.

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

HTTP status code 200

Successfull request.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • observations: required (string)
  • id: required (number)
  • user: required (object)
    • id: required (number)
    • displayName: required (string)
    • email: required (string)
    • username: (string)
    • urlPic: (string)
  • custormer: required (object)
    • id: required (number)
    • observations: (string)
    • displayName: required (string)
    • identification: required (string)
    • type: required (one of PARTICULAR, ESTABLISHMENT)
    • banned: required (boolean)
  • registerDate: required (datetime)

Example:

{
  "id": 1,
  "user": {
    "id": 1,
    "displayName": "Ali Connors",
    "email": "aliconnors@example.com",
    "username": "ali_connors",
    "urlPic": "http://static.arpia.com/imgs/img_001.jpg"
  },
  "custormer": {
    "id": 1,
    "identification": "123456789",
    "displayName": "Jhon Doe",
    "type": "PARTICULAR",
    "banned": false,
    "observations": "This is a observation."
  },
  "registerDate": "2017-04-01T08:00:00.000Z",
  "observations": "This are the observations"
}

put /marketingobs/{id}

Update information about the specific marketing observation.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • id: required (number)

    marketing observation ID is required.

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • observations: required (string)
  • customerId: required (number)

Example:

{
  "customerId": 1,
  "observations": "This are the observations"
}

HTTP status code 200

It has updated a marketingob.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • observations: required (string)
  • id: required (number)
  • user: required (object)
    • id: required (number)
    • displayName: required (string)
    • email: required (string)
    • username: (string)
    • urlPic: (string)
  • custormer: required (object)
    • id: required (number)
    • observations: (string)
    • displayName: required (string)
    • identification: required (string)
    • type: required (one of PARTICULAR, ESTABLISHMENT)
    • banned: required (boolean)
  • registerDate: required (datetime)

Example:

{
  "id": 1,
  "user": {
    "id": 1,
    "displayName": "Ali Connors",
    "email": "aliconnors@example.com",
    "username": "ali_connors",
    "urlPic": "http://static.arpia.com/imgs/img_001.jpg"
  },

    "id": 1,

    "type": "PARTICULAR",
    "banned": false,
    "observations": "This is a observation."
  },
  "registerDate": "2017-04-01T08:00:00.000Z",
  "observations": "This are the observations"
}

delete /marketingobs/{id}

Remove a specific marketing observation.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • id: required (number)

    marketing observation ID is required.

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

HTTP status code 200

Successfull request.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • observations: required (string)
  • id: required (number)
  • user: required (object)
    • id: required (number)
    • displayName: required (string)
    • email: required (string)
    • username: (string)
    • urlPic: (string)
  • custormer: required (object)
    • id: required (number)
    • observations: (string)
    • displayName: required (string)
    • identification: required (string)
    • type: required (one of PARTICULAR, ESTABLISHMENT)
    • banned: required (boolean)
  • registerDate: required (datetime)

{
  "id": 1,
  "user": {
    "id": 2,
    "displayName": "Peter Carlsson",
    "email": "petercarlsson@example.com",
