Messengers

This resource contains all the necessary operations for the management of the messengers, among these operations we will have HTTP methods to get all the elements, to get a single element, to add new elements to the resource, to edit the existing elements and finally to eliminate.

/messengers get post

get

Get a list of all messengers.

post

Add a new messenger.

get /messengers

Get a list of all messengers.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

Query Parameters

  • dismissal: (boolean)

    True, if you need get list filtered by dismissal.

  • category: (integer - minimum: 1 - maximum: 5)

    Provida if you need get list filtered by category.

  • search: (string)

    The value to search.

  • start: (number - default: 0 - minimum: 0)

    Specify the index of first element to get

    Example:

    10
  • size: (number - minimum: 10 - maximum: 200)

    Specify the amount of items that will be retrieved per request

    Example:

    150
  • orderBy: (string)

    Specify the property of the object be sorted.

  • orderType: (one of ASC, DESC - default: ASC)

    Specify whether to sort ascending or descending

HTTP status code 200

Successfull request.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • items: required (array of Messenger)

    Items: Messenger

    • dismissal: (boolean - default: false)
    • observations: (string)
    • photo: required (string)
    • category: (integer)
  • total: required (number)

HTTP status code 404

The origin server did not find a current representation for the target resource or is not willing to disclose that one exists.

Resource not found, specifically occurs when a route is poorly specified, make sure that the resource ID are needing is correct.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 404,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 500

The server encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request.

If an error occurred on the server, the required operation could not be performed, sorry.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 500,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

Secured by jwt

Headers

  • Authorization: required (string)

    Used to send a valid JWT access token. In the Authorization header using the Bearer schema.

    Example:

    Bearer eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJzdWIiOiIxMjM0NTY3ODkwIiwibmFtZSI6IkpvaG4gRG9lIiwiYWRtaW4iOnRydWV9.TJVA95OrM7E2cBab30RMHrHDcEfxjoYZgeFONFh7HgQ

post /messengers

Add a new messenger.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: Messenger

Properties
  • curriculumVitae: required (object)
    • id: (number)
    • socialSecurity: required (object)
      • nameEPS: required (string)
      • nameARL: required (string)
      • pensionEntity: required (string)
    • home: required (object)
      • stratum: required (integer)
      • sonsNumber: required (integer)
      • homeownership: required (one of OWN, RENT)
      • monthlyExpenses: required (number)
    • civilStatus: required (one of SINGLE, MARRIED, WIDOWER, COMMITTED, DIVORCED)
    • birthCity: required (string)
    • academicLevel: required (one of BASIC_EDUCATION, SECONDARY_EDUCATION, TECHNICIAN, TECHNOLOGIST, PROFESSIONAL)
    • militaryCard: (string)
    • district: (string)
    • references: (array of Reference)

      Items: Reference

      • index: (integer)
      • name: required (string)
      • lastName: required (string)
      • address: required (string)
      • phoneNumber: required (string)
      • type: required (one of FAMILY, PERSONAL)
      • relationship: required (one of MOTHER, FATHER, BROTHERS, CHILDREN, OTHER)
  • password: required (string)

HTTP status code 201

It has created a new messenger.

Headers

  • Location: required (string)

    Location where you can get the information of the created messenger.

    Example:

    http://api.arpia.com/v1/messengers/1

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: Person

Properties
  • dismissal: (boolean - default: false)
  • observations: (string)
  • photo: required (string)
  • category: (integer)

HTTP status code 400

The server cannot or will not process the request due to something that is perceived to be a client error (e.g., malformed request syntax, invalid request message framing, or deceptive request routing).

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 400,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 404

The origin server did not find a current representation for the target resource or is not willing to disclose that one exists.

Resource not found, specifically occurs when a route is poorly specified, make sure that the resource ID are needing is correct.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 404,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 500

The server encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request.

If an error occurred on the server, the required operation could not be performed, sorry.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 500,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

Secured by jwt

Headers

  • Authorization: required (string)

    Used to send a valid JWT access token. In the Authorization header using the Bearer schema.

    Example:

    Bearer eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJzdWIiOiIxMjM0NTY3ODkwIiwibmFtZSI6IkpvaG4gRG9lIiwiYWRtaW4iOnRydWV9.TJVA95OrM7E2cBab30RMHrHDcEfxjoYZgeFONFh7HgQ

/messengers/{id} get put delete

A specific messenger, a item of the messengers list.

get

Get information about a messenger.

put

Update information about the specific messenger.

delete

Remove a specific messenger.

get /messengers/{id}

Get information about a messenger.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • id: required (number)

    Messenger ID is required.

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

HTTP status code 200

Successfull request.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: Person

Properties
  • dismissal: (boolean - default: false)
  • observations: (string)
  • photo: required (string)
  • category: (integer)

HTTP status code 400

The server cannot or will not process the request due to something that is perceived to be a client error (e.g., malformed request syntax, invalid request message framing, or deceptive request routing).

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 400,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 404

The origin server did not find a current representation for the target resource or is not willing to disclose that one exists.

Resource not found, specifically occurs when a route is poorly specified, make sure that the resource ID are needing is correct.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

  "statusCode": 404,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 500

The server encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request.

If an error occurred on the server, the required operation could not be performed, sorry.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

put /messengers/{id}

Update information about the specific messenger.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • id: required (number)

    Messenger ID is required.

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: Messenger

Properties
  • curriculumVitae: required (object)
    • id: (number)
    • socialSecurity: required (object)
      • nameEPS: required (string)
      • nameARL: required (string)
      • pensionEntity: required (string)
    • home: required (object)
      • stratum: required (integer)
      • sonsNumber: required (integer)
      • homeownership: required (one of OWN, RENT)
      • monthlyExpenses: required (number)
    • civilStatus: required (one of SINGLE, MARRIED, WIDOWER, COMMITTED, DIVORCED)
    • birthCity: required (string)
    • academicLevel: required (one of BASIC_EDUCATION, SECONDARY_EDUCATION, TECHNICIAN, TECHNOLOGIST, PROFESSIONAL)
    • militaryCard: (string)
    • district: (string)
    • references: (array of Reference)

      Items: Reference

      • index: (integer)
      • name: required (string)
      • lastName: required (string)
      • address: required (string)
      • phoneNumber: required (string)
      • type: required (one of FAMILY, PERSONAL)
      • relationship: required (one of MOTHER, FATHER, BROTHERS, CHILDREN, OTHER)
  • password: required (string)

HTTP status code 200

It has updated a messenger.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: Person

Properties
  • dismissal: (boolean - default: false)
  • observations: (string)
  • photo: required (string)
  • category: (integer)

/messengers/vehicles get post

This resource contains all the necessary operations for the management of the vehicles, among these operations we will have HTTP methods to get all the elements, to get a single element, to add new elements to the resource, to edit the existing elements and finally to eliminate.

get

Get a list of all vehicles.

post

Add a new vehicle.

get /messengers/vehicles

Get a list of all vehicles.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

HTTP status code 200

Successfull request.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: array of Vehicle

Items: Vehicle

  • tecnomecanicaExpiration: required (date-only)
  • color: (string)
  • licensePlate: required (string)
  • soatExpiration: required (date-only)
  • id: (number)
  • ownership: required (one of INDIVIDUAL, BORROWED)
  • vehicleCondition: required (one of GOOD, REGULAR, BAD)
  • trademark: required (string)
  • model: required (string)

HTTP status code 404

The origin server did not find a current representation for the target resource or is not willing to disclose that one exists.

Resource not found, specifically occurs when a route is poorly specified, make sure that the resource ID are needing is correct.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 404,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 500

The server encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request.

If an error occurred on the server, the required operation could not be performed, sorry.

Add a new vehicle.

Secured by jwt

  • Security

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

Media type: application/json

  • tecnomecanicaExpiration: required (date-only)
  • color: (string)
  • licensePlate: required (string)
  • soatExpiration: required (date-only)
  • id: (number)
  • ownership: required (one of INDIVIDUAL, BORROWED)
  • vehicleCondition: required (one of GOOD, REGULAR, BAD)
  • trademark: required (string)
  • model: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 500,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

Secured by jwt

Headers

  • Authorization: required (string)

    Used to send a valid JWT access token. In the Authorization header using the Bearer schema.

    Example:

    Bearer eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJzdWIiOiIxMjM0NTY3ODkwIiwibmFtZSI6IkpvaG4gRG9lIiwiYWRtaW4iOnRydWV9.TJVA95OrM7E2cBab30RMHrHDcEfxjoYZgeFONFh7HgQ

put /messengers/vehicles/{id}

Update information about the specific vehicle.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • id: required (number)

    Vehicle ID is required.

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • tecnomecanicaExpiration: required (date-only)
  • color: (string)
  • licensePlate: required (string)
  • soatExpiration: required (date-only)
  • id: (number)
  • ownership: required (one of INDIVIDUAL, BORROWED)
  • vehicleCondition: required (one of GOOD, REGULAR, BAD)
  • trademark: required (string)
  • model: required (string)

HTTP status code 200

It has updated a vehicle.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • tecnomecanicaExpiration: required (date-only)
  • color: (string)
  • licensePlate: required (string)
  • soatExpiration: required (date-only)
  • id: (number)
  • ownership: required (one of INDIVIDUAL, BORROWED)
  • vehicleCondition: required (one of GOOD, REGULAR, BAD)
  • trademark: required (string)
  • model: required (string)

HTTP status code 400

The server cannot or will not process the request due to something that is perceived to be a client error (e.g., malformed request syntax, invalid request message framing, or deceptive request routing).

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 400,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 404

The origin server did not find a current representation for the target resource or is not willing to disclose that one exists.

Resource not found, specifically occurs when a route is poorly specified, make sure that the resource ID are needing is correct.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 404,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 500

The server encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request.

If an error occurred on the server, the required operation could not be performed, sorry.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 500,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

Secured by jwt

Headers

  • Authorization: required (string)

    Used to send a valid JWT access token. In the Authorization header using the Bearer schema.

    Example:

    Bearer eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJzdWIiOiIxMjM0NTY3ODkwIiwibmFtZSI6IkpvaG4gRG9lIiwiYWRtaW4iOnRydWV9.TJVA95OrM7E2cBab30RMHrHDcEfxjoYZgeFONFh7HgQ

Remove a specific vehicle.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • id: required (number)

    Vehicle ID is required.

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

HTTP status code 200

Successfull request.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • tecnomecanicaExpiration: required (date-only)
  • color: (string)
  • licensePlate: required (string)
  • soatExpiration: required (date-only)

  • ownership: required (one of INDIVIDUAL, BORROWED)
  • vehicleCondition: required (one of GOOD, REGULAR, BAD)
  • trademark: required (string)
  • model: required (string)

HTTP status code 400

The server cannot or will not process the request due to something that is perceived to be a client error (e.g., malformed request syntax, invalid request message framing, or deceptive request routing).

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

  "statusCode": 400,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 404

The origin server did not find a current representation for the target resource or is not willing to disclose that one exists.

Resource not found, specifically occurs when a route is poorly specified, make sure that the resource ID are needing is correct.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 500

The server encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request.

If an error occurred on the server, the required operation could not be performed, sorry.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{

  "statusCode": 500,
  "messages": [

Secured by jwt

Headers

  • Authorization: required (string)

    Used to send a valid JWT access token. In the Authorization header using the Bearer schema.

    Example:

    Bearer eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJzdWIiOiIxMjM0NTY3ODkwIiwibmFtZSI6IkpvaG4gRG9lIiwiYWRtaW4iOnRydWV9.TJVA95OrM7E2cBab30RMHrHDcEfxjoYZgeFONFh7HgQ

Mobiles

This resource contains all the necessary operations for the management of the mobiles, among these operations we will have HTTP methods to get all the elements, to get a single element, to add new elements to the resource, to edit the existing elements and finally to eliminate.

/mobiles get post

get

Get a list of all mobiles.

post

Add a new mobile.

get /mobiles

Get a list of all mobiles.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

Query Parameters

  • operation: required (number)

    Provide if you need get list filtered by operation.

    Example:

    1
  • available: (boolean)

    true, if you need get list filtered by available.

    Example:

    false
  • start: (number - default: 0 - minimum: 0)

    Specify the index of first element to get

    Example:

    10
  • size: (number - minimum: 10 - maximum: 200)

    Specify the amount of items that will be retrieved per request

    Example:

    150
  • orderBy: (string)

    Specify the property of the object be sorted.

  • orderType: (one of ASC, DESC - default: ASC)

    Specify whether to sort ascending or descending

HTTP status code 200

Successfull request.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: array of Mobile

Items: Mobile

  • index: required (integer)
  • messenger: (object)
    • id: required (number)
    • identification: required (string)
    • name: required (string)
    • lastName: required (string)
    • gender: (one of MALE, FEMALE)
    • birthday: (date-only)
    • photo: required (string)
    • category: (number)
  • createdDate: required (datetime)
  • updatedDate: (datetime)

Example:

[
  {
    "index": 1,
    "createdDate": "2017-05-05T08:00:00.000Z"
  },
  {
    "index": 2,
    "messenger": {
      "id": 1,
      "identification": "12346798",
      "name": "Jhon",
      "lastName": "Doe",
      "gender": "MALE",
      "birthday": "1993-02-11",
      "photo": "http://static.arpia.com/imgs/img_001.jpg",
      "category": 5
    },
    "createdDate": "2017-05-05T08:00:00.000Z",
    "updatedDate": "2017-05-06T12:30:00.000Z"
  },
  {
    "index": 3,
    "createdDate": "2017-05-05T08:00:00.000Z"
  }
]

HTTP status code 404

The origin server did not find a current representation for the target resource or is not willing to disclose that one exists.

Resource not found, specifically occurs when a route is poorly specified, make sure that the resource ID are needing is correct.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 404,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 500

The server encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request.

If an error occurred on the server, the required operation could not be performed, sorry.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    • message: required (string)

      "message": "This is a first error message."

      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]

    Used to send a valid JWT access token. In the Authorization header using the Bearer schema.

    Example:

    Bearer eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJzdWIiOiIxMjM0NTY3ODkwIiwibmFtZSI6IkpvaG4gRG9lIiwiYWRtaW4iOnRydWV9.TJVA95OrM7E2cBab30RMHrHDcEfxjoYZgeFONFh7HgQ

post /mobiles

Add a new mobile.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • quantity: required (integer)
  • operationId: required (number)

Example:

{
  "quantity": 50,
  "operationId": 1
}

HTTP status code 201

It has created a new mobile.

Headers

  • Location: required (string)

    Location where you can get the information of the created mobile.

    Example:

    http://api.arpia.com/v1/mobiles/1

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • index: required (integer)
  • messenger: (object)
    • id: required (number)
    • identification: required (string)
    • name: required (string)
    • lastName: required (string)
    • gender: (one of MALE, FEMALE)
    • birthday: (date-only)
    • photo: required (string)
    • category: (number)
  • createdDate: required (datetime)
  • updatedDate: (datetime)

HTTP status code 400

The server cannot or will not process the request due to something that is perceived to be a client error (e.g., malformed request syntax, invalid request message framing, or deceptive request routing).

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

    • message: required (string)

  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

Monitorings

This resource contains all the necessary operations for the management of the monitorings, among these operations we will have HTTP methods to get all the elements, to get a single element, to add new elements to the resource, to edit the existing elements and finally to eliminate.

/monitorings get post

get

Get a list of all monitorings.

post

Add a new monitoring.

get /monitorings

Get a list of all monitorings.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

Query Parameters

  • startDate: (datetime)

    Specify the start date of the monitoring.

    Example:

    2017-04-10T08:00:00.000Z
  • endDate: (datetime)

    Specify the end date of the monitoring.

    Example:

    2017-04-10T08:00:00.000Z
  • domicileId: (number)

    Specify the domicile of the monitoring.

    Example:

    10
  • search: (string)

    The value to search.

  • start: (number - default: 0 - minimum: 0)

    Specify the index of first element to get

    Example:

    10
  • size: (number - minimum: 10 - maximum: 200)

    Specify the amount of items that will be retrieved per request

    Example:

    150
  • orderBy: (string)

    Specify the property of the object be sorted.

  • orderType: (one of ASC, DESC - default: ASC)

    Specify whether to sort ascending or descending

HTTP status code 200

Successfull request.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • items: required (array of MonitoringResponse)

    Items: MonitoringResponse

    • domicileId: required (number)
    • content: required (string)
    • id: required (number)
    • user: required (object)
      • id: required (number)
      • displayName: required (string)
      • email: required (string)
      • username: (string)
      • urlPic: (string)
    • modifierUser: required (object)
      • id: required (number)
      • displayName: required (string)
      • email: required (string)
      • username: (string)
      • urlPic: (string)
    • registerDate: required (datetime)
    • updatedDate: required (datetime)
  • total: required (number)

Example:

{
  "items": [
    {
      "id": 1,
      "user": {
        "id": 1,
        "displayName": "Ali Connors",
        "email": "aliconnors@example.com",
        "username": "ali_connors",
        "urlPic": "http://static.arpia.com/imgs/img_001.jpg"
      },
      "modifierUser": {
        "id": 1,
        "displayName": "Ali Connors",
        "email": "aliconnors@example.com",
        "username": "ali_connors",
        "urlPic": "http://static.arpia.com/imgs/img_001.jpg"
      },
      "registerDate": "2017-04-01T08:00:00.000Z",
      "updatedDate": "2017-04-10T08:00:00.000Z",
      "domicileId": 1,
      "content": "this is content"
    },
    {
      "id": 2,
      "user": {
        "id": 1,
        "displayName": "Ali Connors",
        "email": "aliconnors@example.com",
        "username": "ali_connors",
        "urlPic": "http://static.arpia.com/imgs/img_001.jpg"
      },
      "modifierUser": {
        "id": 2,
        "displayName": "Peter Carlsson",
        "email": "petercarlsson@example.com",
        "username": "peter_carlsson",
        "urlPic": "http://static.arpia.com/imgs/img_002.jpg"
      },
      "registerDate": "2017-04-01T08:00:00.000Z",
      "updatedDate": "2017-04-10T08:00:00.000Z",
      "domicileId": 2,
      "content": "this is content"
    }
  ],
  "total": 2
}

HTTP status code 404

The origin server did not find a current representation for the target resource or is not willing to disclose that one exists.

Resource not found, specifically occurs when a route is poorly specified, make sure that the resource ID are needing is correct.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 404,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

Add a new monitoring.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

Type: object

Properties
  • domicileId: required (number)
  • content: required (string)

Example:

{
  "domicileId": 1,
  "content": "This is content"
}

    Location where you can get the information of the created monitoring.

    Example:

    http://api.arpia.com/v1/monitorings/1

    Example:

    Bearer eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJzdWIiOiIxMjM0NTY3ODkwIiwibmFtZSI6IkpvaG4gRG9lIiwiYWRtaW4iOnRydWV9.TJVA95OrM7E2cBab30RMHrHDcEfxjoYZgeFONFh7HgQ

/monitorings/{id} get put delete

A specific monitoring, a item of the monitorings list.

get

Get information about a monitoring.

put

Update information about the specific monitoring.

delete

Remove a specific monitoring.

get /monitorings/{id}

Get information about a monitoring.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • id: required (number)

    Monitoring ID is required.

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

HTTP status code 200

Successfull request.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • domicileId: required (number)
  • content: required (string)
  • id: required (number)
  • user: required (object)
    • id: required (number)
    • displayName: required (string)
    • email: required (string)
    • username: (string)
    • urlPic: (string)
  • modifierUser: required (object)
    • id: required (number)
    • displayName: required (string)
    • email: required (string)
    • username: (string)
    • urlPic: (string)
  • registerDate: required (datetime)
  • updatedDate: required (datetime)

Example:

{
  "id": 1,
  "user": {
    "id": 1,
    "displayName": "Ali Connors",
    "email": "aliconnors@example.com",
    "username": "ali_connors",
    "urlPic": "http://static.arpia.com/imgs/img_001.jpg"
  },
  "modifierUser": {
    "id": 2,
    "displayName": "Peter Carlsson",
    "email": "petercarlsson@example.com",
    "username": "peter_carlsson",
    "urlPic": "http://static.arpia.com/imgs/img_002.jpg"
  },
  "registerDate": "2017-04-01T08:00:00.000Z",
  "updatedDate": "2017-04-10T08:00:00.000Z",
  "domicileId": 1,
  "content": "this is content"
}

HTTP status code 400

The server cannot or will not process the request due to something that is perceived to be a client error (e.g., malformed request syntax, invalid request message framing, or deceptive request routing).

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 400,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 404

The origin server did not find a current representation for the target resource or is not willing to disclose that one exists.

Resource not found, specifically occurs when a route is poorly specified, make sure that the resource ID are needing is correct.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 404,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 500

The server encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request.

If an error occurred on the server, the required operation could not be performed, sorry.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 500,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

Secured by jwt

Headers

  • Authorization: required (string)

    Used to send a valid JWT access token. In the Authorization header using the Bearer schema.

    Example:

    Bearer eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJzdWIiOiIxMjM0NTY3ODkwIiwibmFtZSI6IkpvaG4gRG9lIiwiYWRtaW4iOnRydWV9.TJVA95OrM7E2cBab30RMHrHDcEfxjoYZgeFONFh7HgQ

Secured by jwt

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • id: required (number)

    Monitoring ID is required.

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • domicileId: required (number)
  • content: required (string)

HTTP status code 200

It has updated a monitoring.

Type: object

Properties
  • domicileId: required (number)
  • content: required (string)
  • id: required (number)

Neighborhoods

This resource contains all the necessary operations for the management of the neighborhoods, among these operations we will have HTTP methods to get all the elements, to get a single element, to add new elements to the resource, to edit the existing elements and finally to eliminate.

/neighborhoods get post

get

Get a list of all neighborhoods.

post

Add a new neighborhood.

get /neighborhoods

Get a list of all neighborhoods.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

Query Parameters

  • start: (number - default: 0 - minimum: 0)

    Specify the index of first element to get

    Example:

    10
  • size: (number - minimum: 10 - maximum: 200)

    Specify the amount of items that will be retrieved per request

    Example:

    150
  • search: (string)

    The value to search.

HTTP status code 200

Successfull request.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • items: required (array of NeighborhoodResponse)

    Items: NeighborhoodResponse

    • id: required (number)
    • name: required (string)
  • total: required (number)

Example:

{
  "items": [
    {
      "id": 1,
      "name": "Downtown Springfield"
    },
    {
      "id": 2,
      "name": "Pressboard Estates"
    }
  ],
  "total": 2
}

HTTP status code 404

The origin server did not find a current representation for the target resource or is not willing to disclose that one exists.

Resource not found, specifically occurs when a route is poorly specified, make sure that the resource ID are needing is correct.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 404,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 500

The server encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request.

If an error occurred on the server, the required operation could not be performed, sorry.

Body

Media type: application/json

  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    • message: required (string)

    }

    Example:

post /neighborhoods

Add a new neighborhood.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • name: required (string)

Example:

{
  "name": "Pressboard Estates"
}

HTTP status code 201

It has created a new neighborhood.

Headers

  • Location: required (string)

    Location where you can get the information of the created neighborhood.

    Example:

    http://api.arpia.com/v1/neighborhoods/1

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • id: required (number)
  • name: required (string)

Example:

{
  "id": 1,
  "name": "Pressboard Estates"
}

  • id: required (number)

    Neighborhood ID is required.

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

HTTP status code 200

Successfull request.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • id: required (number)
  • name: required (string)

Example:

{
  "id": 1,
  "name": "Pressboard Estates"
}

HTTP status code 400

The server cannot or will not process the request due to something that is perceived to be a client error (e.g., malformed request syntax, invalid request message framing, or deceptive request routing).

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 400,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 404

The origin server did not find a current representation for the target resource or is not willing to disclose that one exists.

Resource not found, specifically occurs when a route is poorly specified, make sure that the resource ID are needing is correct.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 404,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 500

The server encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request.

If an error occurred on the server, the required operation could not be performed, sorry.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 500,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

Secured by jwt

Headers

  • Authorization: required (string)

    Used to send a valid JWT access token. In the Authorization header using the Bearer schema.

    Example:

    Bearer eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJzdWIiOiIxMjM0NTY3ODkwIiwibmFtZSI6IkpvaG4gRG9lIiwiYWRtaW4iOnRydWV9.TJVA95OrM7E2cBab30RMHrHDcEfxjoYZgeFONFh7HgQ

/neighborhoods/{id}/customers get

get

At this endpoint we can get all customers registered in the neighborhood with ID specified.

get /neighborhoods/{id}/customers

At this endpoint we can get all customers registered in the neighborhood with ID specified.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • id: required (number)

    Neighborhood ID is required.

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

HTTP status code 200

Successfull request.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • items: required (array of Customer)

    Items: Customer

    • id: required (number)
    • observations: (string)
    • displayName: required (string)
    • identification: required (string)
    • type: required (one of PARTICULAR, ESTABLISHMENT)
    • banned: required (boolean)
  • total: required (integer)

Example:

{
  "items": [
    {
      "id": 1,
      "identification": "123456789",
      "displayName": "Jhon Doe",
      "type": "PARTICULAR",
      "banned": false,
      "observations": "This is a observations."
    },
    {
      "id": 2,
      "identification": "987654321",
      "displayName": "Jhon Doe",
      "type": "PARTICULAR",
      "banned": false
    }
  ],
  "total": 10
}

HTTP status code 400

The server cannot or will not process the request due to something that is perceived to be a client error (e.g., malformed request syntax, invalid request message framing, or deceptive request routing).

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 400,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 404

The origin server did not find a current representation for the target resource or is not willing to disclose that one exists.

Resource not found, specifically occurs when a route is poorly specified, make sure that the resource ID are needing is correct.

Example:

  "statusCode": 404,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 500

The server encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request.

If an error occurred on the server, the required operation could not be performed, sorry.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

Example:

  "messages": [

      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }

    Used to send a valid JWT access token. In the Authorization header using the Bearer schema.

    Example:

    Bearer eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJzdWIiOiIxMjM0NTY3ODkwIiwibmFtZSI6IkpvaG4gRG9lIiwiYWRtaW4iOnRydWV9.TJVA95OrM7E2cBab30RMHrHDcEfxjoYZgeFONFh7HgQ

/neighborhoods/{id}/domiciles get

get

In this endpoint we will be able to obtain all the home services made in the neighborhood with corresponding ID.

get /neighborhoods/{id}/domiciles

In this endpoint we will be able to obtain all the home services made in the neighborhood with corresponding ID.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • id: required (number)

    Neighborhood ID is required.

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

HTTP status code 200

Successfull request.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • items: required (array of DomicileExecute)

    Items: DomicileExecute

    • id: (number)
    • assignments: (array of Assignment)

      Items: Assignment

      • index: required (integer)
      • messengerId: required (number)
      • registerDate: required (datetime)
    • price: required (number)
    • messengerGain: required (number)
    • discount: (number)
    • status: (one of WAITING, DISPATCHED, FINALIZED)
    • automatic: required (boolean)
    • startDate: (datetime)
    • finishDate: (datetime)
    • cancelDate: (datetime)
    • cancelReason: (string)
    • domicile: required (number | Domicile)
  • total: required (integer)

Example:

{
  "items": [
    {
      "id": 1,
      "assignments": [
        {
          "index": 1,
          "messengerId": 1,
          "registerDate": "2017-04-20T12:30:00.000Z"
        }
      ],
      "status": "DISPATCHED",
      "price": 10000,
      "messengerGain": 5000,
      "automatic": true,
      "startDate": "2017-04-20T12:35:00.000Z",
      "domicile": {
        "id": 1,
        "customerId": 1,
        "operationId": 1,
        "locations": [
          {
            "index": 1,
            "address": "CRA 45 # 15-32",
            "reference": "This is a reference.",
            "coordinates": {
              "latitude": 10.4237186,
              "longitude": -75.5456146
            },
            "task": "This is taks."
          },
          {
            "index": 2,
            "address": "CRA 85 # 32-15",
            "reference": "This is a reference.",
            "task": "This is taks."
          }
        ],
        "rating": {
          "trustLevel": 3,
          "priority": "NORMAL"
        },
        "requirements": {
          "cashRequired": 0,
          "monitoring": false
        },
        "createDate": "2017-04-20T12:32:00.000Z",
        "periodicity": {
          "type": "monthlyRepeatData",
          "time": "12:30:00",
          "startDate": "2017-01-01",
          "endDate": "2017-12-31",
          "every": 1,
          "dayOfMonth": 15
        }
      }
    },
    {
      "id": 2,
      "assignments": [
        {
          "index": 1,
          "messengerId": 1,
          "registerDate": "2017-04-20T12:30:00.000Z"
        },
        {
          "index": 2,
          "messengerId": 2,
          "registerDate": "2017-04-20T12:30:00.000Z"
        }
      ],
      "status": "FINALIZED",
      "price": 10000,
      "messengerGain": 5000,
      "automatic": true,
      "startDate": "2017-04-20T12:35:00.000Z",
      "finishDate": "2017-04-20T12:53:00.000Z",
      "domicile": {
        "id": 1,
        "customerId": 1,
        "operationId": 1,
        "locations": [
          {
            "index": 1,
            "address": "CRA 45 # 15-32",
            "reference": "This is a reference.",
            "coordinates": {
              "latitude": 10.4237186,
              "longitude": -75.5456146
            },
            "task": "This is taks."
          },
          {
            "index": 2,
            "address": "CRA 85 # 32-15",
            "reference": "This is a reference.",
            "task": "This is taks."
          }
        ],
        "rating": {
          "trustLevel": 3,
          "priority": "NORMAL"
        },
        "requirements": {
          "cashRequired": 0,
          "monitoring": false
        },
        "createDate": "2017-04-20T12:32:00.000Z",
        "periodicity": {
          "type": "monthlyRepeatData",
          "time": "12:30:00",
          "startDate": "2017-01-01",
          "endDate": "2017-12-31",
          "every": 1,
          "dayOfMonth": 15
        }
      }
    }
  ],
  "total": 10
}

HTTP status code 400

The server cannot or will not process the request due to something that is perceived to be a client error (e.g., malformed request syntax, invalid request message framing, or deceptive request routing).

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 400,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 404

The origin server did not find a current representation for the target resource or is not willing to disclose that one exists.

Resource not found, specifically occurs when a route is poorly specified, make sure that the resource ID are needing is correct.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 404,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 500

The server encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request.

If an error occurred on the server, the required operation could not be performed, sorry.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

  "statusCode": 500,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."

    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

Secured by jwt

Headers

  • Authorization: required (string)

    Used to send a valid JWT access token. In the Authorization header using the Bearer schema.

    Example:

    Bearer eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJzdWIiOiIxMjM0NTY3ODkwIiwibmFtZSI6IkpvaG4gRG9lIiwiYWRtaW4iOnRydWV9.TJVA95OrM7E2cBab30RMHrHDcEfxjoYZgeFONFh7HgQ

Operations

This resource contains all the necessary operations for the management of the operations, among these operations we will have HTTP methods to get all the elements, to get a single element, to add new elements to the resource, to edit the existing elements and finally to eliminate.

/operations get post

get

Get a list of all operations.

post

Add a new operation.

get /operations

Get a list of all operations.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

HTTP status code 200

Successfull request.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: array of Operation

Items: Operation

  • id: (number)
  • name: required (string)
  • alias: required (string)
  • description: (string)
  • imageUrl: (string)
  • adminUser: (object)
    • id: required (number)
    • username: (string)
    • email: required (string)
    • displayName: required (string)

Example:

[
  {
    "id": 1,
    "name": "Operation 411",
    "alias": "411",
    "adminUser": {
      "id": 1,
      "username": "admin",
      "email": "admin@mail.com",
      "displayName": "Administrador"
    },
    "description": "This is a description",
    "imageUrl": "http://static.arpia.com/imgs/img_001.jpg"
  },
  {
    "id": 2,
    "name": "Operation 357",
    "alias": "357",
    "adminUser": {
      "id": 2,
      "username": "admin2",
      "email": "admin2@mail.com",
      "displayName": "Administrador 2"
    },
    "description": "This is a description",
    "imageUrl": "http://static.arpia.com/imgs/img_002.jpg"
  }
]

HTTP status code 404

The origin server did not find a current representation for the target resource or is not willing to disclose that one exists.

Resource not found, specifically occurs when a route is poorly specified, make sure that the resource ID are needing is correct.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 404,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 500

The server encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request.

If an error occurred on the server, the required operation could not be performed, sorry.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)

post /operations

Add a new operation.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • description: (string)
  • administrator: required (string)
  • email: required (string)
  • password: required (string)
  • name: required (string)
  • imageUrl: (string)
  • alias: required (string)
  • adminUser: (object)
    • id: required (number)
    • username: (string)
    • email: required (string)
    • displayName: required (string)
  • id: (number)

Example:

{
  "name": "Operation 411",
  "alias": "411",
  "administrator": "Juan Pablo",
  "password": "123456",
  "email": "juanpablo@mail.com"
}

HTTP status code 201

It has created a new operation.

Headers

  • Location: required (string)

    Location where you can get the information of the created operation.

    Example:

    http://api.arpia.com/v1/operations/1

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • id: (number)
  • name: required (string)
  • alias: required (string)
  • description: (string)
  • imageUrl: (string)
  • adminUser: (object)
    • id: required (number)
    • username: (string)
    • email: required (string)
    • displayName: required (string)

HTTP status code 400

The server cannot or will not process the request due to something that is perceived to be a client error (e.g., malformed request syntax, invalid request message framing, or deceptive request routing).

Body

Media type: application/json

  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]

/operations/{id} get put delete

A specific operation, a item of the operations list.

get

Get information about a operation.

put

Update information about the specific operation.

delete

Remove a specific operation.

get /operations/{id}

Get information about a operation.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • id: required (number)

    Operation ID is required.

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

HTTP status code 200

Successfull request.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • id: (number)
  • name: required (string)
  • alias: required (string)
  • description: (string)
  • imageUrl: (string)
  • adminUser: (object)
    • id: required (number)
    • username: (string)
    • email: required (string)
    • displayName: required (string)

Example:

{
  "id": 1,
  "name": "Operation 411",
  "alias": "411",
  "adminUser": {
    "id": 1,
    "username": "admin",
    "email": "admin@mail.com",
    "displayName": "Administrador"
  },
  "description": "This is a description",
  "imageUrl": "http://static.arpia.com/imgs/img_001.jpg"
}

    Used to send a valid JWT access token. In the Authorization header using the Bearer schema.

    Example:

    Bearer eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJzdWIiOiIxMjM0NTY3ODkwIiwibmFtZSI6IkpvaG4gRG9lIiwiYWRtaW4iOnRydWV9.TJVA95OrM7E2cBab30RMHrHDcEfxjoYZgeFONFh7HgQ

put /operations/{id}

Update information about the specific operation.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • id: required (number)

    Operation ID is required.

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • id: (number)
  • name: required (string)
  • alias: required (string)
  • description: (string)
  • imageUrl: (string)
  • adminUser: (object)
    • id: required (number)
    • username: (string)
    • email: required (string)
    • displayName: required (string)

HTTP status code 200

It has updated a operation.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • id: (number)
  • name: required (string)
  • alias: required (string)
  • description: (string)
  • imageUrl: (string)
  • adminUser: (object)
    • id: required (number)
    • username: (string)
    • email: required (string)
    • displayName: required (string)

HTTP status code 400

The server cannot or will not process the request due to something that is perceived to be a client error (e.g., malformed request syntax, invalid request message framing, or deceptive request routing).

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 400,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 404

The origin server did not find a current representation for the target resource or is not willing to disclose that one exists.

Resource not found, specifically occurs when a route is poorly specified, make sure that the resource ID are needing is correct.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 404,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 500

The server encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request.

If an error occurred on the server, the required operation could not be performed, sorry.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 500,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

Secured by jwt

Headers

  • Authorization: required (string)

    Used to send a valid JWT access token. In the Authorization header using the Bearer schema.

    Example:

    Bearer eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJzdWIiOiIxMjM0NTY3ODkwIiwibmFtZSI6IkpvaG4gRG9lIiwiYWRtaW4iOnRydWV9.TJVA95OrM7E2cBab30RMHrHDcEfxjoYZgeFONFh7HgQ

    Operation ID is required.

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

HTTP status code 500

The server encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request.

If an error occurred on the server, the required operation could not be performed, sorry.

Media type: application/json

    Used to send a valid JWT access token. In the Authorization header using the Bearer schema.

    Example:

    Bearer eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJzdWIiOiIxMjM0NTY3ODkwIiwibmFtZSI6IkpvaG4gRG9lIiwiYWRtaW4iOnRydWV9.TJVA95OrM7E2cBab30RMHrHDcEfxjoYZgeFONFh7HgQ

/operations/{id}/mobiles get post

This resource contains all the necessary operations for the management of the mobiles, among these operations we will have HTTP methods to get all the elements, to get a single element, to add new elements to the resource, to edit the existing elements and finally to eliminate.

get

Get a list of all mobiles.

post

Add a new mobile.

get /operations/{id}/mobiles

Get a list of all mobiles.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • id: required (number)

    Operation ID is required.

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

Query Parameters

  • operation: required (number)

    Provide if you need get list filtered by operation.

    Example:

    1
  • available: (boolean)

    true, if you need get list filtered by available.

    Example:

    false
  • start: (number - default: 0 - minimum: 0)

    Specify the index of first element to get

    Example:

    10
  • size: (number - minimum: 10 - maximum: 200)

    Specify the amount of items that will be retrieved per request

    Example:

    150
  • orderBy: (string)

    Specify the property of the object be sorted.

  • orderType: (one of ASC, DESC - default: ASC)

    Specify whether to sort ascending or descending

HTTP status code 200

Successfull request.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: array of Mobile

Items: Mobile

  • index: required (integer)
  • messenger: (object)
    • id: required (number)
    • identification: required (string)
    • name: required (string)
    • lastName: required (string)
    • gender: (one of MALE, FEMALE)
    • birthday: (date-only)
    • photo: required (string)
    • category: (number)
  • createdDate: required (datetime)
  • updatedDate: (datetime)

Example:

[
  {
    "index": 1,
    "createdDate": "2017-05-05T08:00:00.000Z"
  },
  {
    "index": 2,
    "messenger": {
      "id": 1,
      "identification": "12346798",
      "name": "Jhon",
      "lastName": "Doe",
      "gender": "MALE",
      "birthday": "1993-02-11",
      "photo": "http://static.arpia.com/imgs/img_001.jpg",
      "category": 5
    },
    "createdDate": "2017-05-05T08:00:00.000Z",
    "updatedDate": "2017-05-06T12:30:00.000Z"
  },
  {
    "index": 3,
    "createdDate": "2017-05-05T08:00:00.000Z"
  }
]

HTTP status code 404

The origin server did not find a current representation for the target resource or is not willing to disclose that one exists.

Resource not found, specifically occurs when a route is poorly specified, make sure that the resource ID are needing is correct.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 404,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

post /operations/{id}/mobiles

Add a new mobile.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • id: required (number)

    Operation ID is required.

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • quantity: required (integer)
  • operationId: required (number)

Example:

{
  "quantity": 50,
  "operationId": 1
}

HTTP status code 201

It has created a new mobile.

Headers

  • Location: required (string)

    Location where you can get the information of the created mobile.

    Example:

    http://api.arpia.com/v1/mobiles/1

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • index: required (integer)
  • messenger: (object)
    • id: required (number)
    • identification: required (string)
    • name: required (string)
    • lastName: required (string)
    • gender: (one of MALE, FEMALE)
    • birthday: (date-only)
    • photo: required (string)
    • category: (number)
  • createdDate: required (datetime)
  • updatedDate: (datetime)

A specific mobile number, a item of the mobiles list.

put

Update information about the specific mobile number.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

  • id: required (number)

    Operation ID is required.

  • index: required (integer)

    Mobile Index is required.

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • messenger: required (number)

Example:

{
  "messenger": 1
}

HTTP status code 200

It has updated a mobile number.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • index: required (integer)
  • messenger: (object)
    • id: required (number)
    • identification: required (string)
    • name: required (string)
    • lastName: required (string)
    • gender: (one of MALE, FEMALE)
    • birthday: (date-only)
    • photo: required (string)
    • category: (number)
  • createdDate: required (datetime)
  • updatedDate: (datetime)

Example:

{
  "index": 2,
  "messenger": {
    "id": 1,
    "identification": "12346798",
    "name": "Jhon",
    "lastName": "Doe",
    "gender": "MALE",
    "birthday": "1993-02-11",
    "photo": "http://static.arpia.com/imgs/img_001.jpg",
    "category": 5
  },
  "createdDate": "2017-05-05T08:00:00.000Z",
  "updatedDate": "2017-05-06T12:30:00.000Z"
}

Penalties

This resource contains all the necessary operations for the management of the penalties, among these operations we will have HTTP methods to get all the elements, to get a single element, to add new elements to the resource, to edit the existing elements and finally to eliminate.

/penalties get post

get

Get a list of all penalties.

post

Add a new penalty.

get /penalties

Get a list of all penalties.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

Query Parameters

  • messenger: required (number)

    Specify the id of the messenger.

    Example:

    10
  • search: (string)

    The value to search.

  • start: (number - default: 0 - minimum: 0)

    Specify the index of first element to get

    Example:

    10
  • size: (number - minimum: 10 - maximum: 200)

    Specify the amount of items that will be retrieved per request

    Example:

    150
  • orderBy: (string)

    Specify the property of the object be sorted.

  • orderType: (one of ASC, DESC - default: ASC)

    Specify whether to sort ascending or descending

HTTP status code 200

Successfull request.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • items: required (array of PenaltieResponse)

    Items: PenaltieResponse

    • id: required (number)
    • messenger: required (object)
      • id: (number)
      • identification: required (string - maxLength: 15)
      • name: required (string - maxLength: 60)
      • lastName: required (string - maxLength: 50)
      • addresses: required (array of Address)

        Items: Address

        • id: required (number)
        • neighborhood: required (object)
          • id: required (number)
          • name: required (string)
        • tag: required (string)
        • residentialAddress: required (string)
      • emails: required (array of Email)

        Items: Email

        • confirmed: required (boolean)
        • address: required (string)
      • phones: required (array of Phone)

        Items: Phone

        • confirmed: required (boolean)
        • tag: required (string)
        • number: required (string)
        • phoneType: required (one of CELL_PHONE, LANDLINE)
      • gender: (one of MALE, FEMALE)
      • birthday: (datetime)
    • created: required (datetime)
    • updated: required (datetime)
    • description: required (string)
  • total: required (number)

Example:

{
  "items": [
    {
      "id": 1,
      "messenger": {
        "id": 1,
        "addresses": [
          {
            "id": 1,
            "neighborhood": {
              "id": 123,
              "name": "Jhon Neighborhood"
            },
            "tag": "This is the tag",
            "residentialAddress": "This is the address"
          },
          {
            "id": 2,
            "neighborhood": {
              "id": 456,
              "name": "Jhon Neighborhood"
            },
            "tag": "This is the tag",
            "residentialAddress": "This is the address"
          }
        ],
        "emails": [
          {
            "confirmed": true,
            "address": "jhondoe@arpia.com"
          },
          {
            "confirmed": false,
            "address": "jhondoe2@arpia.com"
          }
        ],
        "phones": [
          {
            "confirmed": true,
            "tag": "This is the tag",
            "number": "3018888666",
            "phoneType": "CELL_PHONE"
          },
          {
            "confirmed": false,
            "tag": "This is the tag",
            "number": "6661232",
            "phoneType": "LANDLINE"
          }
        ],
        "curriculumVitaeId": 1,
        "userId": 1,
        "mobile": 3018888666,
        "identification": "12H2",
        "name": "Jhon",
        "lastName": "Doe",
        "gender": "MALE",
        "birthday": "1994-04-01T08:00:00.000Z",
        "dismissal": true,
        "observations": "This are the observations",
        "photo": "http://static.arpia.com/imgs/img_001.jpg",
        "category": 1
      },
      "created": "2017-04-01T08:00:00.000Z",
      "updated": "2017-05-01T08:00:00.000Z",
      "description": "This is the description."
    }
  ],
  "total": 1
}

HTTP status code 404

The origin server did not find a current representation for the target resource or is not willing to disclose that one exists.

Resource not found, specifically occurs when a route is poorly specified, make sure that the resource ID are needing is correct.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 404,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 500

The server encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request.

If an error occurred on the server, the required operation could not be performed, sorry.

Media type: application/json

  • documentation: required (string)

  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
