Secured by jwt

Headers

  • Authorization: required (string)

    Used to send a valid JWT access token. In the Authorization header using the Bearer schema.

    Example:

    Bearer eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJzdWIiOiIxMjM0NTY3ODkwIiwibmFtZSI6IkpvaG4gRG9lIiwiYWRtaW4iOnRydWV9.TJVA95OrM7E2cBab30RMHrHDcEfxjoYZgeFONFh7HgQ

post /penalties

Add a new penalty.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • messengerId: required (number)
  • description: required (string)

Example:

{
  "messengerId": 1,
  "description": "This is the description."
}

HTTP status code 201

It has created a new penalty.

Headers

  • Location: required (string)

    Location where you can get the information of the created penalty.

    Example:

    http://api.arpia.com/v1/penalties/1

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • id: required (number)
  • messenger: required (object)
    • id: (number)
    • identification: required (string - maxLength: 15)
    • name: required (string - maxLength: 60)
    • lastName: required (string - maxLength: 50)
    • addresses: required (array of Address)

      Items: Address

      • id: required (number)
      • neighborhood: required (object)
        • id: required (number)
        • name: required (string)
      • tag: required (string)
      • residentialAddress: required (string)
    • emails: required (array of Email)

      Items: Email

      • confirmed: required (boolean)
      • address: required (string)
    • phones: required (array of Phone)

      Items: Phone

      • confirmed: required (boolean)
      • tag: required (string)
      • number: required (string)
      • phoneType: required (one of CELL_PHONE, LANDLINE)
    • gender: (one of MALE, FEMALE)
    • birthday: (datetime)
  • created: required (datetime)
  • updated: required (datetime)
  • description: required (string)

Example:

{
  "id": 1,
  "messenger": {
    "id": 1,
    "addresses": [
      {
        "id": 1,
        "neighborhood": {
          "id": 123,
          "name": "Jhon Neighborhood"
        },
        "tag": "This is the tag",
        "residentialAddress": "This is the address"
      },
      {
        "id": 2,
        "neighborhood": {
          "id": 456,
          "name": "Jhon Neighborhood"
        },
        "tag": "This is the tag",
        "residentialAddress": "This is the address"
      }
    ],
    "emails": [
      {
        "confirmed": true,
        "address": "jhondoe@arpia.com"
      },
      {
        "confirmed": false,
        "address": "jhondoe2@arpia.com"
      }
    ],
    "phones": [
      {
        "confirmed": true,
        "tag": "This is the tag",
        "number": "3018888666",
        "phoneType": "CELL_PHONE"
      },
      {
        "confirmed": false,
        "tag": "This is the tag",
        "number": "6661232",
        "phoneType": "LANDLINE"
      }
    ],
    "curriculumVitaeId": 1,
    "userId": 1,
    "mobile": 3018888666,
    "identification": "12H2",
    "name": "Jhon",
    "lastName": "Doe",
    "gender": "MALE",
    "birthday": "1994-04-01T08:00:00.000Z",
    "dismissal": true,
    "observations": "This are the observations",
    "photo": "http://static.arpia.com/imgs/img_001.jpg",
    "category": 1
  },
  "created": "2017-04-01T08:00:00.000Z",
  "updated": "2017-05-01T08:00:00.000Z",
  "description": "This is the description."
}

HTTP status code 400

The server cannot or will not process the request due to something that is perceived to be a client error (e.g., malformed request syntax, invalid request message framing, or deceptive request routing).

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 400,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 404

The origin server did not find a current representation for the target resource or is not willing to disclose that one exists.

Resource not found, specifically occurs when a route is poorly specified, make sure that the resource ID are needing is correct.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 404,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 500

The server encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request.

If an error occurred on the server, the required operation could not be performed, sorry.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 500,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

Secured by jwt

Headers

  • Authorization: required (string)

    Used to send a valid JWT access token. In the Authorization header using the Bearer schema.

    Example:

    Bearer eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJzdWIiOiIxMjM0NTY3ODkwIiwibmFtZSI6IkpvaG4gRG9lIiwiYWRtaW4iOnRydWV9.TJVA95OrM7E2cBab30RMHrHDcEfxjoYZgeFONFh7HgQ

/penalties/{id} get put delete

A specific penalty, a item of the penalties list.

get

Get information about a penalty.

put

Update information about the specific penalty.

delete

Remove a specific penalty.

get /penalties/{id}

Get information about a penalty.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • id: required (number)

    Penalty ID is required.

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

HTTP status code 200

Successfull request.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • id: required (number)
  • messenger: required (object)
    • id: (number)
    • identification: required (string - maxLength: 15)
    • name: required (string - maxLength: 60)
    • lastName: required (string - maxLength: 50)
    • addresses: required (array of Address)

      Items: Address

      • id: required (number)
      • neighborhood: required (object)
        • id: required (number)
        • name: required (string)
      • tag: required (string)
      • residentialAddress: required (string)
    • emails: required (array of Email)

      Items: Email

      • confirmed: required (boolean)
      • address: required (string)
    • phones: required (array of Phone)

      Items: Phone

      • confirmed: required (boolean)
      • tag: required (string)
      • number: required (string)
      • phoneType: required (one of CELL_PHONE, LANDLINE)
    • gender: (one of MALE, FEMALE)
    • birthday: (datetime)
  • created: required (datetime)
  • updated: required (datetime)
  • description: required (string)

Example:

{
  "id": 1,
  "messenger": {
    "id": 1,
    "addresses": [
      {
        "id": 1,
        "neighborhood": {
          "id": 123,
          "name": "Jhon Neighborhood"
        },
        "tag": "This is the tag",
        "residentialAddress": "This is the address"
      },
      {
        "id": 2,
        "neighborhood": {
          "id": 456,
          "name": "Jhon Neighborhood"
        },
        "tag": "This is the tag",
        "residentialAddress": "This is the address"
      }
    ],
    "emails": [
      {
        "confirmed": true,
        "address": "jhondoe@arpia.com"
      },
      {
        "confirmed": false,
        "address": "jhondoe2@arpia.com"
      }
    ],
    "phones": [
      {
        "confirmed": true,
        "tag": "This is the tag",
        "number": "3018888666",
        "phoneType": "CELL_PHONE"
      },
      {
        "confirmed": false,
        "tag": "This is the tag",
        "number": "6661232",
        "phoneType": "LANDLINE"
      }
    ],
    "curriculumVitaeId": 1,
    "userId": 1,
    "mobile": 3018888666,
    "identification": "12H2",
    "name": "Jhon",
    "lastName": "Doe",
    "gender": "MALE",
    "birthday": "1994-04-01T08:00:00.000Z",
    "dismissal": true,
    "observations": "This are the observations",
    "photo": "http://static.arpia.com/imgs/img_001.jpg",
    "category": 1
  },
  "created": "2017-04-01T08:00:00.000Z",
  "updated": "2017-05-01T08:00:00.000Z",
  "description": "This is the description."
}

put /penalties/{id}

Update information about the specific penalty.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • id: required (number)

    Penalty ID is required.

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • messengerId: required (number)
  • description: required (string)

Example:

{
  "messengerId": 1,
  "description": "This is the description."
}

HTTP status code 200

It has updated a penalty.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • id: required (number)
  • messenger: required (object)
    • id: (number)
    • identification: required (string - maxLength: 15)
    • name: required (string - maxLength: 60)
    • lastName: required (string - maxLength: 50)
    • addresses: required (array of Address)

      Items: Address

      • id: required (number)
      • neighborhood: required (object)
        • id: required (number)
        • name: required (string)
      • tag: required (string)
      • residentialAddress: required (string)
    • emails: required (array of Email)

      Items: Email

      • confirmed: required (boolean)
      • address: required (string)
    • phones: required (array of Phone)

      Items: Phone

      • confirmed: required (boolean)
      • tag: required (string)
      • number: required (string)
      • phoneType: required (one of CELL_PHONE, LANDLINE)
    • gender: (one of MALE, FEMALE)
    • birthday: (datetime)
  • created: required (datetime)
  • updated: required (datetime)
  • description: required (string)

Example:

{
  "id": 1,
  "messenger": {
    "id": 1,
    "addresses": [
      {
        "id": 1,
        "neighborhood": {
          "id": 123,
          "name": "Jhon Neighborhood"
        },
        "tag": "This is the tag",
        "residentialAddress": "This is the address"
      },
      {
        "id": 2,
        "neighborhood": {
          "id": 456,
          "name": "Jhon Neighborhood"
        },
        "tag": "This is the tag",
        "residentialAddress": "This is the address"
      }
    ],
    "emails": [
      {
        "confirmed": true,
        "address": "jhondoe@arpia.com"
      },
      {
        "confirmed": false,
        "address": "jhondoe2@arpia.com"
      }
    ],
    "phones": [
      {
        "confirmed": true,
        "tag": "This is the tag",
        "number": "3018888666",
        "phoneType": "CELL_PHONE"
      },
      {
        "confirmed": false,
        "tag": "This is the tag",
        "number": "6661232",
        "phoneType": "LANDLINE"
      }
    ],
    "curriculumVitaeId": 1,
    "userId": 1,
    "mobile": 3018888666,
    "identification": "12H2",
    "name": "Jhon",
    "lastName": "Doe",
    "gender": "MALE",
    "birthday": "1994-04-01T08:00:00.000Z",
    "dismissal": true,
    "observations": "This are the observations",
    "photo": "http://static.arpia.com/imgs/img_001.jpg",
    "category": 1
  },
  "created": "2017-04-01T08:00:00.000Z",
  "updated": "2017-05-01T08:00:00.000Z",
  "description": "This is the description."
}

      "message": "This is a second error message."

The origin server did not find a current representation for the target resource or is not willing to disclose that one exists.

delete /penalties/{id}

Remove a specific penalty.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • id: required (number)

    Penalty ID is required.

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

HTTP status code 200

Successfull request.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • id: required (number)
  • messenger: required (object)
    • id: (number)
    • identification: required (string - maxLength: 15)
    • name: required (string - maxLength: 60)
    • lastName: required (string - maxLength: 50)
    • addresses: required (array of Address)

      Items: Address

      • id: required (number)
      • neighborhood: required (object)
        • id: required (number)
        • name: required (string)
      • tag: required (string)
      • residentialAddress: required (string)
    • emails: required (array of Email)

      Items: Email

      • confirmed: required (boolean)
      • address: required (string)
    • phones: required (array of Phone)

      Items: Phone

      • confirmed: required (boolean)
      • tag: required (string)
      • number: required (string)
      • phoneType: required (one of CELL_PHONE, LANDLINE)
    • gender: (one of MALE, FEMALE)
    • birthday: (datetime)
  • created: required (datetime)
  • updated: required (datetime)
  • description: required (string)

Example:

{
  "id": 1,
  "messenger": {
    "id": 1,
    "addresses": [
      {
        "id": 1,
        "neighborhood": {
          "id": 123,
          "name": "Jhon Neighborhood"
        },
        "tag": "This is the tag",
        "residentialAddress": "This is the address"
      },
      {
        "id": 2,
        "neighborhood": {
          "id": 456,
          "name": "Jhon Neighborhood"
        },
        "tag": "This is the tag",
        "residentialAddress": "This is the address"
      }
    ],
    "emails": [
      {
        "confirmed": true,
        "address": "jhondoe@arpia.com"
      },
      {
        "confirmed": false,
        "address": "jhondoe2@arpia.com"
      }
    ],
    "phones": [
      {
        "confirmed": true,
        "tag": "This is the tag",
        "number": "3018888666",
        "phoneType": "CELL_PHONE"
      },
      {
        "confirmed": false,
        "tag": "This is the tag",
        "number": "6661232",
        "phoneType": "LANDLINE"
      }
    ],
    "curriculumVitaeId": 1,
    "userId": 1,
    "mobile": 3018888666,
    "identification": "12H2",
    "name": "Jhon",
    "lastName": "Doe",
    "gender": "MALE",
    "birthday": "1994-04-01T08:00:00.000Z",
    "dismissal": true,
    "observations": "This are the observations",
    "photo": "http://static.arpia.com/imgs/img_001.jpg",
    "category": 1
  },
  "created": "2017-04-01T08:00:00.000Z",
  "updated": "2017-05-01T08:00:00.000Z",
  "description": "This is the description."
}

HTTP status code 400

The server cannot or will not process the request due to something that is perceived to be a client error (e.g., malformed request syntax, invalid request message framing, or deceptive request routing).

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

  • documentation: required (string)

  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },

      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]

HTTP status code 500

The server encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request.

If an error occurred on the server, the required operation could not be performed, sorry.

Body

Media type: application/json

  • Authorization: required (string)

    Used to send a valid JWT access token. In the Authorization header using the Bearer schema.

    Example:

    Bearer eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJzdWIiOiIxMjM0NTY3ODkwIiwibmFtZSI6IkpvaG4gRG9lIiwiYWRtaW4iOnRydWV9.TJVA95OrM7E2cBab30RMHrHDcEfxjoYZgeFONFh7HgQ

People

This resource contains all the necessary operations for the management of the people, among these operations we will have HTTP methods to get all the elements, to get a single element, to add new elements to the resource, to edit the existing elements and finally to eliminate.

/people get

get

Get a list of all the people.

get /people

Get a list of all the people.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Query Parameters

  • start: (number - default: 0 - minimum: 0)

    Specify the index of first element to get

    Example:

    10
  • size: (number - minimum: 10 - maximum: 200)

    Specify the amount of items that will be retrieved per request

    Example:

    150
  • search: (string)

    The value to search.

HTTP status code 200

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • items: required (array of Person)

    Items: Person

    • id: (number)
    • identification: required (string - maxLength: 15)
    • name: required (string - maxLength: 60)
    • lastName: required (string - maxLength: 50)
    • addresses: required (array of Address)

      Items: Address

      • id: required (number)
      • neighborhood: required (object)
        • id: required (number)
        • name: required (string)
      • tag: required (string)
      • residentialAddress: required (string)
    • emails: required (array of Email)

      Items: Email

      • confirmed: required (boolean)
      • address: required (string)
    • phones: required (array of Phone)

      Items: Phone

      • confirmed: required (boolean)
      • tag: required (string)
      • number: required (string)
      • phoneType: required (one of CELL_PHONE, LANDLINE)
    • gender: (one of MALE, FEMALE)
    • birthday: (datetime)
  • total: required (number)

Example:

{
  "items": [
    {
      "id": 1,
      "addresses": [
        {
          "id": 1,
          "neighborhood": {
            "id": 123,
            "name": "Jhon Neighborhood"
          },
          "tag": "This is the tag",
          "residentialAddress": "This is the address"
        },
        {
          "id": 2,
          "neighborhood": {
            "id": 456,
            "name": "Jhon Neighborhood"
          },
          "tag": "This is the tag",
          "residentialAddress": "This is the address"
        }
      ],
      "emails": [
        {
          "confirmed": true,
          "address": "jhondoe@arpia.com"
        },
        {
          "confirmed": false,
          "address": "jhondoe2@arpia.com"
        }
      ],
      "phones": [
        {
          "confirmed": true,
          "tag": "This is the tag",
          "number": "3018888666",
          "phoneType": "CELL_PHONE"
        },
        {
          "confirmed": false,
          "tag": "This is the tag",
          "number": "6661232",
          "phoneType": "LANDLINE"
        }
      ],
      "identification": "AH12",
      "name": "Jhon",
      "lastName": "Doe",
      "gender": "MALE",
      "birthday": "1994-04-01T08:00:00.000Z"
    }
  ],
  "total": 1
}

HTTP status code 400

The server cannot or will not process the request due to something that is perceived to be a client error (e.g., malformed request syntax, invalid request message framing, or deceptive request routing).

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 400,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 404

The origin server did not find a current representation for the target resource or is not willing to disclose that one exists.

Resource not found, specifically occurs when a route is poorly specified, make sure that the resource ID are needing is correct.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 404,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 500

The server encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request.

If an error occurred on the server, the required operation could not be performed, sorry.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 500,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

Secured by jwt

Headers

  • Authorization: required (string)

    Used to send a valid JWT access token. In the Authorization header using the Bearer schema.

    Example:

    Bearer eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJzdWIiOiIxMjM0NTY3ODkwIiwibmFtZSI6IkpvaG4gRG9lIiwiYWRtaW4iOnRydWV9.TJVA95OrM7E2cBab30RMHrHDcEfxjoYZgeFONFh7HgQ

/people/{id} get

A specific person, a item of the people list.

get

Get information about a person.

get /people/{id}

Get information about a person.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • id: required (number)

    Person ID is required.

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

HTTP status code 200

Successfull request.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • id: (number)
  • identification: required (string - maxLength: 15)
  • name: required (string - maxLength: 60)
  • lastName: required (string - maxLength: 50)
  • addresses: required (array of Address)

    Items: Address

    • id: required (number)
    • neighborhood: required (object)
      • id: required (number)
      • name: required (string)
    • tag: required (string)
    • residentialAddress: required (string)
  • emails: required (array of Email)

    Items: Email

    • confirmed: required (boolean)
    • address: required (string)
  • phones: required (array of Phone)

    Items: Phone

    • confirmed: required (boolean)
    • tag: required (string)
    • number: required (string)
    • phoneType: required (one of CELL_PHONE, LANDLINE)
  • gender: (one of MALE, FEMALE)
  • birthday: (datetime)

Example:

{
  "id": 1,
  "addresses": [
    {
      "id": 1,
      "neighborhood": {
        "id": 123,
        "name": "Jhon Neighborhood"
      },
      "tag": "This is the tag",
      "residentialAddress": "This is the address"
    },
    {
      "id": 2,
      "neighborhood": {
        "id": 456,
        "name": "Jhon Neighborhood"
      },
      "tag": "This is the tag",
      "residentialAddress": "This is the address"
    }
  ],
  "emails": [
    {
      "confirmed": true,
      "address": "jhondoe@arpia.com"
    },
    {
      "confirmed": false,
      "address": "jhondoe2@arpia.com"
    }
  ],
  "phones": [
    {
      "confirmed": true,
      "tag": "This is the tag",
      "number": "3018888666",
      "phoneType": "CELL_PHONE"
    },
    {
      "confirmed": false,
      "tag": "This is the tag",
      "number": "6661232",
      "phoneType": "LANDLINE"
    }
  ],
  "identification": "AH12",
  "name": "Jhon",
  "lastName": "Doe",
  "gender": "MALE",
  "birthday": "1994-04-01T08:00:00.000Z"
}

HTTP status code 400

The server cannot or will not process the request due to something that is perceived to be a client error (e.g., malformed request syntax, invalid request message framing, or deceptive request routing).

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 400,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 404

The origin server did not find a current representation for the target resource or is not willing to disclose that one exists.

Resource not found, specifically occurs when a route is poorly specified, make sure that the resource ID are needing is correct.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 404,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 500

The server encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request.

If an error occurred on the server, the required operation could not be performed, sorry.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 500,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

Secured by jwt

Headers

  • Authorization: required (string)

    Used to send a valid JWT access token. In the Authorization header using the Bearer schema.

    Example:

    Bearer eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJzdWIiOiIxMjM0NTY3ODkwIiwibmFtZSI6IkpvaG4gRG9lIiwiYWRtaW4iOnRydWV9.TJVA95OrM7E2cBab30RMHrHDcEfxjoYZgeFONFh7HgQ

Points

This resource contains all the necessary operations for the management of the points, among these operations we will have HTTP methods to get all the elements, to get a single element, to add new elements to the resource, to edit the existing elements and finally to eliminate.

/points get post

get

Get a list of all points.

post

Add a new point.

get /points

Get a list of all points.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

Query Parameters

  • search: (string)

    The value to search.

  • start: (number - default: 0 - minimum: 0)

    Specify the index of first element to get

    Example:

    10
  • size: (number - minimum: 10 - maximum: 200)

    Specify the amount of items that will be retrieved per request

    Example:

    150
  • orderBy: (string)

    Specify the property of the object be sorted.

  • orderType: (one of ASC, DESC - default: ASC)

    Specify whether to sort ascending or descending

HTTP status code 200

Successfull request.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • items: required (array of Point)

    Items: Point

    • id: (number)
    • name: required (string)
    • coordinates: required (object)
      • latitude: required (number)
      • longitude: required (number)
    • coverage: (integer)
    • type: required (one of CRITICAL, FIXED)
    • schedules: required (array of Schedule)

      Items: Schedule

      • weekday: required (one of MONDAY, TUESDAY, WEDNESDAY, THURSDAY, FRIDAY, SATURDAY, SUNDAY)
      • opening: required (time-only)
      • closing: required (time-only)
      • breakOpening: (time-only)
      • breakClosing: (time-only)
    • pricings: required (array of Pricing)

      Items: Pricing

      • index: (integer)
      • distance: required (integer)
      • price: required (number)
  • total: required (number)

Example:

{
  "items": [
    {
      "id": 1,
      "name": "Map Point 1",
      "coordinates": {
        "latitude": 10.41395,
        "longitude": -75.53022
      },
      "coverage": 100,
      "type": "FIXED",
      "schedules": [
        {
          "weekday": "MONDAY",
          "opening": "07:00:00",
          "closing": "21:00:00"
        },
        {
          "weekday": "TUESDAY",
          "opening": "07:00:00",
          "closing": "21:00:00"
        }
      ],
      "pricings": [
        {
          "distance": 100,
          "price": 2500
        },
        {
          "distance": 400,
          "price": 5000
        }
      ]
    },
    {
      "id": 2,
      "name": "Map Point 2",
      "coordinates": {
        "latitude": 10.41395,
        "longitude": -75.53022
      },
      "type": "FIXED",
      "schedules": [
        {
          "weekday": "MONDAY",
          "opening": "07:00:00",
          "closing": "21:00:00"
        },
        {
          "weekday": "TUESDAY",
          "opening": "07:00:00",
          "closing": "21:00:00"
        }
      ],
      "pricings": [
        {
          "distance": 100,
          "price": 2500
        },
        {
          "distance": 400,
          "price": 5000
        }
      ]
    }
  ],
  "total": 25
}

HTTP status code 404

The origin server did not find a current representation for the target resource or is not willing to disclose that one exists.

Resource not found, specifically occurs when a route is poorly specified, make sure that the resource ID are needing is correct.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 404,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 500

The server encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request.

If an error occurred on the server, the required operation could not be performed, sorry.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 500,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

Secured by jwt

  • Authorization: required (string)

    Used to send a valid JWT access token. In the Authorization header using the Bearer schema.

    Example:

    Bearer eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJzdWIiOiIxMjM0NTY3ODkwIiwibmFtZSI6IkpvaG4gRG9lIiwiYWRtaW4iOnRydWV9.TJVA95OrM7E2cBab30RMHrHDcEfxjoYZgeFONFh7HgQ

post /points

Add a new point.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • id: (number)
  • name: required (string)
  • coordinates: required (object)
    • latitude: required (number)
    • longitude: required (number)
  • coverage: (integer)
  • type: required (one of CRITICAL, FIXED)
  • schedules: required (array of Schedule)

    Items: Schedule

    • weekday: required (one of MONDAY, TUESDAY, WEDNESDAY, THURSDAY, FRIDAY, SATURDAY, SUNDAY)
    • opening: required (time-only)
    • closing: required (time-only)
    • breakOpening: (time-only)
    • breakClosing: (time-only)
  • pricings: required (array of Pricing)

    Items: Pricing

    • index: (integer)
    • distance: required (integer)
    • price: required (number)

Example:

{
  "name": "Map Point 2",
  "coordinates": {
    "latitude": 10.41395,
    "longitude": -75.53022
  },
  "type": "FIXED",
  "schedules": [
    {
      "weekday": "MONDAY",
      "opening": "07:00:00",
      "closing": "21:00:00"
    },
    {
      "weekday": "TUESDAY",
      "opening": "07:00:00",
      "closing": "21:00:00"
    }
  ],
  "pricings": [
    {
      "distance": 100,
      "price": 2500
    },
    {
      "distance": 400,
      "price": 5000
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 201

It has created a new point.

Headers

  • Location: required (string)

    Location where you can get the information of the created point.

    Example:

    http://api.arpia.com/v1/points/1

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • id: (number)
  • name: required (string)
  • coordinates: required (object)
    • latitude: required (number)
    • longitude: required (number)
  • coverage: (integer)
  • type: required (one of CRITICAL, FIXED)
  • schedules: required (array of Schedule)

    Items: Schedule

    • weekday: required (one of MONDAY, TUESDAY, WEDNESDAY, THURSDAY, FRIDAY, SATURDAY, SUNDAY)
    • opening: required (time-only)
    • closing: required (time-only)
    • breakOpening: (time-only)
    • breakClosing: (time-only)
  • pricings: required (array of Pricing)

    Items: Pricing

    • index: (integer)
    • distance: required (integer)
    • price: required (number)

  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]

/points/{id} get put delete

A specific point, a item of the points list.

get

Get information about a point.

put

Update information about the specific point.

delete

Remove a specific point.

get /points/{id}

Get information about a point.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • id: required (number)

    Point ID is required.

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

HTTP status code 200

Successfull request.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • id: (number)
  • name: required (string)
  • coordinates: required (object)
    • latitude: required (number)
    • longitude: required (number)
  • coverage: (integer)
  • type: required (one of CRITICAL, FIXED)
  • schedules: required (array of Schedule)

    Items: Schedule

    • weekday: required (one of MONDAY, TUESDAY, WEDNESDAY, THURSDAY, FRIDAY, SATURDAY, SUNDAY)
    • opening: required (time-only)
    • closing: required (time-only)
    • breakOpening: (time-only)
    • breakClosing: (time-only)
  • pricings: required (array of Pricing)

    Items: Pricing

    • index: (integer)
    • distance: required (integer)
    • price: required (number)

Example:

{
  "id": 2,
  "name": "Map Point 2",
  "coordinates": {
    "latitude": 10.41395,
    "longitude": -75.53022
  },
  "type": "FIXED",
  "schedules": [
    {
      "weekday": "MONDAY",
      "opening": "07:00:00",
      "closing": "21:00:00"
    },
    {
      "weekday": "TUESDAY",
      "opening": "07:00:00",
      "closing": "21:00:00"
    }
  ],
  "pricings": [
    {
      "distance": 100,
      "price": 2500
    },
    {
      "distance": 400,
      "price": 5000
    }
  ]
}

put /points/{id}

Update information about the specific point.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • id: required (number)

    Point ID is required.

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • id: (number)
  • name: required (string)
  • coordinates: required (object)
    • latitude: required (number)
    • longitude: required (number)
  • coverage: (integer)
  • type: required (one of CRITICAL, FIXED)
  • schedules: required (array of Schedule)

    Items: Schedule

    • weekday: required (one of MONDAY, TUESDAY, WEDNESDAY, THURSDAY, FRIDAY, SATURDAY, SUNDAY)
    • opening: required (time-only)
    • closing: required (time-only)
    • breakOpening: (time-only)
    • breakClosing: (time-only)
  • pricings: required (array of Pricing)

    Items: Pricing

    • index: (integer)
    • distance: required (integer)
    • price: required (number)

HTTP status code 200

It has updated a point.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • id: (number)
  • name: required (string)
  • coordinates: required (object)
    • latitude: required (number)
    • longitude: required (number)
  • coverage: (integer)
  • type: required (one of CRITICAL, FIXED)
  • schedules: required (array of Schedule)

    Items: Schedule

    • weekday: required (one of MONDAY, TUESDAY, WEDNESDAY, THURSDAY, FRIDAY, SATURDAY, SUNDAY)
    • opening: required (time-only)
    • closing: required (time-only)
    • breakOpening: (time-only)
    • breakClosing: (time-only)
  • pricings: required (array of Pricing)

    Items: Pricing

    • index: (integer)
    • distance: required (integer)
    • price: required (number)

HTTP status code 400

The server cannot or will not process the request due to something that is perceived to be a client error (e.g., malformed request syntax, invalid request message framing, or deceptive request routing).

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 400,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 404

The origin server did not find a current representation for the target resource or is not willing to disclose that one exists.

Resource not found, specifically occurs when a route is poorly specified, make sure that the resource ID are needing is correct.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 404,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 500

The server encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request.

If an error occurred on the server, the required operation could not be performed, sorry.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 500,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

Secured by jwt

Headers

  • Authorization: required (string)

    Used to send a valid JWT access token. In the Authorization header using the Bearer schema.

    Example:

    Bearer eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJzdWIiOiIxMjM0NTY3ODkwIiwibmFtZSI6IkpvaG4gRG9lIiwiYWRtaW4iOnRydWV9.TJVA95OrM7E2cBab30RMHrHDcEfxjoYZgeFONFh7HgQ

delete /points/{id}

Remove a specific point.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • id: required (number)

    Point ID is required.

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

HTTP status code 200

Successfull request.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • id: (number)
  • name: required (string)
  • coordinates: required (object)
    • latitude: required (number)
    • longitude: required (number)
  • coverage: (integer)
  • type: required (one of CRITICAL, FIXED)
  • schedules: required (array of Schedule)

    Items: Schedule

    • weekday: required (one of MONDAY, TUESDAY, WEDNESDAY, THURSDAY, FRIDAY, SATURDAY, SUNDAY)
    • opening: required (time-only)
    • closing: required (time-only)
    • breakOpening: (time-only)
    • breakClosing: (time-only)
  • pricings: required (array of Pricing)

    Items: Pricing

    • index: (integer)
    • distance: required (integer)
    • price: required (number)

HTTP status code 400

The server cannot or will not process the request due to something that is perceived to be a client error (e.g., malformed request syntax, invalid request message framing, or deceptive request routing).

Body

Media type: application/json

  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

  "statusCode": 400,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 500

The server encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request.

If an error occurred on the server, the required operation could not be performed, sorry.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

      "message": "This is a first error message."

Secured by jwt

Headers

  • Authorization: required (string)

    Used to send a valid JWT access token. In the Authorization header using the Bearer schema.

    Example:

    Bearer eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJzdWIiOiIxMjM0NTY3ODkwIiwibmFtZSI6IkpvaG4gRG9lIiwiYWRtaW4iOnRydWV9.TJVA95OrM7E2cBab30RMHrHDcEfxjoYZgeFONFh7HgQ

QCR

This resource contains all the necessary operations for the management of the qcr, among these operations we will have HTTP methods to get all the elements.

/qcr get post

get

Get a list of all the QCR's.

post

Add a new QCR.

get /qcr

Get a list of all the QCR's.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Query Parameters

  • customer: (number)

    If you need to filter by customer, you can provide the customer ID.

    Example:

    1003
  • status: (one of PENDING, FINISHED, CANCELED)

    If you need to filter by the QCR status, you can provide the status in this parameter.

  • start: (number - default: 0 - minimum: 0)

    Specify the index of first element to get

    Example:

    10
  • size: (number - minimum: 10 - maximum: 200)

    Specify the amount of items that will be retrieved per request

    Example:

    150

HTTP status code 200

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • items: required (array of QCRData)

    Items: QCRData

    • openingDate: required (datetime)
    • index: required (integer)
    • customer: required (object)
      • id: required (number)
      • observations: (string)
      • displayName: required (string)
      • identification: required (string)
      • type: required (one of PARTICULAR, ESTABLISHMENT)
      • banned: required (boolean)
    • evaluation: (string)
    • status: required (one of PENDING, FINISHED, CANCELED)
    • inconvenient: required (string)
    • solution: (string)
    • closingDate: (datetime)
    • counterpartVersion: (string)
  • total: required (integer)

Example:

{
  "items": [
    {
      "index": 1,
      "customer": {
        "id": 211,
        "type": "PARTICULAR",
        "displayName": "Gustavo Pacheco",
        "identification": "123456",
        "banned": false,
        "observations": "This is a observation"
      },
      "inconvenient": "This is the inconvenient",
      "counterpartVersion": "This is the counterpart version",
      "evaluation": "This is the admin evaluation.",
      "solution": "This is the admin solution.",
      "status": "FINISHED",
      "openingDate": "2017-04-01T08:00:00.000Z",
      "closingDate": "2017-05-01T08:00:00.000Z"
    },
    {
      "index": 2,
      "customer": {
        "id": 1003,
        "type": "PARTICULAR",
        "displayName": "Luis Lenes",
        "identification": "654321",
        "banned": false,
        "observations": "This is a observation"
      },
      "inconvenient": "This is the inconvenient",
      "status": "CANCELED",
      "openingDate": "2017-04-01T08:00:00.000Z",
      "closingDate": "2017-05-01T08:00:00.000Z"
    }
  ],
  "total": 10
}

HTTP status code 400

The server cannot or will not process the request due to something that is perceived to be a client error (e.g., malformed request syntax, invalid request message framing, or deceptive request routing).

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

  "statusCode": 400,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

post /qcr

Add a new QCR.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • inconvenient: required (string)

Example:

{
  "inconvenient": "This is the inconvenient",
  "customer": 211
}

HTTP status code 201

It has created a new qcr.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • openingDate: required (datetime)
  • index: required (integer)
  • customer: required (object)
    • id: required (number)
    • observations: (string)
    • displayName: required (string)
    • identification: required (string)
    • type: required (one of PARTICULAR, ESTABLISHMENT)
    • banned: required (boolean)
  • evaluation: (string)
  • status: required (one of PENDING, FINISHED, CANCELED)
  • inconvenient: required (string)
  • solution: (string)
  • closingDate: (datetime)
  • counterpartVersion: (string)

Example:

{
  "index": 1,
  "customer": {
    "id": 211,
    "type": "PARTICULAR",
    "displayName": "Gustavo Pacheco",
    "identification": "123456",
    "banned": false,
    "observations": "This is a observation"
  },
  "inconvenient": "This is the inconvenient",
  "status": "PENDING",
  "openingDate": "2017-04-01T08:00:00.000Z"
}

HTTP status code 400

The server cannot or will not process the request due to something that is perceived to be a client error (e.g., malformed request syntax, invalid request message framing, or deceptive request routing).

/qcr/{id} get

A specific QCR, a item of the QCR's list.

get

Get information about a QCR.

get /qcr/{id}

Get information about a QCR.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • id: required (number)

    QCR ID is required.

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

Query Parameters

  • customer: required (number)

    Specify the customer ID.

HTTP status code 200

Successfull request.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • openingDate: required (datetime)
  • index: required (integer)
  • customer: required (object)
    • id: required (number)
    • observations: (string)
    • displayName: required (string)
    • identification: required (string)
    • type: required (one of PARTICULAR, ESTABLISHMENT)
    • banned: required (boolean)
  • evaluation: (string)
  • status: required (one of PENDING, FINISHED, CANCELED)
  • inconvenient: required (string)
  • solution: (string)
  • closingDate: (datetime)
  • counterpartVersion: (string)

Example:

{
  "index": 1,
  "customer": {
    "id": 211,
    "type": "PARTICULAR",
    "displayName": "Gustavo Pacheco",
    "identification": "123456",
    "banned": false,
    "observations": "This is a observation"
  },
  "inconvenient": "This is the inconvenient",
  "counterpartVersion": "This is the counterpart version",
  "evaluation": "This is the admin evaluation.",
  "solution": "This is the admin solution.",
  "status": "CANCELED",
  "openingDate": "2017-04-01T08:00:00.000Z",
  "closingDate": "2017-05-01T08:00:00.000Z"
}

/qcr/{id}/counterpart put

The second step in the qcr.

put

Update the QCR to a step 2.

put /qcr/{id}/counterpart

Update the QCR to a step 2.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • id: required (number)

    QCR ID is required.

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

Query Parameters

  • customer: required (number)

    Specify the customer ID.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • counterpartVersion: required (string)

Example:

{
  "counterpartVersion": "This is the counterpart version."
}

HTTP status code 200

Successfull request.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • openingDate: required (datetime)
  • index: required (integer)
  • customer: required (object)
    • id: required (number)
    • observations: (string)
    • displayName: required (string)
    • identification: required (string)
    • type: required (one of PARTICULAR, ESTABLISHMENT)
    • banned: required (boolean)
  • evaluation: (string)
  • status: required (one of PENDING, FINISHED, CANCELED)
  • inconvenient: required (string)
  • solution: (string)
  • closingDate: (datetime)
  • counterpartVersion: (string)

Example:

{
  "index": 1,
  "customer": {
    "id": 211,
    "type": "PARTICULAR",
    "displayName": "Gustavo Pacheco",
    "identification": "123456",
    "banned": false,
    "observations": "This is a observation"
  },
  "inconvenient": "This is the inconvenient",
  "counterpartVersion": "This is the counterpart version.",
  "status": "PENDING",
  "openingDate": "2017-04-01T08:00:00.000Z"
}

}

Secured by jwt

Headers

  • Authorization: required (string)

    Used to send a valid JWT access token. In the Authorization header using the Bearer schema.

    Example:

    Bearer eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJzdWIiOiIxMjM0NTY3ODkwIiwibmFtZSI6IkpvaG4gRG9lIiwiYWRtaW4iOnRydWV9.TJVA95OrM7E2cBab30RMHrHDcEfxjoYZgeFONFh7HgQ

/qcr/{id}/solution put

The third step in the qcr.

put

Update the QCR to a step 3.

put /qcr/{id}/solution

Update the QCR to a step 3.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • id: required (number)

    QCR ID is required.

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

Query Parameters

  • customer: required (number)

    Specify the customer ID.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • evaluation: (string)
  • solution: required (string)

Example:

{
  "evaluation": "This is the admin evaluation.",
  "solution": "This is the admin solution."
}

HTTP status code 200

Successfull request.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • openingDate: required (datetime)
  • index: required (integer)
  • customer: required (object)
    • id: required (number)
    • observations: (string)
    • displayName: required (string)
    • identification: required (string)
    • type: required (one of PARTICULAR, ESTABLISHMENT)
    • banned: required (boolean)
  • evaluation: (string)
  • status: required (one of PENDING, FINISHED, CANCELED)
  • inconvenient: required (string)
  • solution: (string)
  • closingDate: (datetime)
  • counterpartVersion: (string)

Example:

{
  "index": 1,
  "customer": {
    "id": 211,
    "type": "PARTICULAR",
    "displayName": "Gustavo Pacheco",
    "identification": "123456",
    "banned": false,
    "observations": "This is a observation"
  },
  "inconvenient": "This is the inconvenient",
  "counterpartVersion": "This is the counterpart version",
  "evaluation": "This is the admin evaluation.",
  "solution": "This is the admin solution.",
  "status": "FINISHED",
  "openingDate": "2017-04-01T08:00:00.000Z",
  "closingDate": "2017-05-01T08:00:00.000Z"
}

HTTP status code 400

The server cannot or will not process the request due to something that is perceived to be a client error (e.g., malformed request syntax, invalid request message framing, or deceptive request routing).

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 400,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 404

The origin server did not find a current representation for the target resource or is not willing to disclose that one exists.

Resource not found, specifically occurs when a route is poorly specified, make sure that the resource ID are needing is correct.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 404,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 500

The server encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request.

If an error occurred on the server, the required operation could not be performed, sorry.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 500,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

Secured by jwt

Headers

  • Authorization: required (string)

    Used to send a valid JWT access token. In the Authorization header using the Bearer schema.

    Example:

    Bearer eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJzdWIiOiIxMjM0NTY3ODkwIiwibmFtZSI6IkpvaG4gRG9lIiwiYWRtaW4iOnRydWV9.TJVA95OrM7E2cBab30RMHrHDcEfxjoYZgeFONFh7HgQ

/qcr/{id}/cancel put

The cancel in the qcr.

put

Update the QCR to a cancel.

put /qcr/{id}/cancel

Update the QCR to a cancel.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • id: required (number)

    QCR ID is required.

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

Query Parameters

  • customer: required (number)

    Specify the customer ID.

HTTP status code 200

Successfull request.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • openingDate: required (datetime)
  • index: required (integer)
  • customer: required (object)
    • id: required (number)
    • observations: (string)
    • displayName: required (string)
    • identification: required (string)
    • type: required (one of PARTICULAR, ESTABLISHMENT)
    • banned: required (boolean)
  • evaluation: (string)
  • status: required (one of PENDING, FINISHED, CANCELED)
  • inconvenient: required (string)
  • solution: (string)
  • closingDate: (datetime)
  • counterpartVersion: (string)

Example:

{
  "index": 1,
  "customer": {
    "id": 211,
    "type": "PARTICULAR",
    "displayName": "Gustavo Pacheco",
    "identification": "123456",
    "banned": false,
    "observations": "This is a observation"
  },
  "inconvenient": "This is the inconvenient",
  "status": "CANCELED",
  "openingDate": "2017-04-01T08:00:00.000Z",
  "closingDate": "2017-05-01T08:00:00.000Z"
}

HTTP status code 400

The server cannot or will not process the request due to something that is perceived to be a client error (e.g., malformed request syntax, invalid request message framing, or deceptive request routing).

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 400,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }

Resource not found, specifically occurs when a route is poorly specified, make sure that the resource ID are needing is correct.

Settings

This resource contains all the necessary operations for the management of the settings, among these operations we will have HTTP methods to get all the elements, to get a single element, to add new elements to the resource, to edit the existing elements and finally to eliminate.

/settings get put

get

Get an object of the settings.

put

Update information about the settings.

get /settings

Get an object of the settings.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Response
  • Security

HTTP status code 200

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • amount: required (number)
  • securityDeposit: required (number)
  • demoninations: required (array of Denomination)

    Items: Denomination

    • value: required (number)
    • cashType: required (one of PAPER, COIN)
  • questions: required (array of Question)

    Items: Question

    • index: required (number)
    • question: required (string)

Example:

{
  "amount": 10000,
  "securityDeposit": 30,
  "demoninations": [
    {
      "value": 100000,
      "cashType": "COIN"
    },
    {
      "value": 300000,
      "cashType": "PAPER"
    }
  ],
  "questions": [
    {
      "index": 1,
      "question": "This is the question 1."
    },
    {
      "index": 2,
      "question": "This is the question 2."
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 400

The server cannot or will not process the request due to something that is perceived to be a client error (e.g., malformed request syntax, invalid request message framing, or deceptive request routing).

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]

Update information about the settings.

  • Security

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • amount: required (number)
  • securityDeposit: required (number)
  • demoninations: required (array of Denomination)

    Items: Denomination

    • value: required (number)
    • cashType: required (one of PAPER, COIN)
  • questions: required (array of Question)

    Items: Question

    • index: required (number)

{

    {
      "value": 100000,
      "cashType": "COIN"
    },
    {
      "value": 300000,
      "cashType": "PAPER"

    {
      "index": 1,
      "question": "This is the question 1."
    },
    {
      "index": 2,
      "question": "This is the question 2."
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 200

It has updated the settings.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • amount: required (number)
  • securityDeposit: required (number)
  • demoninations: required (array of Denomination)

    Items: Denomination

Shiftplanning

This resource contains all the necessary operations for the management of the shiftplanning, among these operations we will have HTTP methods to get all the elements, to get a single element, to add new elements to the resource, to edit the existing elements and finally to eliminate.

/shiftplanning get post

get

Get a list of all shiftplanning.

post

Add a new shiftplanning.

get /shiftplanning

Get a list of all shiftplanning.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

Query Parameters

  • start: (number - default: 0 - minimum: 0)

    Specify the index of first element to get

    Example:

    10
  • size: (number - minimum: 10 - maximum: 200)

    Specify the amount of items that will be retrieved per request

    Example:

    150

HTTP status code 200

Successfull request.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • items: required (array of ShiftplanningResponse)

    Items: ShiftplanningResponse

    • id: required (integer)
    • initialDate: required (datetime)
    • finalDate: required (datetime)
    • operation: required (object)
      • id: (number)
      • name: required (string)
      • alias: required (string)
      • description: (string)
      • imageUrl: (string)
      • adminUser: (object)
        • id: required (number)
        • username: (string)
        • email: required (string)
        • displayName: required (string)
    • shifts: required (array of ShiftResponse)

      Items: ShiftResponse

      • startTime: required (datetime)
      • endTime: required (datetime)
      • count: required (integer)
      • index: required (integer)
      • shiftplanningId: required (integer)
  • total: required (integer)

Example:

{
  "items": [
    {
      "id": 1,
      "operation": {
        "id": 1,
        "name": "Operation 411",
        "alias": "411"
      },
      "initialDate": "2017-05-31T05:30:00.000Z",
      "finalDate": "2017-06-01T05:30:00.000Z",
      "shifts": [
        {
          "index": 1,
          "shiftplanningId": 1,
          "startTime": "2017-05-31T05:30:00.000Z",
          "endTime": "2017-05-31T10:00:00.000Z",
          "count": 1
        },
        {
          "index": 2,
          "shiftplanningId": 1,
          "startTime": "2017-05-31T10:00:00.000Z",
          "endTime": "2017-05-31T14:00:00.000Z",
          "count": 2
        }
      ]
    },
    {
      "id": 2,
      "operation": {
        "id": 2,
        "name": "Operation 357",
        "alias": "357"
      },
      "initialDate": "2017-06-01T05:30:00.000Z",
      "finalDate": "2017-06-02T05:30:00.000Z",
      "shifts": [
        {
          "index": 1,
          "shiftplanningId": 2,
          "startTime": "2017-05-31T05:30:00.000Z",
          "endTime": "2017-05-31T10:00:00.000Z",
          "count": 1
        },
        {
          "index": 2,
          "shiftplanningId": 2,
          "startTime": "2017-05-31T10:00:00.000Z",
          "endTime": "2017-05-31T14:00:00.000Z",
          "count": 2
        }
      ]
    }
  ],
  "total": 10
}

HTTP status code 404

The origin server did not find a current representation for the target resource or is not willing to disclose that one exists.

Resource not found, specifically occurs when a route is poorly specified, make sure that the resource ID are needing is correct.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 404,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 500

The server encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request.

If an error occurred on the server, the required operation could not be performed, sorry.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 500,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

Secured by jwt

Headers

  • Authorization: required (string)

    Used to send a valid JWT access token. In the Authorization header using the Bearer schema.

    Example:

    Bearer eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJzdWIiOiIxMjM0NTY3ODkwIiwibmFtZSI6IkpvaG4gRG9lIiwiYWRtaW4iOnRydWV9.TJVA95OrM7E2cBab30RMHrHDcEfxjoYZgeFONFh7HgQ

post /shiftplanning

Add a new shiftplanning.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • initialDate: required (datetime)
  • finalDate: required (datetime)
  • operationId: required (integer)
  • shifts: required (array of Shift)

    Items: Shift

    • startTime: required (datetime)
    • endTime: required (datetime)
    • count: required (integer)

Example:

{
  "operationId": 1,
  "initialDate": "2017-05-31T05:30:00.000Z",
  "finalDate": "2017-06-01T05:30:00.000Z",
  "shifts": [
    {
      "startTime": "2017-05-31T05:30:00.000Z",
      "endTime": "2017-05-31T10:00:00.000Z",
      "count": 1
    },
    {
      "startTime": "2017-05-31T10:00:00.000Z",
      "endTime": "2017-05-31T14:00:00.000Z",
      "count": 2
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 201

It has created a new shiftplanning.

Headers

  • Location: required (string)

    Location where you can get the information of the created shiftplanning.

    Example:

    http://api.arpia.com/v1/shiftplanning/1

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • initialDate: required (datetime)
  • finalDate: required (datetime)
  • operationId: required (integer)
  • shifts: required (array of Shift)

    Items: Shift

    • startTime: required (datetime)
    • endTime: required (datetime)
    • count: required (integer)

HTTP status code 400

The server cannot or will not process the request due to something that is perceived to be a client error (e.g., malformed request syntax, invalid request message framing, or deceptive request routing).

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 400,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 404

The origin server did not find a current representation for the target resource or is not willing to disclose that one exists.

Resource not found, specifically occurs when a route is poorly specified, make sure that the resource ID are needing is correct.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 404,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 500

The server encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request.

If an error occurred on the server, the required operation could not be performed, sorry.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 500,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

Secured by jwt

Headers

  • Authorization: required (string)

    Used to send a valid JWT access token. In the Authorization header using the Bearer schema.

    Example:

    Bearer eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJzdWIiOiIxMjM0NTY3ODkwIiwibmFtZSI6IkpvaG4gRG9lIiwiYWRtaW4iOnRydWV9.TJVA95OrM7E2cBab30RMHrHDcEfxjoYZgeFONFh7HgQ

/shiftplanning/{id} get delete

A specific shiftplanning, a item of the shiftplanning list.

get

Get information about a shiftplanning.

delete

Remove a specific shiftplanning.

get /shiftplanning/{id}

Get information about a shiftplanning.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • id: required (number)

    shiftplanning ID is required.

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

HTTP status code 200

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • id: required (integer)
  • initialDate: required (datetime)
  • finalDate: required (datetime)
  • operation: required (object)
    • id: (number)
    • name: required (string)
    • alias: required (string)
    • description: (string)
    • imageUrl: (string)
    • adminUser: (object)
      • id: required (number)
      • username: (string)
      • email: required (string)
      • displayName: required (string)
  • shifts: required (array of ShiftResponse)

    Items: ShiftResponse

    • startTime: required (datetime)
    • endTime: required (datetime)
    • count: required (integer)
    • index: required (integer)
    • shiftplanningId: required (integer)

Example:

{
  "id": 2,
  "operation": {
    "id": 1,
    "name": "Operation 411",
    "alias": "411"
  },
  "initialDate": "2017-06-01T05:30:00.000Z",
  "finalDate": "2017-06-02T05:30:00.000Z",
  "shifts": [
    {
      "index": 1,
      "shiftplanningId": 2,
      "startTime": "2017-05-31T05:30:00.000Z",
      "endTime": "2017-05-31T10:00:00.000Z",
      "count": 1
    },
    {
      "index": 2,
      "shiftplanningId": 2,
      "startTime": "2017-05-31T10:00:00.000Z",
      "endTime": "2017-05-31T14:00:00.000Z",
      "count": 2
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 400

The server cannot or will not process the request due to something that is perceived to be a client error (e.g., malformed request syntax, invalid request message framing, or deceptive request routing).

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 400,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 404

The origin server did not find a current representation for the target resource or is not willing to disclose that one exists.

Resource not found, specifically occurs when a route is poorly specified, make sure that the resource ID are needing is correct.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 404,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 500

The server encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request.

If an error occurred on the server, the required operation could not be performed, sorry.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 500,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

Secured by jwt

Headers

  • Authorization: required (string)

    Used to send a valid JWT access token. In the Authorization header using the Bearer schema.

    Example:

    Bearer eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJzdWIiOiIxMjM0NTY3ODkwIiwibmFtZSI6IkpvaG4gRG9lIiwiYWRtaW4iOnRydWV9.TJVA95OrM7E2cBab30RMHrHDcEfxjoYZgeFONFh7HgQ

delete /shiftplanning/{id}

Remove a specific shiftplanning.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • id: required (number)

    shiftplanning ID is required.

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

HTTP status code 200

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • id: required (integer)
  • initialDate: required (datetime)
  • finalDate: required (datetime)
  • operation: required (object)
    • id: (number)
    • name: required (string)
    • alias: required (string)
    • description: (string)
    • imageUrl: (string)
    • adminUser: (object)
      • id: required (number)
      • username: (string)
      • email: required (string)
      • displayName: required (string)
  • shifts: required (array of ShiftResponse)

    Items: ShiftResponse

    • startTime: required (datetime)
    • endTime: required (datetime)
    • count: required (integer)
    • index: required (integer)
    • shiftplanningId: required (integer)

HTTP status code 400

The server cannot or will not process the request due to something that is perceived to be a client error (e.g., malformed request syntax, invalid request message framing, or deceptive request routing).

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 400,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

Body

Media type: application/json

    Used to send a valid JWT access token. In the Authorization header using the Bearer schema.
