/shiftplanning/{id}/shifts get post

This resource contains all the necessary operations for the management of the shifts, among these operations we will have HTTP methods to get all the elements, to get a single element, to add new elements to the resource, to edit the existing elements and finally to eliminate.

get

Get a list of all shifts.

post

Add a new shift.

get /shiftplanning/{id}/shifts

Get a list of all shifts.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • id: required (number)

    shiftplanning ID is required.

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

HTTP status code 200

Successfull request.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: array of ShiftResponse

Items: ShiftResponse

  • startTime: required (datetime)
  • endTime: required (datetime)
  • count: required (integer)
  • index: required (integer)
  • shiftplanningId: required (integer)

Example:

[
  {
    "index": 1,
    "shiftplanningId": 1,
    "startTime": "2017-05-31T05:30:00.000Z",
    "endTime": "2017-05-31T10:00:00.000Z",
    "count": 1
  },
  {
    "index": 2,
    "shiftplanningId": 1,
    "startTime": "2017-05-31T05:30:00.000Z",
    "endTime": "2017-05-31T10:00:00.000Z",
    "count": 2
  }
]

HTTP status code 404

The origin server did not find a current representation for the target resource or is not willing to disclose that one exists.

Resource not found, specifically occurs when a route is poorly specified, make sure that the resource ID are needing is correct.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties

  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 404,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

post /shiftplanning/{id}/shifts

Add a new shift.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • id: required (number)

    shiftplanning ID is required.

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • startTime: required (datetime)
  • endTime: required (datetime)
  • count: required (integer)

HTTP status code 200

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Example:

{
  "startTime": "2017-05-31T05:30:00.000Z",
  "endTime": "2017-05-31T10:00:00.000Z",
  "count": 1
}

HTTP status code 201

It has created a new shift.

Headers

  • Location: required (string)

    Location where you can get the information of the created shift.

    Example:

    http://api.arpia.com/v1/shifts/1

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • startTime: required (datetime)
  • endTime: required (datetime)
  • count: required (integer)

/shiftplanning/{id}/shifts/{index} get put delete

A specific shift, a item of the shifts list.

get

Get information about a shift.

put

Update information about the specific shift.

delete

Remove a specific shift.

get /shiftplanning/{id}/shifts/{index}

Get information about a shift.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • id: required (number)

    shiftplanning ID is required.

  • index: required (number)

    Shift INDEX is required

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

HTTP status code 200

Successfull request.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • startTime: required (datetime)
  • endTime: required (datetime)
  • count: required (integer)
  • index: required (integer)
  • shiftplanningId: required (integer)

Example:

{
  "index": 2,
  "shiftplanningId": 1,
  "startTime": "2017-05-31T05:30:00.000Z",
  "endTime": "2017-05-31T10:00:00.000Z",
  "count": 2
}

The server cannot or will not process the request due to something that is perceived to be a client error (e.g., malformed request syntax, invalid request message framing, or deceptive request routing).

put /shiftplanning/{id}/shifts/{index}

Update information about the specific shift.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • id: required (number)

    shiftplanning ID is required.

  • index: required (number)

    Shift INDEX is required

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • startTime: required (datetime)
  • endTime: required (datetime)
  • count: required (integer)

Example:

{
  "startTime": "2017-05-31T05:30:00.000Z",
  "endTime": "2017-05-31T10:00:00.000Z",
  "count": 1
}

HTTP status code 200

It has updated a shift.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • startTime: required (datetime)
  • endTime: required (datetime)
  • count: required (integer)
  • index: required (integer)
  • shiftplanningId: required (integer)

Example:

{
  "index": 2,
  "shiftplanningId": 1,
  "startTime": "2017-05-31T05:30:00.000Z",
  "endTime": "2017-05-31T10:00:00.000Z",
  "count": 2
}

delete /shiftplanning/{id}/shifts/{index}

Remove a specific shift.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • id: required (number)

    shiftplanning ID is required.

  • index: required (number)

    Shift INDEX is required

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

HTTP status code 200

Successfull request.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • startTime: required (datetime)
  • endTime: required (datetime)
  • count: required (integer)
  • index: required (integer)
  • shiftplanningId: required (integer)

Example:

{
  "index": 2,
  "shiftplanningId": 1,
  "startTime": "2017-05-31T05:30:00.000Z",
  "endTime": "2017-05-31T10:00:00.000Z",
  "count": 2
}

HTTP status code 400

The server cannot or will not process the request due to something that is perceived to be a client error (e.g., malformed request syntax, invalid request message framing, or deceptive request routing).

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 400,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 404

The origin server did not find a current representation for the target resource or is not willing to disclose that one exists.

Resource not found, specifically occurs when a route is poorly specified, make sure that the resource ID are needing is correct.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 404,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 500

The server encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request.

If an error occurred on the server, the required operation could not be performed, sorry.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 500,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

Secured by jwt

Headers

  • Authorization: required (string)

    Used to send a valid JWT access token. In the Authorization header using the Bearer schema.

    Example:

    Bearer eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJzdWIiOiIxMjM0NTY3ODkwIiwibmFtZSI6IkpvaG4gRG9lIiwiYWRtaW4iOnRydWV9.TJVA95OrM7E2cBab30RMHrHDcEfxjoYZgeFONFh7HgQ

/shiftplanning/{id}/shifts/{index}/assignments get post

This resource contains all the necessary operations for the management of the shift assignments.

get

Get a list of all shift assignments.

post

Allows to assign a shift to a messenger

get /shiftplanning/{id}/shifts/{index}/assignments

Get a list of all shift assignments.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • id: required (number)

    shiftplanning ID is required.

  • index: required (number)

    Shift INDEX is required

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

HTTP status code 200

Successfull request.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: array of ShiftAssignmentResponse

Items: ShiftAssignmentResponse

  • messenger: required (object)
    • id: required (number)
    • identification: required (string)
    • name: required (string)
    • lastName: required (string)
    • gender: (one of MALE, FEMALE)
    • birthday: (date-only)
    • photo: required (string)
    • category: (number)
  • shift: required (object)
    • startTime: required (datetime)
    • endTime: required (datetime)
    • count: required (integer)
    • index: required (integer)
    • shiftplanningId: required (integer)

Example:

[
  {
    "messenger": {
      "id": 1,
      "identification": "12346798",
      "name": "Jhon",
      "lastName": "Doe",
      "gender": "MALE",
      "birthday": "1993-02-11",
      "photo": "http://static.arpia.com/imgs/img_001.jpg",
      "category": 5
    },
    "shift": {
      "index": 1,
      "shiftplanningId": 1,
      "startTime": "2017-08-11T12:00:00.000Z",
      "endTime": "2017-08-11T16:00:00.000Z",
      "count": 2
    }
  },
  {
    "messenger": {
      "id": 1,
      "identification": "12346798",
      "name": "Jhon",
      "lastName": "Doe",
      "gender": "MALE",
      "birthday": "1993-02-11",
      "photo": "http://static.arpia.com/imgs/img_001.jpg",
      "category": 5
    },
    "shift": {
      "index": 2,
      "shiftplanningId": 1,
      "startTime": "2017-08-11T08:00:00.000Z",
      "endTime": "2017-08-11T12:00:00.000Z",
      "count": 3
    }
  }
]

HTTP status code 404

The origin server did not find a current representation for the target resource or is not willing to disclose that one exists.

Resource not found, specifically occurs when a route is poorly specified, make sure that the resource ID are needing is correct.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

  "statusCode": 404,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • id: required (number)

    shiftplanning ID is required.

  • index: required (number)

    Shift INDEX is required

Headers

  • Accept-Language: required (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • messengerId: required (integer)

Example:

{
  "messengerId": 1
}

HTTP status code 200

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • messenger: required (object)
    • id: required (number)
    • identification: required (string)
    • name: required (string)
    • lastName: required (string)
    • gender: (one of MALE, FEMALE)
    • birthday: (date-only)
    • photo: required (string)
    • category: (number)

    • endTime: required (datetime)

/shiftplanning/{id}/shifts/{index}/assignments/{messengerId} delete

delete

Delete a shift assignment that belongs a messenger

delete /shiftplanning/{id}/shifts/{index}/assignments/{messengerId}

Delete a shift assignment that belongs a messenger

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • id: required (number)

    shiftplanning ID is required.

  • index: required (number)

    Shift INDEX is required

  • messengerId: required (string)

    messenger ID that belongs the assignment

Headers

  • Accept-Language: required (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

HTTP status code 200

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • messenger: required (object)
    • id: required (number)
    • identification: required (string)
    • name: required (string)
    • lastName: required (string)
    • gender: (one of MALE, FEMALE)
    • birthday: (date-only)
    • photo: required (string)
    • category: (number)
  • shift: required (object)
    • startTime: required (datetime)
    • endTime: required (datetime)
    • count: required (integer)
    • index: required (integer)
    • shiftplanningId: required (integer)

Example:

{
  "messenger": {
    "id": 1,
    "identification": "12346798",
    "name": "Jhon",
    "lastName": "Doe",
    "gender": "MALE",
    "birthday": "1993-02-11",
    "photo": "http://static.arpia.com/imgs/img_001.jpg",
    "category": 5
  },
  "shift": {
    "index": 2,
    "shiftplanningId": 1,
    "startTime": "2017-08-11T12:00:00.000Z",
    "endTime": "2017-08-11T16:00:00.000Z",
    "count": 2
  }
}

/shiftplanning/{id}/shifts/{index}/checks get

This resource contains all the necessary operations for the management of the shift checks.

get

Get a list of all shift checks.

get /shiftplanning/{id}/shifts/{index}/checks

Get a list of all shift checks.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • id: required (number)

    shiftplanning ID is required.

  • index: required (number)

    Shift INDEX is required

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

HTTP status code 200

Successfull request.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: array of ShiftCheckResponse

Items: ShiftCheckResponse

  • goodAppearance: required (boolean)
  • observations: required (string)
  • clockIn: required (datetime)
  • clockOut: required (datetime)
  • messenger: required (object)
    • id: required (number)
    • identification: required (string)
    • name: required (string)
    • lastName: required (string)
    • gender: (one of MALE, FEMALE)
    • birthday: (date-only)
    • photo: required (string)
    • category: (number)

Example:

[
  {
    "goodAppearance": true,
    "observations": "everything fine",
    "clockIn": "2017-05-10T08:00:00.000Z",
    "clockOut": "2017-05-10T12:00:00.000Z",
    "messenger": {
      "id": 1,
      "identification": "12346798",
      "name": "Jhon",
      "lastName": "Doe",
      "gender": "MALE",
      "birthday": "1993-02-11",
      "photo": "http://static.arpia.com/imgs/img_001.jpg",
      "category": 5
    }
  },
  {
    "goodAppearance": false,
    "observations": "everything fine",
    "clockIn": "2017-05-10T08:00:00.000Z",
    "clockOut": "2017-05-10T12:00:00.000Z",
    "messenger": {
      "id": 1,
      "identification": "12346798",
      "name": "Jhon",
      "lastName": "Doe",
      "gender": "MALE",
      "birthday": "1993-02-11",
      "photo": "http://static.arpia.com/imgs/img_001.jpg",
      "category": 5
    }
  }
]

HTTP status code 404

The origin server did not find a current representation for the target resource or is not willing to disclose that one exists.

Resource not found, specifically occurs when a route is poorly specified, make sure that the resource ID are needing is correct.

Body

Media type: application/json

  • documentation: required (string)

/shiftplanning/{id}/shifts/{index}/checks/clockin post

post

Allows to clockin a shift

post /shiftplanning/{id}/shifts/{index}/checks/clockin

Allows to clockin a shift

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • id: required (number)

    shiftplanning ID is required.

  • index: required (number)

    Shift INDEX is required

Headers

  • Accept-Language: required (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • goodAppearance: required (boolean)
  • observations: required (string)
  • messengerId: required (integer)

Example:

{
  "messengerId": 1,
  "goodAppearance": true,
  "observations": "everything fine"
}

HTTP status code 200

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • goodAppearance: required (boolean)
  • observations: required (string)
  • clockIn: required (datetime)
  • clockOut: required (datetime)

    • id: required (number)
    • identification: required (string)
    • name: required (string)

    • category: (number)

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

  • id: required (number)

    shiftplanning ID is required.

  • index: required (number)

Headers

  • Accept-Language: required (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • messengerId: required (number)

Example:

{
  "messengerId": 1
}

HTTP status code 200

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • goodAppearance: required (boolean)
  • observations: required (string)
  • clockIn: required (datetime)
  • clockOut: required (datetime)
  • messenger: required (object)
    • id: required (number)
    • identification: required (string)
    • name: required (string)
    • lastName: required (string)
    • gender: (one of MALE, FEMALE)
    • birthday: (date-only)
    • photo: required (string)
    • category: (number)

Example:

{
  "goodAppearance": true,
  "observations": "everything fine",
  "clockIn": "2017-05-10T08:00:00.000Z",
  "clockOut": "2017-05-10T12:00:00.000Z",
  "messenger": {
    "id": 1,
    "identification": "12346798",
    "name": "Jhon",
    "lastName": "Doe",
    "gender": "MALE",
    "birthday": "1993-02-11",
    "photo": "http://static.arpia.com/imgs/img_001.jpg",
    "category": 5
  }
}

HTTP status code 400

The server cannot or will not process the request due to something that is perceived to be a client error (e.g., malformed request syntax, invalid request message framing, or deceptive request routing).

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 400,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 404

The origin server did not find a current representation for the target resource or is not willing to disclose that one exists.

Resource not found, specifically occurs when a route is poorly specified, make sure that the resource ID are needing is correct.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 404,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 500

The server encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request.

If an error occurred on the server, the required operation could not be performed, sorry.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 500,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

Secured by jwt

Headers

  • Authorization: required (string)

    Used to send a valid JWT access token. In the Authorization header using the Bearer schema.

    Example:

    Bearer eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJzdWIiOiIxMjM0NTY3ODkwIiwibmFtZSI6IkpvaG4gRG9lIiwiYWRtaW4iOnRydWV9.TJVA95OrM7E2cBab30RMHrHDcEfxjoYZgeFONFh7HgQ

/shiftplanning/{id}/shifts/{index}/checks/keys get

This resource contains all the necessary operations for the management of the shift check keys.

get

Get a list of all shift check keys.

get /shiftplanning/{id}/shifts/{index}/checks/keys

Get a list of all shift check keys.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • id: required (number)

    shiftplanning ID is required.

  • index: required (number)

    Shift INDEX is required

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

Query Parameters

  • messengerId: required (number)

    Allows to filter the shift check keys by messenger ID

HTTP status code 200

Successfull request.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: array of ShiftCheckKeyResponse

Items: ShiftCheckKeyResponse

  • key: required (string)
  • creationDate: required (datetime)
  • useDate: required (datetime)

Example:

[
  {
    "key": "123456",
    "creationDate": "2017-05-10T08:00:00.000Z",
    "useDate": "2017-05-10T08:01:00.000Z"
  },
  {
    "key": "654321",
    "creationDate": "2017-05-10T08:00:00.000Z",
    "useDate": "2017-05-10T08:01:00.000Z"
  }
]

HTTP status code 404

The origin server did not find a current representation for the target resource or is not willing to disclose that one exists.

Resource not found, specifically occurs when a route is poorly specified, make sure that the resource ID are needing is correct.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 404,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 500

The server encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request.

If an error occurred on the server, the required operation could not be performed, sorry.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 500,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

Secured by jwt

Headers

  • Authorization: required (string)

    Used to send a valid JWT access token. In the Authorization header using the Bearer schema.

    Example:

    Bearer eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJzdWIiOiIxMjM0NTY3ODkwIiwibmFtZSI6IkpvaG4gRG9lIiwiYWRtaW4iOnRydWV9.TJVA95OrM7E2cBab30RMHrHDcEfxjoYZgeFONFh7HgQ

/shiftplanning/{id}/shifts/{index}/checks/keys/generate get

get

Allows to generate a shift check key

get /shiftplanning/{id}/shifts/{index}/checks/keys/generate

Allows to generate a shift check key

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • id: required (number)

    shiftplanning ID is required.

  • index: required (number)

    Shift INDEX is required

Headers

  • Accept-Language: required (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

Query Parameters

  • messengerId: required (number)

    Messenger ID to generate o use the key

HTTP status code 200

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • key: required (string)
  • creationDate: required (datetime)
  • useDate: required (datetime)

Example:

{
  "key": "123456",
  "creationDate": "2017-05-10T08:00:00.000Z",
  "useDate": "2017-05-10T08:01:00.000Z"
}

Shortcuts

This resource contains all the necessary operations for the management of the shortcuts, among these operations we will have HTTP methods to get all the elements, to get a single element, to add new elements to the resource, to edit the existing elements and finally to eliminate.

/shortcuts get post

get

Get a list of all shortcuts.

post

Add a new shortcut.

get /shortcuts

Get a list of all shortcuts.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

HTTP status code 200

Successfull request.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: array of Shortcut

Items: Shortcut

  • id: (number)
  • key: required (string)
  • command: required (string)
  • when: required (string)
  • description: (string - maxLength: 60)

Example:

[
  {
    "id": 1,
    "key": "Ctrl + A",
    "command": "openDialog.customer",
    "when": "domicile",
    "description": "This is a description."
  },
  {
    "id": 2,
    "key": "Ctrl + 1",
    "command": "writeDireccion -d 1",
    "when": "domicile",
    "description": "This is a description."
  }
]

HTTP status code 404

The origin server did not find a current representation for the target resource or is not willing to disclose that one exists.

Resource not found, specifically occurs when a route is poorly specified, make sure that the resource ID are needing is correct.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 404,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

post /shortcuts

Add a new shortcut.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • id: (number)
  • key: required (string)
  • command: required (string)
  • when: required (string)
  • description: (string - maxLength: 60)

Example:

{
  "key": "Ctrl + A",
  "command": "openDialog.customer",
  "when": "domicile"
}

HTTP status code 201

It has created a new shortcut.

Headers

  • Location: required (string)

    Location where you can get the information of the created shortcut.

    Example:

    http://api.arpia.com/v1/shortcuts/1

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • id: (number)
  • key: required (string)
  • command: required (string)
  • when: required (string)
  • description: (string - maxLength: 60)

Example:

{
  "id": 1,
  "key": "Ctrl + A",
  "command": "openDialog.customer",
  "when": "domicile",
  "description": "This is a description."
}

/shortcuts/{id} get put delete

A specific shortcut, a item of the shortcuts list.

get

Get information about a shortcut.

put

Update information about the specific shortcut.

delete

Remove a specific shortcut.

get /shortcuts/{id}

Get information about a shortcut.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • id: required (number)

    Shortcut ID is required.

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

  • id: (number)

  "id": 1,
  "key": "Ctrl + A",
  "command": "openDialog.customer",
  "when": "domicile",
  "description": "This is a description."
}

It has updated a shortcut.

Body

Media type: application/json

  • id: (number)

  • when: required (string)

HTTP status code 400

The server cannot or will not process the request due to something that is perceived to be a client error (e.g., malformed request syntax, invalid request message framing, or deceptive request routing).

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 400,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 404

The origin server did not find a current representation for the target resource or is not willing to disclose that one exists.

Resource not found, specifically occurs when a route is poorly specified, make sure that the resource ID are needing is correct.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 404,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 500

The server encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request.

If an error occurred on the server, the required operation could not be performed, sorry.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 500,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

Secured by jwt

Headers

  • Authorization: required (string)

    Used to send a valid JWT access token. In the Authorization header using the Bearer schema.

    Example:

    Bearer eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJzdWIiOiIxMjM0NTY3ODkwIiwibmFtZSI6IkpvaG4gRG9lIiwiYWRtaW4iOnRydWV9.TJVA95OrM7E2cBab30RMHrHDcEfxjoYZgeFONFh7HgQ

delete /shortcuts/{id}

Remove a specific shortcut.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • id: required (number)

    Shortcut ID is required.

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

HTTP status code 200

Successfull request.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • id: (number)
  • key: required (string)
  • command: required (string)
  • when: required (string)
  • description: (string - maxLength: 60)

Example:

{
  "id": 1,
  "key": "Ctrl + A",
  "command": "openDialog.customer",
  "when": "domicile",
  "description": "This is a description."
}

HTTP status code 400

The server cannot or will not process the request due to something that is perceived to be a client error (e.g., malformed request syntax, invalid request message framing, or deceptive request routing).

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 400,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 404

The origin server did not find a current representation for the target resource or is not willing to disclose that one exists.

Resource not found, specifically occurs when a route is poorly specified, make sure that the resource ID are needing is correct.

/shortcuts/key/{key} get

get

Get a keyboard shortcut with the given key combination.

get /shortcuts/key/{key}

Get a keyboard shortcut with the given key combination.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • key: required (string)

    The keyboard shorcut.

    Example:

    Ctrl+A

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

HTTP status code 200

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • id: (number)
  • key: required (string)
  • command: required (string)
  • when: required (string)
  • description: (string - maxLength: 60)

Example:

{
  "id": 1,
  "key": "Ctrl + A",
  "command": "openDialog.customer",
  "when": "domicile",
  "description": "This is a description."
}

HTTP status code 400

The server cannot or will not process the request due to something that is perceived to be a client error (e.g., malformed request syntax, invalid request message framing, or deceptive request routing).

    Example:

    Bearer eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJzdWIiOiIxMjM0NTY3ODkwIiwibmFtZSI6IkpvaG4gRG9lIiwiYWRtaW4iOnRydWV9.TJVA95OrM7E2cBab30RMHrHDcEfxjoYZgeFONFh7HgQ

Special Dates

This resource contains all the necessary operations for the management of the special dates, among these operations we will have HTTP methods to get all the elements, to get a single element, to add new elements to the resource, to edit the existing elements and finally to eliminate.

/specialdates get post

get

Get a list of all the special dates.

post

Add a new special date.

get /specialdates

Get a list of all the special dates.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

HTTP status code 200

Successfull request.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: array of SpecialDate

Items: SpecialDate

  • id: (number)
  • name: required (string)
  • date: required (datetime)

Example:

[
  {
    "id": 1,
    "name": "special date #1",
    "date": "2017-04-01T08:00:00.000Z"
  },
  {
    "id": 2,
    "name": "special date #2",
    "date": "2017-05-01T08:00:00.000Z"
  }
]

HTTP status code 404

The origin server did not find a current representation for the target resource or is not willing to disclose that one exists.

Resource not found, specifically occurs when a route is poorly specified, make sure that the resource ID are needing is correct.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 404,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

post /specialdates

Add a new special date.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • id: (number)
  • name: required (string)
  • date: required (datetime)

Example:

{
  "name": "special date #1",
  "date": "2017-04-01T08:00:00.000Z"
}

HTTP status code 201

It has created a new specialdate.

Headers

  • Location: required (string)

    Location where you can get the information of the created specialdate.

    Example:

    http://api.arpia.com/v1/specialdates/1

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • id: (number)
  • name: required (string)
  • date: required (datetime)

Example:

{
  "id": 1,
  "name": "special date #1",
  "date": "2017-04-01T08:00:00.000Z"
}

/specialdates/{id} get put delete

A specific special date, a item of the special dates list.

get

Get information about a special date.

put

Update information about the specific special date.

delete

Remove a specific special date.

get /specialdates/{id}

Get information about a special date.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • id: required (number)

    Specialdate ID is required.

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

  • id: (number)

  "id": 1,

  "date": "2017-04-01T08:00:00.000Z"
}

put /specialdates/{id}

Update information about the specific special date.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • id: required (number)

    Specialdate ID is required.

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

Media type: application/json

Type: object

  • id: (number)
  • name: required (string)
  • date: required (datetime)

Example:

{
  "name": "special date #1",
  "date": "2017-04-01T08:00:00.000Z"
}

HTTP status code 200

It has updated a specialdate.

    Used to send a valid JWT access token. In the Authorization header using the Bearer schema.

    Example:

    Bearer eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJzdWIiOiIxMjM0NTY3ODkwIiwibmFtZSI6IkpvaG4gRG9lIiwiYWRtaW4iOnRydWV9.TJVA95OrM7E2cBab30RMHrHDcEfxjoYZgeFONFh7HgQ

Users

This resource contains all the necessary operations for the management of the users, among these operations we will have HTTP methods to get all the elements, to get a single element, to add new elements to the resource, to edit the existing elements and finally to eliminate.

/users get post

get

Get a list of all users.

post

Add a new user.

get /users

Get a list of all users.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

Query Parameters

  • type: (one of SUPER_USER, ADMINISTRATOR, OPERATOR, MESSENGER, CLIENT)

    Specify if you need filtered result by the user type.

  • search: (string)

    The value to search.

  • start: (number - default: 0 - minimum: 0)

    Specify the index of first element to get

    Example:

    10
  • size: (number - minimum: 10 - maximum: 200)

    Specify the amount of items that will be retrieved per request

    Example:

    150
  • orderBy: (string)

    Specify the property of the object be sorted.

  • orderType: (one of ASC, DESC - default: ASC)

    Specify whether to sort ascending or descending

HTTP status code 200

Successfull request.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • items: required (array of User)

    Items: User

    • id: (number)
    • username: (string - minLength: 3 - maxLength: 12 - pattern: ^(?!\d*$)[_a-z\d]{3,12}$$)
    • email: required (string - pattern: ^([\w\.-]+)@((?:[\w]+\.)+)([a-zA-Z]{2,4})$)
    • displayName: required (string)
    • userType: required (one of SUPER_USER, ADMINISTRATOR, OPERATOR, MESSENGER, CLIENT)
    • roleId: (number)
    • urlPic: (string)
    • operations: required (array of number)
    • enabled: (boolean)
    • created: (datetime)
    • updated: (datetime)
  • total: required (integer)

Example:

{
  "items": [
    {
      "id": 1,
      "username": "ryctabo",
      "email": "ryctabo@mail.com",
      "displayName": "Gustavo Pacheco",
      "userType": "OPERATOR",
      "roleId": 1,
      "urlPic": "default",
      "operations": [
        1
      ],
      "enabled": true,
      "created": "2017-04-01T08:00:00.000Z"
    },
    {
      "id": 2,
      "username": "luislenes",
      "email": "luislenes@mail.com",
      "displayName": "Luis Lenes",
      "userType": "OPERATOR",
      "roleId": 2,
      "urlPic": "http://static.arpia.com/imgs/img_001.jpg",
      "operations": [
        1,
        2
      ],
      "enabled": false,
      "created": "2017-04-01T08:00:00.000Z",
      "updated": "2017-04-01T12:30:00.000Z"
    }
  ],
  "total": 10
}

HTTP status code 404

The origin server did not find a current representation for the target resource or is not willing to disclose that one exists.

Resource not found, specifically occurs when a route is poorly specified, make sure that the resource ID are needing is correct.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 404,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 500

The server encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request.

If an error occurred on the server, the required operation could not be performed, sorry.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 500,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

Secured by jwt

Headers

  • Authorization: required (string)

    Used to send a valid JWT access token. In the Authorization header using the Bearer schema.

    Example:

    Bearer eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJzdWIiOiIxMjM0NTY3ODkwIiwibmFtZSI6IkpvaG4gRG9lIiwiYWRtaW4iOnRydWV9.TJVA95OrM7E2cBab30RMHrHDcEfxjoYZgeFONFh7HgQ

post /users

Add a new user.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: User

Properties
  • password: required (string)

Example:

{
  "username": "ryctabo",
  "email": "ryctabo@mail.com",
  "displayName": "Gustavo Pacheco",
  "password": "123456",
  "userType": "OPERATOR",
  "roleId": 1,
  "operations": [
    1,
    2
  ]
}

HTTP status code 201

It has created a new user.

Headers

  • Location: required (string)

    Location where you can get the information of the created user.

    Example:

    http://api.arpia.com/v1/users/1

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • id: (number)
  • username: (string - minLength: 3 - maxLength: 12 - pattern: ^(?!\d*$)[_a-z\d]{3,12}$$)
  • email: required (string - pattern: ^([\w\.-]+)@((?:[\w]+\.)+)([a-zA-Z]{2,4})$)
  • displayName: required (string)
  • userType: required (one of SUPER_USER, ADMINISTRATOR, OPERATOR, MESSENGER, CLIENT)
  • roleId: (number)
  • urlPic: (string)
  • operations: required (array of number)
  • enabled: (boolean)
  • created: (datetime)
  • updated: (datetime)

HTTP status code 400

The server cannot or will not process the request due to something that is perceived to be a client error (e.g., malformed request syntax, invalid request message framing, or deceptive request routing).

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 400,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

/users/{id} get put delete

A specific user, a item of the users list.

get

Get information about a user.

put

Update information about the specific user.

delete

Remove a specific user.

get /users/{id}

Get information about a user.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • id: required (number)

    User ID is required.

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

HTTP status code 200

Successfull request.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • id: (number)
  • username: (string - minLength: 3 - maxLength: 12 - pattern: ^(?!\d*$)[_a-z\d]{3,12}$$)
  • email: required (string - pattern: ^([\w\.-]+)@((?:[\w]+\.)+)([a-zA-Z]{2,4})$)
  • displayName: required (string)
  • userType: required (one of SUPER_USER, ADMINISTRATOR, OPERATOR, MESSENGER, CLIENT)
  • roleId: (number)
  • urlPic: (string)
  • operations: required (array of number)
  • enabled: (boolean)
  • created: (datetime)
  • updated: (datetime)

Example:

{
  "id": 1,
  "username": "ryctabo",
  "email": "ryctabo@mail.com",
  "displayName": "Gustavo Pacheco",
  "userType": "OPERATOR",
  "roleId": 1,
  "urlPic": "default",
  "operations": [
    1
  ],
  "enabled": true,
  "created": "2017-04-01T08:00:00.000Z"
}

    User ID is required.

Media type: application/json

  • id: (number)
  • username: (string - minLength: 3 - maxLength: 12 - pattern: ^(?!\d*$)[_a-z\d]{3,12}$$)
  • email: required (string - pattern: ^([\w\.-]+)@((?:[\w]+\.)+)([a-zA-Z]{2,4})$)

  • updated: (datetime)

  • id: (number)

HTTP status code 200

Successfull request.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • id: (number)
  • username: (string - minLength: 3 - maxLength: 12 - pattern: ^(?!\d*$)[_a-z\d]{3,12}$$)
  • email: required (string - pattern: ^([\w\.-]+)@((?:[\w]+\.)+)([a-zA-Z]{2,4})$)
  • displayName: required (string)
  • userType: required (one of SUPER_USER, ADMINISTRATOR, OPERATOR, MESSENGER, CLIENT)
  • roleId: (number)
  • urlPic: (string)
  • operations: required (array of number)
  • enabled: (boolean)
  • created: (datetime)
  • updated: (datetime)

HTTP status code 400

The server cannot or will not process the request due to something that is perceived to be a client error (e.g., malformed request syntax, invalid request message framing, or deceptive request routing).

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 400,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 404

The origin server did not find a current representation for the target resource or is not willing to disclose that one exists.

Resource not found, specifically occurs when a route is poorly specified, make sure that the resource ID are needing is correct.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 404,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 500

The server encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request.

If an error occurred on the server, the required operation could not be performed, sorry.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 500,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

Secured by jwt

Headers

  • Authorization: required (string)

    Used to send a valid JWT access token. In the Authorization header using the Bearer schema.

    Example:

    Bearer eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJzdWIiOiIxMjM0NTY3ODkwIiwibmFtZSI6IkpvaG4gRG9lIiwiYWRtaW4iOnRydWV9.TJVA95OrM7E2cBab30RMHrHDcEfxjoYZgeFONFh7HgQ

/users/username get

get

Get user information from the given username.

get /users/username

Get user information from the given username.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Headers

  • Accept-Language: required (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

Query Parameters

  • q: required (string - pattern: ^(?!\d*$)[_a-z\d]{3,12}$$)

    username to search

    Example:

    juan123

HTTP status code 200

Successfull request.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • id: (number)
  • username: (string - minLength: 3 - maxLength: 12 - pattern: ^(?!\d*$)[_a-z\d]{3,12}$$)
  • email: required (string - pattern: ^([\w\.-]+)@((?:[\w]+\.)+)([a-zA-Z]{2,4})$)
  • displayName: required (string)
  • userType: required (one of SUPER_USER, ADMINISTRATOR, OPERATOR, MESSENGER, CLIENT)
  • roleId: (number)
  • urlPic: (string)
  • operations: required (array of number)
  • enabled: (boolean)
  • created: (datetime)
  • updated: (datetime)

/users/email get

get

Get user information from the give email.

get /users/email

Get user information from the give email.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Headers

  • Accept-Language: required (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

Query Parameters

  • q: required (string - pattern: ^([\w\.-]+)@((?:[\w]+\.)+)([a-zA-Z]{2,4})$)

    email to search

    Example:

    example@mail.com

Successfull request.

Media type: application/json

Type: object

  • id: (number)

Vehicles

This resource contains all the necessary operations for the management of the vehicles, among these operations we will have HTTP methods to get all the elements, to get a single element, to add new elements to the resource, to edit the existing elements and finally to eliminate.

/vehicles get post

get

Get a list of all vehicles.

post

Add a new vehicle.

get /vehicles

Get a list of all vehicles.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

Query Parameters

  • messengerId: (number)

    Provide if you need get list filtered by messenger ID.

    Example:

    15

HTTP status code 200

Successfull request.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: array of Vehicle

Items: Vehicle

  • tecnomecanicaExpiration: required (date-only)
  • color: (string)
  • licensePlate: required (string)
  • soatExpiration: required (date-only)
  • id: (number)
  • ownership: required (one of INDIVIDUAL, BORROWED)
  • vehicleCondition: required (one of GOOD, REGULAR, BAD)
  • trademark: required (string)
  • model: required (string)

HTTP status code 404

The origin server did not find a current representation for the target resource or is not willing to disclose that one exists.

Resource not found, specifically occurs when a route is poorly specified, make sure that the resource ID are needing is correct.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 404,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

post /vehicles

Add a new vehicle.

Secured by jwt

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • tecnomecanicaExpiration: required (date-only)
  • color: (string)
  • licensePlate: required (string)
  • soatExpiration: required (date-only)
  • id: (number)
  • ownership: required (one of INDIVIDUAL, BORROWED)
  • vehicleCondition: required (one of GOOD, REGULAR, BAD)
  • trademark: required (string)
  • model: required (string)

HTTP status code 201

It has created a new vehicle.

Headers

  • Location: required (string)

    Location where you can get the information of the created vehicle.

    Example:

    http://api.arpia.com/v1/vehicles/1

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • tecnomecanicaExpiration: required (date-only)
  • color: (string)
  • licensePlate: required (string)
  • soatExpiration: required (date-only)

  • ownership: required (one of INDIVIDUAL, BORROWED)
  • vehicleCondition: required (one of GOOD, REGULAR, BAD)
  • trademark: required (string)
  • model: required (string)

/vehicles/{id} get put delete

A specific vehicle, a item of the vehicles list.

get

Get information about a vehicle.

put

Update information about the specific vehicle.

delete

Remove a specific vehicle.

get /vehicles/{id}

Get information about a vehicle.

Secured by jwt

Arpia REST supports Json Web Token for authenticating all API requests.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • id: required (number)

    Vehicle ID is required.

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

HTTP status code 200

  • tecnomecanicaExpiration: required (date-only)

  • trademark: required (string)
  • model: required (string)

Update information about the specific vehicle.

Secured by jwt

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • id: required (number)

    Vehicle ID is required.

Headers

  • Accept-Language: (one of en_US, es_CO - default: en_US)

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

Media type: application/json

Properties

  • ownership: required (one of INDIVIDUAL, BORROWED)
  • vehicleCondition: required (one of GOOD, REGULAR, BAD)
  • trademark: required (string)
  • model: required (string)

Secured by jwt

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • id: required (number)

    Vehicle ID is required.

    It is used to specify the language preferred by the user to receive the error message, by default the API uses en-US.

  • color: (string)
  • licensePlate: required (string)
  • soatExpiration: required (date-only)
  • id: (number)
  • ownership: required (one of INDIVIDUAL, BORROWED)
  • vehicleCondition: required (one of GOOD, REGULAR, BAD)
  • trademark: required (string)
  • model: required (string)

HTTP status code 400

The server cannot or will not process the request due to something that is perceived to be a client error (e.g., malformed request syntax, invalid request message framing, or deceptive request routing).

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 400,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 404

The origin server did not find a current representation for the target resource or is not willing to disclose that one exists.

Resource not found, specifically occurs when a route is poorly specified, make sure that the resource ID are needing is correct.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 404,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 500

The server encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request.

If an error occurred on the server, the required operation could not be performed, sorry.

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • documentation: required (string)
  • statusCode: required (number)
  • messages: required (array of items)

    Items: items

    • message: required (string)

Example:

{
  "documentation": "http://api.arpia.com",
  "statusCode": 500,
  "messages": [
    {
      "message": "This is a first error message."
    },
    {
      "message": "This is a second error message."
    }
  ]
}

Secured by jwt

Headers

  • Authorization: required (string)

    Used to send a valid JWT access token. In the Authorization header using the Bearer schema.

    Example:

    Bearer eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJzdWIiOiIxMjM0NTY3ODkwIiwibmFtZSI6IkpvaG4gRG9lIiwiYWRtaW4iOnRydWV9.TJVA95OrM7E2cBab30RMHrHDcEfxjoYZgeFONFh7HgQ
